Balance & mobility symptom reports

Male, 26 - 39 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
26 2021-01-03 dizziness Patient was anxious when arrived. After receiving the vaccine, felt light headed and revealed he has... Read more
Close
Patient was anxious when arrived. After receiving the vaccine, felt light headed and revealed he has "spells" of anxiety similar to current experience. Became diaphoretic and needed to lie down.
26 2021-01-03 joint stiffness, injected limb mobility decreased I received the shot around 0730 on 12/30/2020. Went home and got ready for work. Around 12am 12/31/2... Read more
Close
I received the shot around 0730 on 12/30/2020. Went home and got ready for work. Around 12am 12/31/2020 my arm started to radiate at the injection site and was very tense. I placed a heat pack on the right harm but the pain did not dissipate. My arm continued to be in pain for the rest of the night. Around 0240 I ate dinner, had water and still had some arm pain. Around 0345 my arm started to flare up and sent pain sensations throughout my body. My right arm was increasingly discomforting, I could barely move it. The sensations spread to my legs, numbing them and my throat had felt as if it were closing up. I got up to get the attention of the nurse and was able to flag her down. She said I was pale as a ghost. My vision was very blurry, I could not hear anything because my ears had filled up and everything was muffled. My head had begun to ring and I was on the brink of fainting when a chair was given to me. My eyes had become extremely sensitive to the light, I was given water and spoken to about what had happened leading up to the event. I was greeted by the paramedics who drew my blood, placed an IV and transferred me to the Acute Care portion of the Emergency Department. My vitals were 76/49, 80/50, 90/56, 100/60 before being brought to the ER. On 1/1/2021 My thighs have been sore/tense, my knees and ankles have been stiff and just feeling sickly. On 1/2/2021 much of the same symptoms are present. The soreness in the muscles isn't as prevalent, however joints still are stiff On 1/3/2021, congestion and runny nose are still present, stiffness in ankles and now shins are prevalent.
26 2021-01-04 dizziness Developed slight nausea about 10 minutes after vaccine administered. Started having sensitivity to l... Read more
Close
Developed slight nausea about 10 minutes after vaccine administered. Started having sensitivity to light, lightheaded, dizzy, sweaty/clammy then dry heaves.
26 2021-01-05 dizziness 11:09 Pt was vaccinated with Moderna vaccine by other RN 11:10 pt honks horn to inform staff that he... Read more
Close
11:09 Pt was vaccinated with Moderna vaccine by other RN 11:10 pt honks horn to inform staff that he us feeling unwell 11:12 Nurses to scene with epi kit, EMS called over to pt car, pt pale and diaphoretic. states blurry vision, dizziness and thinks this could be his anxiety 11:15 Pt given juice and crackers. Pt states history of hypertension, anxiety, and that he has recently started a low car diet 11.17 EMS monitor displays HR 50, b/p 216/193, o2 99, blood sugar 109 11:20 HR 40, Tele displays SB 11:26 EKG 12 Lead done also displays SB 11:29 HR 66 B/P 176/157 11:31 Pt was educated to avoid 2nd dose of Moderna and concern expressed to him regarding driving and feeling faint. Pt refused EMS transport to thee hospital, states he will be waiting in his car for a moment, and signed release form.
26 2021-01-06 dizziness At 4:00pm the patient became anxious immediately after receiving the COVID-19 Moderna vaccine and af... Read more
Close
At 4:00pm the patient became anxious immediately after receiving the COVID-19 Moderna vaccine and after a minute of being observed he complained of sweats, feeling feverish, light headedness, muffled hearing. seeing spots and sudden urge to urinate. Blood pressure was 132/80 at time of event. Immediately he was given Gatorade and water and visibly became less diaphoretic and anxious after five minutes. By 4:20 pm the patient stated he was feeling "back to normal" and was assessed by a physician and was released after 30 minute of observation.
26 2021-01-07 dizziness I woke up around 3 am because of body aches. The body aches worsened and i checked and had a fever o... Read more
Close
I woke up around 3 am because of body aches. The body aches worsened and i checked and had a fever of 100.6 degrees Fahrenheit. My head started to pound and my pulse was accelerated to probably 80 bpm (normally rest at 60 bpm). I felt a little lightheaded and a bit nauseas. I took 2 200 mg tablets of EC ibuprofen and did not take Tylenol because i knew my immune response needed to take its course. it is about 3:33 in the afternoon and my body is still aching but my fever has dissipated and I still have a headache that throbs when I walk.
26 2021-01-08 dizziness Dizziness tongue numb Narrative: felt like tongue was numb, felt a little off, lightheaded, resolv... Read more
Close
Dizziness tongue numb Narrative: felt like tongue was numb, felt a little off, lightheaded, resolved
26 2021-01-08 injected limb mobility decreased Extreme pain in upper left arm where vaccine was given. Can barely move left arm. Has been 24 hours ... Read more
Close
Extreme pain in upper left arm where vaccine was given. Can barely move left arm. Has been 24 hours and still extremely painful.
26 2021-01-12 dizziness Adverse Events: Dizzyness, fever, GI upset, shortness of breath and weakness. Treatment: Tylanol and... Read more
Close
Adverse Events: Dizzyness, fever, GI upset, shortness of breath and weakness. Treatment: Tylanol and rest Outcome: Not much improvement.
26 2021-01-13 dizziness Approximately, 25 minutes after vaccine administration the patient verbalized feeling dizzy. He was ... Read more
Close
Approximately, 25 minutes after vaccine administration the patient verbalized feeling dizzy. He was transferred from a chair to a nearby cot with feet elevated. The ER was notified and an EpiPen was on standby. Vital signs were: BP 155/69, O2 saturation 100%, and HR 125. Vitals were rechecked 5 min later and HR came down to 76. Dizziness still persisted and he complained of his hands feeling weak but grip strength was noted to be equal bilaterally. There was no indication for EpiPen so it was not used. Patient preference was to be transported to the ER for additional follow-up. In the ER vital signs continued to be monitored and patient was given 1 liter sodium chloride 0.9% fluid bolus after which the patient reported feeling much better. Patient was discharged from the ER.
26 2021-01-14 dizziness Sweating to drench his shirt. Achy. Cough. Dizzy. Tired. He went to a walk-in clinic. Had chills. ... Read more
Close
Sweating to drench his shirt. Achy. Cough. Dizzy. Tired. He went to a walk-in clinic. Had chills. They are testing him for COVID. Has been sick for 2 days.
26 2021-01-14 dizziness Client complained of dizziness.
26 2021-01-17 dizziness fever of 102.8 body aches, fatigue and dizziness on Friday evening 1/15 and 1/16 Saturday. Sunday 1... Read more
Close
fever of 102.8 body aches, fatigue and dizziness on Friday evening 1/15 and 1/16 Saturday. Sunday 1/17 with low grade temp of 100.3 and fatigue.
26 2021-01-17 joint stiffness Approximately 6 hours after the injection at 6 pm I began to experience right sided ankle pain and s... Read more
Close
Approximately 6 hours after the injection at 6 pm I began to experience right sided ankle pain and swelling and mild chills. The pain peaked about 2 hours later about a 5/10 and was constant. I took 200 mg of Ibuprofen and elevated my foot. The right ankle was visibly swollen and red compared to the left. Prior to going to bed the pain had mostly resolved. Upon waking up in the morning the pain had entirely resolved. There was some residual stiffness that resolved throughout the course of the day.
26 2021-01-21 dizziness The next day after receiving the COVID vaccine, patient woke up about 11:30 with 101.o temperature, ... Read more
Close
The next day after receiving the COVID vaccine, patient woke up about 11:30 with 101.o temperature, vomiting, dizziness, ringing in ears, headache and soreness at injection site. All symptoms except arm soreness resolved in about 1 hour. Pt experienced fatigue for the remainder of the day.
26 2021-01-24 mobility decreased I developed a sore arm a few hours after administration. The soreness was at its worst the following... Read more
Close
I developed a sore arm a few hours after administration. The soreness was at its worst the following morning when I woke up; I was barely able to lift my arm above my shoulder. It took about 2-3 days for the soreness to completely go away.
26 2021-01-25 dizziness Pt received his vaccine at 10:35 am and stated that at 11:46 he felt weak and light headed. Pt was c... Read more
Close
Pt received his vaccine at 10:35 am and stated that at 11:46 he felt weak and light headed. Pt was clammy and pale his BP was 98/62. Pt states that he did not eat or drink anything prior to his vaccine today. 2 Orange juices given to the pt. Pt states at 10:50 that the orange juice made his head clearer and he no longer felt weak or shaky. Pt no longer looked pale or clammy.
26 2021-01-27 dizziness Starting when I woke up at 0600 AM on 1/26/2021, I felt light-headed and had a headache and full bod... Read more
Close
Starting when I woke up at 0600 AM on 1/26/2021, I felt light-headed and had a headache and full body ache all day. It finally subsided at approximately midnight on the morning of 1/27/2021.
26 2021-01-30 dizziness Dizzy, lightheaded. Laid pt on cot and hydrated pt with H20.
26 2021-02-01 dizziness, fall 8 min after receiving the vaccination, client was sitting in waiting area. States after he sat down,... Read more
Close
8 min after receiving the vaccination, client was sitting in waiting area. States after he sat down, he thought about being glad the shot was over. He began to get dizzy and blacked out. Fell out of chair. Unconscious for approx. 15 sec. EMS on site and attended to him. States he did not eat today. Had some snacks, but planned to eat after shot. Admits to being nervous prior to shot. Mother was present. States he has never passed out after vaccines or medical treatment. Mother believes that this was a reaction to the vaccine. Ambulance was called, however, family refused further tx. Client received ice for back of head which hit the floor when he fell out of the chair. Client left after being released from paramedics. Client was taken home by family.
26 2021-02-23 gait inability Pt recived his second Moderna vaccine 2/15/21, and on 2/16, staff at pt's group home noted pt was un... Read more
Close
Pt recived his second Moderna vaccine 2/15/21, and on 2/16, staff at pt's group home noted pt was unable to walk although pt previously ambulatory (could go on long hikes prior to acute illness). Pt was grabbing his legs and rubbing them, and initially staff thought it was pain that would resolve. However, on 2/22, lower extremity edema was noted, and pt without improving symptoms, so he was brought to the hospital for evaluation and treatment. GBS suspected, IVIG initiated.
26 2021-02-25 dizziness Lightheadedness upon standing after 30 minutes in post vaccination area. Placed in supine position x... Read more
Close
Lightheadedness upon standing after 30 minutes in post vaccination area. Placed in supine position x 10 minutes. Rechecked vital signs x 4; Vital signs stable, no acute distress. Cold pak applied to back of neck, gave water and powerade. Felt better. Released at 3:34pm
26 2021-02-28 dizziness Patient c/o headrush within 5minutes post vaccine, no acute distress notes, patient was diaphoretic ... Read more
Close
Patient c/o headrush within 5minutes post vaccine, no acute distress notes, patient was diaphoretic with clammy skin and had warm sensation feeling. after 2 minutes of siting and given water, patient stated he feels better. V/S obtained and within normal range.
26 2021-03-04 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Flushed ... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Mild, Additional Details: pt was walking out and collapsed on the floor, pt regained consciousness after couple seconds, pt is alert and responsive, and he thinks he just got up too fast, pharmacy gave pt water and he was okay after sitting and resting
26 2021-03-04 gait inability, gait disturbance could no longer walk and could only crawl, just drags his feet; gets tired very quickly; seemed drun... Read more
Close
could no longer walk and could only crawl, just drags his feet; gets tired very quickly; seemed drunk and his feet from the knee down weren't working; A spontaneous report was received from consumer concerning a 26-year-old, male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and seemed drunk and his feet from the knee down, he could no longer walk and could only crawl, just drags his feet and was also getting tired very quickly. The patient's medical history included aphasia. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included diazepam, duwalpro and another, unspecified over-the-counter product. On 15-FEB-2021, prior to the onset of the event, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot unknown) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. That same day, according to report, the patient seemed drunk and his feet from the knee down were not working. On 16-FEB-2021, the patient was unable to walk and could only crawl; he was just dragging his feet. He was also getting tired very quickly. Treatment for the event included paracetamol and ibuprofen. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the events, therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the events was not applicable. The outcome of the events, seemed drunk and his feet from the knee down, he could no longer walk and could only crawl, just drags his feet and was also getting tired very quickly, was considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the information provided which includes a strong temporal association, a causal association between the reported events and the administration of the mRNA-1273 cannot be excluded. Fatigue is consistent with the known safety profile of the vaccine.
26 2021-03-08 fall During sleep, pt's arm was hurting. He got up to use the bathroom. His spouse said he collapsed ne... Read more
Close
During sleep, pt's arm was hurting. He got up to use the bathroom. His spouse said he collapsed next to the bed and started convulsing. Spouse said she called 911. Convulsing lasted until EMT's arrived. When pt awoke, he was in the ambulance and was vomiting. Taken to ER at Hospital. Given muscle relaxors and zofran for emesis. Was also given fluids. When fluids were complete, he was released to home.
26 2021-03-09 dizziness lightheaded, vasovagal no loss of consciousness. Supine, legs elevated. Resolved
26 2021-03-13 dizziness Patient described feeling light-headed after receiving vaccination; pt was given a bottle of water; ... Read more
Close
Patient described feeling light-headed after receiving vaccination; pt was given a bottle of water; after consuming some water patient appeared to faint, spit-up, began seizing and bit his tongue. After the event resolved the patient commented, "I looked at the needle" (suggesting the cause of the event was his phobia of needles, and not the vaccine itself).
26 2021-03-18 dizziness Light headedness, head ache, sore arm, body sweats then chills,
26 2021-03-19 dizziness Site: Itching at Injection Site-Mild, Site: Redness at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Allergic: Diff... Read more
Close
Site: Itching at Injection Site-Mild, Site: Redness at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Allergic: Difficulty Breathing-Mild, Systemic: Allergic: Difficulty Swallowing, Throat Tightness-Medium, Systemic: Body Aches Generalized-Mild, Systemic: Confusion-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadedness-Severe, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Nausea-Severe, Systemic: Numbness (specify: facial area, extremities)-Medium, Systemic: Tinnitus-Mild, Systemic: Vomiting-Medium, Additional Details: Patient was attended to by RPH, Nurse, then we had EMS called. Patient was transported by EMS Form required to provide observation of injection site. That was not done, band aid applied.
26 2021-03-23 gait disturbance depression; felt weird; Felt disoriented; could not walk without a cane; joint pain; A spontaneous r... Read more
Close
depression; felt weird; Felt disoriented; could not walk without a cane; joint pain; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 26-years-old, male patient who experienced joint pain, depression, could not walk without cane, "I felt disoriented" and "I felt weird". The patient's medical history was not provided. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included topiramate, lithium, ziprasidone hydrochloride, escitalopram oxalate, lisdexamfetamine mesilate, clarithromycin, mometasone furoate, probiotic, vitamin D and multivitamin. On 05 Mar 2021, approximately two days prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 lot number 040A21A intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 07 Mar 2021, the patient reported feeling weird, disoriented and having joint pain. Two days later he could not walk without a cane. The patient reported being hospitalized for depression from unknown date until 11 Mar 2021. Treatment for the event included gabapentin. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The events joint pain, depression, could not walk without cane, "I felt disoriented" and "I felt weird" were considered recovered on 14 Mar 2021.; Reporter's Comments: Very limited information regarding this event/s has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
26 2021-03-25 dizziness Patient is a 26 y.o. male who received the Moderna Covid-19 Vaccine, mRNA-1273 (PF) 100 mcg/0.5 mL I... Read more
Close
Patient is a 26 y.o. male who received the Moderna Covid-19 Vaccine, mRNA-1273 (PF) 100 mcg/0.5 mL IM Susp, Lot 003B21A on 3/26/2021. The patient experienced the following reaction(s) during the immediate of observation: 1:00pm Patient c/o dizziness during observation period. Patient was treated/managed as follows: 1:00pm Patient taken to treatment area to lay down. VS BP 115/82, HR 56, RR 18, O2 sat 99% on room air. Patient reports "feeling better." Patient given educational material regarding vaccine and advised to continue to self-monitor per the CDC guidance. 1:15pm Patient escorted to door by RN
26 2021-03-25 dizziness dizziness seen and cleared by EMS
26 2021-03-28 dizziness Systemic: Confusion-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Visual Changes/Dis... Read more
Close
Systemic: Confusion-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Visual Changes/Disturbances-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Additional Details: While sitting in waiting area after vaccine: client became weak, and walked towards assistance saying he did not feel well and could not see well. Responded yes to question about sensation in the lips, tounge or throat so 1 epipen was administered. He reported feeling better within 1-2 mnutes. He sat for observation for 30 more minutes and left asymtomatic.
26 2021-03-28 dizziness I received the shot and was told to sit in a chair and wait for 15 minutes. After about 5-10 minutes... Read more
Close
I received the shot and was told to sit in a chair and wait for 15 minutes. After about 5-10 minutes I began to feel faint/lightheaded/clammy. I do have a history of these from shots I have had in the past. I got the pharmacists attention and told her I was feeling faint and asked for some water. Once she left, breathing in my throat felt significantly constricted. I had a reaction to clear my throat a few times but that didn't not affect anything. The pharmacist came back with water and an ice pack that she held against my neck. During this episode I was able to drink water still. The severity of the breathing issue leveled off and eventually I was able to breathe normally again. The whole thing lasted 1-2 minutes. It felt longer thinking back on it but I don't think it lasted as long as my impression of the episode. After that I felt tingling followed by shakiness in my extremities which was more typical of the fainting side effects ive had in the past. I've never experienced breathing issues with other shots I've received in the past. The pharmacist kept me there to monitor me for 30-45 minutes. No additional medication was administered
26 2021-03-29 fall Patient seen slumped over by staff, Had syncopal episode Appeared diaphoretic, and fatigued Blood ... Read more
Close
Patient seen slumped over by staff, Had syncopal episode Appeared diaphoretic, and fatigued Blood pressure and heart rate low Patient had emesis Ambulance called for medical transport to hospital
26 2021-04-01 dizziness Patient fainted after the Shot and regained consciousness .He complained about dizziness and nause... Read more
Close
Patient fainted after the Shot and regained consciousness .He complained about dizziness and nausea. 911 was called. He was advised to sit and be observed until they arrived
26 2021-04-02 dizziness Shortly after injection, pt developed dizziness/near syncope. He was noted to be very pale and was r... Read more
Close
Shortly after injection, pt developed dizziness/near syncope. He was noted to be very pale and was reclined in his chair. He improved after appx. 5 minutes and symptoms resolved. BP 110/80, HR 72, 99%. No signs to suggest anaphylaxis. He felt completely back to normal when he drove home. Symptoms likely consistent with vasovagal response from injection. Pt notes he did not eat much during the day
26 2021-04-07 dizziness patient reported feeling dizzy and faint 5 minutes after vaccine while sitting donw. water was offer... Read more
Close
patient reported feeling dizzy and faint 5 minutes after vaccine while sitting donw. water was offered. 3 minutes later, patient was still feeling dizzy and requested to lie down. upon helping patient to a place to lie down, they fainted in the store. paramedics were called and personnel stayed with patient until paramedics arrived
26 2021-04-07 dizziness Patient felt nauseous and lightheaded. He felt very warm and was pale. Patient was given cool cloths... Read more
Close
Patient felt nauseous and lightheaded. He felt very warm and was pale. Patient was given cool cloths and an ice pack to cool him down. Patient was monitored and felt better shortly after.
26 2021-04-07 fall, dizziness Written by Doctor: April 7, 2021 2:09 p.m. DOB 2/07/1995, male, received his second dose of Moderna ... Read more
Close
Written by Doctor: April 7, 2021 2:09 p.m. DOB 2/07/1995, male, received his second dose of Moderna Vaccine (Lot 019B21A) at 1:13 p.m. He stood up and walked to the usher?s table to have his vaccine card completed. Approximately one minute after receiving his vaccine, he had a syncopal episode falling directly backwards striking his head on the floor. I, MD did not directly witness the fall, but everyone who witnessed the fall said that he fell completely unimpeded to the floor. I was notified and immediately assisted the patient who was with his girlfriend. Patient initially appeared ?out?, but almost immediately opened his eyes and asked what happened. His skin was cool and clammy. A pulse oximeter was placed on his finger registering 98% o2 and a pulse of 53. I kept him lying on the floor until he was completely awake and aware of his surroundings. At the time he said his neck was not sore, but his head was sore. Approximately 2-3 minutes later, we were able to assist him in standing to immediately sit down in a wheelchair. He was taken to the cot in the hallway just outside the Medical Observation where I was able to help him to stand and then lie down. An icepack was provided to put on the back of his head, he was provided water, Gatorade, and two cookies. Patient said that he hadn?t eaten all day and had been feeling slightly hungry prior to his vaccination. I had patient move all extremities and asked his questions to verify that he was full awake and oriented to person, place, and time. Patient girlfriend stayed with patient while he ate his cookies. I addressed my concerns about patient striking his head on the floor and the possibility of a closed head injury. Girlfriend felt that patient was now completely back to his normal state of mind. I had patient remain lying down for 20 minutes. When I returned to check on him, he was sitting up and wanted to leave. I told him that he needed to be able to walk up and down the hallway before I would feel comfortable letting him leave. He stood up and walked halfway down the hallway before saying he was lightheaded. I immediately went to him to lead him back to the cot, but he insisted that he needed to use the bathroom to urinate. Both girlfriend and I stood in the doorway to assist patient if he needed, but he was able to finish urinating, then returned and sat in the wheelchair. I spoke to both Doctors via a phone call and had spoken to someone earlier. After letting them know that patient did not want an ambulance called, but I was going to strongly recommend he go to the nearest ER before returning home, I returned to the patient. Vital signs at 1:53 were Pulse Ox of 98%, pulse 78, and blood pressure sitting of 140/75. Again, I strongly recommended that girlfriend drive him to an ED for an evaluation and possible cat scan. Patient also now had some paracervical neck pain which I also said should be evaluated. Patient and girlfriend both insisted they didn?t want an ambulance called and girlfriend felt comfortable taking patient out of the clinic. Patient said he was hungry, and they were going to get food first. Girlfriend gave me her phone number (xxx)xxx-xxxx and I gave her my phone number (xxx-xxx-xxxx). I told her I was going to call her every hour to check on patient and told her to call me at any time. I recommended acetaminophen for the headache and other vaccine symptoms but no ibuprofen because of the possible head injury. I recommended to immediately call an ambulance or go to an ED for nausea, worsening headache, confusion, or drowsiness. Girlfriend is not to let patient sleep longer than 30 minutes at a time. Patient was able to walk out of the clinic easily under his own power without any assistance. He stated he was feeling much better.

26 2021-04-12 dizziness Patient noted on form that he had a severe reaction to peanuts which causes him to have anaphylaxis.... Read more
Close
Patient noted on form that he had a severe reaction to peanuts which causes him to have anaphylaxis. He stated that he does carry an EpiPen and any time anything with peanuts touches his mouth/lips he immediately notices his throat starting to close. He also is allergic to cats. Before administering the vaccine, the patient noted that he does not like needles and was not going to look. I administered the vaccine and the patient and I exited the vaccination room. I explained that he should sit in the waiting area for about 30 minutes due to his severe allergic reaction in the past. By the time that I walked back into the pharmacy, the patient's wife shouted "He's not breathing!". My technicians called 911 while I grabbed an EpiPen and rushed to the patient. I immediately administered a 0.3 mg dose of epinephrine and observed that the patient had passed out, was not breathing, but had a pulse. A few seconds later he regained consciousness and his breathing was erratic. I gave him water and he stated that he felt very lightheaded and dizzy. I instructed him to remain seated. He also noted that his vision was blurry and he saw a black dot. His wife was fanning him to cool him down while I tried to obtain the patient's blood pressure, but could not get a reading. The paramedics came and evaluated him thoroughly. His blood pressure, heart rate, EKG, and blood sugar were all within normal limits. They determined that the syncope was most likely due to the patient not eating during the day and not liking needles. The patient was feeling much better and declined further medical treatment, including going to the hospital. He was instructed to go home and relax.

Patient said he "felt much better" and B/P was repeated B/P 139/71 HR 62 at 2:23PM . 3/31/21 26YM admit with Acute issue: myocarditis, chest pain, extreme fatigue, body aches, SOB; Moderna (first dose on 3/28). No known prior COVID. Patient admits that approximately a month and a half ago, he was drinking a significant amount of alcohol with a 24-pack of beer daily and 5 drinks at night. He quit this approximately 2 weeks ago when he got back together with his girlfriend. He has had stress in his life with the death of a cousin approximately 2 weeks ago. The patient had been feeling well over the last week or so and received the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 3/28 Sunday. This was his first dose. Approximately an hour and a half after receiving the vaccine, he had symptoms of feeling dizzy with position change. He went home from work. He developed fevers, chills, rigors, diaphoresis, and headaches. He slept a lot due to these symptoms. On 3/30 Tuesday, he woke with mild chest discomfort that he described as a pressure sensation in his anterior chest. He states that it was bothersome, but not too significant. He woke up 3/31 at approximately 0200 hours with a stabbing left anterior chest discomfort. He notes that it felt like a hot knife stabbing him. He admits that over the last couple of days, he had a cough when he would lay back in bed. He admits to feeling more short of breath when flat and feeling like he had to put pillows behind his head. He came to the emergency department due to these symptoms. He was given a dose of acetaminophen and promptly had nausea and vomiting. He received a dose of aspirin 325 mg and states that his symptoms resolved shortly after that. 3/31 He now feels well and denies any further chest discomfort. He denies any dyspnea.

26 2021-06-26 dizziness 4 weeks following 2nd Moderna Vaccine, I started having symptomatic Bigeminal PVC's that lasted appr... Read more
Close
4 weeks following 2nd Moderna Vaccine, I started having symptomatic Bigeminal PVC's that lasted approximately 45 minutes. Symptoms included dizziness, near syncope, palpitations, and shortness of breath. After 2 ED visits, I was referred to a cardiologist who ran tests to include a Holter monitor, and echocardiogram. I followed up with a Cardiac Electrophysiology Doctor who prescribed Flecainide to control the PVC's. I have been on Flecainide since early March, which has controlled the PVC's to a tolerable level (roughly 100/day). Before the Flecainide use, I was having roughly 1,000 PVC's a day, and had multiple episodes of Bigeminy.
26 2021-06-30 fall Following administration of the vaccine, the patient and his wife were seated and I requested they r... Read more
Close
Following administration of the vaccine, the patient and his wife were seated and I requested they remain seated for 15 min after because I had recently had someone with a fear of needles collapse after their shot, at which point I had already counseled on the things to expect afterward but the patient stopped responding and slumped over. I was unsure if he was breathing as his wife was cradling his head, so I shouted for a technician to call 911. I heard a sound that I perceived to be wheezing and administered an epipen at which point the patients limbs began to contract so I then suspected it was a seizure. We lowered the patient to the ground and shortly after he became responsive. He was able to state his name and date of birth and breathing was unlabored. Pulse ox was 98 and HR was 88 BPM before EMS arrived. They examined the patient and determined it was "anxiety induced response" but also noted that the bloodpressure was "very low" which is consistent with anaphylaxis, but I did not examine the patient at that time. He was sent home afterward.

26 2021-07-13 dizziness Pt is a 26 yo M w/ a PMH of COVID 19 infection (resolved), seasonal allergies, and head trauma (2019... Read more
Close
Pt is a 26 yo M w/ a PMH of COVID 19 infection (resolved), seasonal allergies, and head trauma (2019). He arrived at Facility on 6/15/21. On 7/8/21, pt had his tooth extracted (#30) at 0930 without complication. At 1200 same day, he received the first dose of the COVID-19 Moderna vaccine. At 1323, the pt was found lying on couch in dorm c/o pain in dental area, dizziness, and lightheadedness (BP 150/77, HR 91, RR 18, O2sat 99%). Heart sounds normal, breath sounds absent on auscultation. Pt was confused and in distress. (unable to respond verbally). His eyes were red and tearing. Tongue and lips appeared red and were mildly swollen. RN was unable to visualize throat in dorm. Epipen was administered at 1340 which resulted in an immediate decrease in symptoms. Pt was calmer and in less distress. Normal uvula with some narrowing of airway noted. He was then taken to clinic and was calm but shaking with an open airway and mild swelling noted; VS wnl. He left via EMS in stable condition to ED at 1400 for evaluation. Pt returned from ED same day in no acute distress but still c/o dental pain (5/10). He was last evaluated by provider on 7/9/21 and is asymptomatic. Denies swelling, SOB, or fatigue. No bleeding or swelling at dental extraction site noted. Pt evaluated by dental on 7/12/21. No swelling, erythema, exposed bone, or signs of infection noted. Area appears to be following normal post-operative course. Pt remains asymptomatic. ED summary- Medical Center (7/8/21): Pt sent to ED for allergic reaction/near-fainting (vagal reaction); Assessment: ?Most likely the syncopal episode was due to vasovagal syncope. Cannot rule out allergic reaction to the COVID 19 vaccination?. Drug screen negative. Discharged on 7/8/21.

Patient experience a brief moment lightheadedness while waiting in the waiting area after the shot was administered. He appeared to faint briefly dropping his phone, and almost immediately regained coherence. Patient sad he felt fine. 2 or 3 minutes later he asked for a cup of water. He appeared pale at the time but a few minutes later looked normal. He was anxious about the vaccine. We were about to call the ambulance and he refused to let us saying he was fine. He expressed that he didn't want any medical attention. He also reported after the event, that he hadn't slept the night before or eaten anything that day. We would not let him drive himself home. He had his brother pick him up. We explained what had happened, and will follow up with him to see how the patient is.

27 2021-02-12 balance disorder Had no symptoms prior to injection. After injection, quickly developed moderate pain at injection si... Read more
Close
Had no symptoms prior to injection. After injection, quickly developed moderate pain at injection site that eventually became severe. Over the rest of the day, developed a severe headache, severe muscle aches (not just at injection site), severe fatigue, fever of 100.6F, moderate joint aches (not just in arm, but all over body - neck is worst), and general weakness (I almost fell walking to the bathroom and I'm in decently good shape). Toward the evening, I started struggling with thermal homeostasis - I was simultaneously sweating and shivering. The combination of these was severe enough that I had extreme difficulty sleeping last night and woke up at least once an hour, getting <6 hours of sleep after lying in bed for almost 12 hours. Right now (23h post vaccination), the pain at the injection site has gotten significantly less bad, but I still have a splitting headache, fever of 100.3F, moderate fatigue/weakness, and mild muscle/joint pains across my whole body. I'm unsure how much the headache this morning is from sleep deprivation. At no point did I lose sense of smell or taste, have a sore throat, cough, runny nose/nasal congestion, or shortness of breath.
27 2021-02-17 injected limb mobility decreased Approximately two hours after injection, slight discomfort and soreness about 2 inches in radius bel... Read more
Close
Approximately two hours after injection, slight discomfort and soreness about 2 inches in radius below the the injection site, but not at the point of contact. Movement of the upper arm produced some levels of pain, but nothing noteworthy. It was uncomfortable to sleep on, though, so that was avoided. Lower arm unaffected. The following morning, the pain was immediately noticeable and made using the arm a severely difficult task. It was painful to move the forearm above stomach level, and essentially impossible to do any sort of heavy lifting with it. Pain relieving medication such as aspirin and ibuprofen helped in a minimal capacity, and was ultimately irrelevant in the healing process. These symptoms lasted the entirety of the day after the injection and most of the following day as well, subsiding mostly in the evening. Today (Thursday, third full day after), all pain and soreness/dullness are entirely gone. The second full day was easily the most intense in terms of pain.

27 2021-03-04 fall Patient was given a covid vaccine on 3/4/21 at approximately 5:40pm. The administration went well a... Read more
Close
Patient was given a covid vaccine on 3/4/21 at approximately 5:40pm. The administration went well according to the patient. After approximately 10 minutes, while the patient was sitting in the post vaccination area, he appeared to be pale looking to the imx RPh. The pharmacist asked him how he was doing, he replied "I am doing so-so". The RPh got up to check on him further when the patient fell to the floor. The RPh rolled him on his back, got him in a comfortable position, and elevated his legs. RPh applied gauze to a cut in his lip, and with the immediate assistance of the health screener, applied cold compress to his neck and forehead. Patient experienced faintness and sweaty skin only. Patient did not show any other symptoms. After about15 minutes, patient said he felt like himself again, and wanted to sit up in a chair. The RPh assisted him into a chair, where he sat for 5 minutes. At the request of the patient, he wanted to go home. RPh escorted patient to his car and watched him get inside safely. 1 hour later, RPh followed up with a phone call to the patient and he was on his way to an urgent care clinic to get a possible stitch for his lip.

Close
Adverse events were more applicable in the second dose of this vaccination. At 22:00 a low-grade fever began. At 03:30 on 3/3 a fever of 102 degrees had been achieved. Left axillary lymph node swelled. Generalized body aches mostly in wrists and ankles occurred. For the duration of 3/3 102 fevers persisted while taking Tylenol and slept for duration of day. On 3/4 low grade fevers of 100 degrees were maintained. Nausea and diarrhea occurred, aches continued throughout body particularly in shoulders. Lethargy so severe couldn't stay awake for more than 20 minutes. On 3/5 fevers reduced down to 99 degrees. Vertigo occurred with dizzy spells and ataxia. Heart rate periodically elevating to 120-140s for hour long durations. Only able to sleep for 2 hours at at time because of waking up from tachycardic episodes. Panic attacks ensued due to tachycardic episodes. On 3/6 psychotic thoughts and hallucinations began. First, racing thoughts about irrational an incontrollable events began. "Will I be able to father children?; I will sell my car tomorrow to sustain myself.; etc." Visions of insects crawling down a mountain side, flowers with eyeballs, etc. Panic so severe couldn't close eyes and mind always racing.

27 2021-04-06 fall Patient had no reaction at time of vaccination, got up out of chair and walked approx. 20 feet to si... Read more
Close
Patient had no reaction at time of vaccination, got up out of chair and walked approx. 20 feet to sit down in a chair with arms in the vaccine observation area at 1715. At 1722 patient fell out of chair and onto floor. PharmD started emergency chain including 911 call and call to patient's emergency contact. PharmD ran to patient and observed him lying facedown with head facing left. Eyes open but unresponsive, his name was called with no response. Right as he was observed to be breathing normally with a steady pulse, patient had mild seizure with jerking movements. He was turned to his side during seizure event lasting no longer that 2 minutes. Patient then regained consciousness and was kept on his side. Was alert and oriented. He knew where he was, who he was, what day it was. He was able to answer all 911 dispatcher questions relayed to him. Dispatcher advised he could sit up on floor, which he did. PharmD stayed right behind him until paramedics arrived. He was kept talking to stay alert. It was unknown if he hit his head on the initial fall. Paramedics arrived and checked BP/Pulse/EKG. Pt then had a gasp/shake attack that paramedic notated as a panic induced episode. He calmed and was transferred to ER

RN assessed- weak pulse, blurred vision. BP was stabalized at 110/797, hr 72, o2 sat 98%. 911 was notified because he hit his head. Pt was suggested for CT for head injury but signed himself AMA from the paramedics. Pt's said friend would take him to ER. Followed up next day- CT scan clear. Pt is fine.
27 2021-04-10 dizziness Patient waited the 15 minute waiting period sitting down and appeared fine. Patient began walking ar... Read more
Close
Patient waited the 15 minute waiting period sitting down and appeared fine. Patient began walking around the store with family members. Patient became dizzy/light-headed, had a numb arm, and began sweating. Patient was brought back to the pharmacy, where a machine took his BP as 207/107 with a pulse of 114. Patient stated he felt "like his heart was trying to get out of his chest". Patient had no significant medical history, and in fact had not had a vaccine in over a decade. Pharmacist directed patient and their family to the hospital/doctor due to hypertensive crisis BP, but suspected it was due to nerves/anxiety.

27 2021-04-11 fall PATIENT RECEIVED THE VACCINE AND APPEARED PERFECTLY FINE, NO COMPLAINTS OF PAIN AT INJECTION SITE, D... Read more
Close
PATIENT RECEIVED THE VACCINE AND APPEARED PERFECTLY FINE, NO COMPLAINTS OF PAIN AT INJECTION SITE, DIZZINESS, OR ANY OTHER ADVERSE EFFECT. PATIENT WAS ASKED TO REMAIN IN OBSERVATION AREA FOR STANDARD 15 MINUTES OBSERVATION. APPROXIMATELY 5-10 MINUTES AFTER RECEIVING VACCINE, PATIENT WAS LOOKING AT HIS PHONE AND SUDDENLY LOST CONSCIOUSNESS CAUSING HIM TO FALL OUT OF THE CHAIR HE WAS SITTING IN. HE WAS QUICKLY ASSESSED AND FOUND TO HAVE WOUND ON HIS FOREHEAD AND NOSE. HE DID NOT KNOW HOW HE GOT TO THE FLOOR. HE SIMPLY REMEMBERS "BEING ON TIK-TOK AND THEN BEING STARTLED THAT HE WAS AWOKEN ON THE FLOOR". PATIENT WAS CLEANED UP AND BANDAGED WHILE EMT WAS EN ROUTE. PATIENT WAS DISORIENTED AT FIRST, UNABLE TO EXPLAIN WHAT HAPPENED/HOW IT HAPPENED. AFTER 2-3 MINUTES HIS COGNITION CLEARED AND HE WAS ABLE TO SPEAK WITH THE PARAMEDICS WHO ARRIVED. THE PARAMEDICS RAN A ECG, BLOOD GLUCOSE TEST, AND COGNITION TEST. PATIENT WAS RELEASED UNDER HIS OWN POWER TO HIS SIGNIFICANT OTHER. HE WAS BEING TAKEN TO URGENT CARE AND BOTH HE AND HIS PARTNER WERE GIVEN INSTRUCTION ON WARNING SIGNS AND WHEN TO ALERT MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS.

He said he started to get light headed and we helped him to the ground.He was cold and clammy and he had no difficulty breathing. He stayed conscience. He sat with us for 1/2 hour , had some water. Said he felt better and then he left. He did not with us to call Paramedics. To the best of my knowledge he was recovered. He said he was recovered.

Close
It was reported by the safety officer that the guest complained about feeling faint and hot 10 minutes after receiving the vaccine. EMS was called to see guest. Guest became sweaty and was offered water, which he drank. Guest was conscious and talking to the EMS. Vital signs were WNL. After a few minutes the guest stated that he was feeling better and no longer felt hot. Patient was observed for an additional 15 minutes per the suggestion of EMS. After the 30 minutes, guest continued to be without symtoms and was able to stand up with out dizziness nor lightheadedness. Able to leave on his own.
27 2021-04-22 dizziness Pt presented to clinic Moderna vaccine administered at around 11:55 AM; pt. stated no prior history ... Read more
Close
Pt presented to clinic Moderna vaccine administered at around 11:55 AM; pt. stated no prior history of issues receiving vaccines. At around 12:03 PM pt. felt severely nauseous/lightheaded and attempted to stand and tell staff but immediately fainted, falling to the ground and hitting the front right side of his face on the ground. Pt. was unconscious for about 30-45 seconds. Pt. regained consciousness and able to verbalize name, DOB, location, etc. Vitals at the time taken include: BP 136/73 mmHg, O2 sat 94%, & HR 51 bpm. Called 911 and EMS arrived within about 5 mins. EMS arrived by 12:11 PM, vitals taken O2 Sat 100% & HR 68 bpm. Pt. refused transport to ED and insisted on driving himself home. Left on his own by 12:15 PM after being escorted by EMS to his car.

27 2021-04-23 dizziness Moderna COVID?19 Vaccine About 8 hours after receiving the second dose of Moderna, almost all of th... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID?19 Vaccine About 8 hours after receiving the second dose of Moderna, almost all of the side effects came in full force including headache, dizziness, fatigue, full body aches, injection site pain, chills, and elevated temperature. The peak severity lasted about 4-5 hours. It wasn't possible to sleep at all the night after the shot. After that 5 hour period, lingering side effects included headache, fatigue, and aches. About 22 hours after the shot, I decided to take some Tylenol to help get rid of the residual side effects. At 24 hours after the shot, it appears most effects have subsided but there is residual dizziness and some fatigue and weakness.

Close
Patient felt dizzy and warm while sitting in chair outside vaccination room, then fell to floor. HCPs immediately went to him, and he came to within seconds. Management stayed with patient while medic evaluated for possible hitting head on floor. No injuries known. Patient was able to leave on his own within 30 minutes.
27 2021-04-27 fall 1 minute after administration of vaccine, patient lost consciousness and fell from chair striking th... Read more
Close
1 minute after administration of vaccine, patient lost consciousness and fell from chair striking the right side of head on pavement. He was rolled from prone, assessed and had a pulse but initially was not breathing. 911 called Within 10 second, had spontaneous return of respirations, consciousness and was oriented to person, place, time. Sustained an abrasion to his head, complaints of mild HA, no neck pain or signs of cervical injury or other trauma. Vitals monitored. Given fluids, juice. Assessed by paramedics and refused transport to ED for further evaluation. Given ice and called a friend for a ride home. Observed for nearly 1 hour after LOC and had returned to baseline mentation. Advised to call 911 or go to ED if worsening of HA, vision changes, confusion, falls, nausea, vomiting due to concerns for head trauma. Assessment is that this was likely a vasovagal episode and patient reported similar experience with immunization in past, in retrospect. Discussed that this is not a contraindication for 2nd dose but that he should be sure he is well hydrated and advise healthcare providers of history of vasovagal with first dose. The county will work with him to schedule 2nd dose at a health clinic attended by EMS (on site).

Close
Within 90 seconds of receiving the vaccine the patient who was seated fell to the floor briefly unresponsive and hit his head on the floor. We checked pulse and had a strong regular pulse and breathing was normal, placed him in recovery position and called for EMS. He woke disoriented within another minute and was responsive to questions to pharmacy personnel for information to relay to EMS during the 911 phone call. Patient reported that he has had syncope and fainting with needles in the past, described blood draw. Fire first responders arrived checked his vitals. 100/64 Blood pressure, 99% O2, and 66 Heart rate were recorded. Then paramedics arrived and took pt to ambulance for monitoring before releasing.

27 2021-05-10 dizziness Client complained of dizziness, seeing double, and had ringing in his ears. He alerted the EMT at 17... Read more
Close
Client complained of dizziness, seeing double, and had ringing in his ears. He alerted the EMT at 1752. EMT supported the client in chair while other EMT grabbed zero gravity chair. RN came over to assess client. Client appeared pale and diaphoretic. He was alert and oriented x3. When he felt comfortable enough to stand, he was transitioned into the zero gravity chair. Vital signs were taken at 1802 (HR 70, O2 97%, Blood Pressure 106/66, RR 16). Client stated that he ate and drank water that day. He also stated "I fainted when my wife got her epidural." Vital signs taken at 1817 (HR 68, O2 98% blood pressure 110/58). Client was warm pink and dry. Client advised to seek medical care if symptoms worsen. At 1825 client stated "I feel better." He left at 1825 unassisted with a steady gait.

Close
Patient has history of passing out when getting blood drawn. As patient was standing to get vaccination card filled out, he told associate to call RPH that he wasn't feeling well. I ran out to give my attention and patient was sweating and looked dizzy. His eyes started to shut while he was standing and as I was holding his arm and back to support him he started to fall to the ground. Patient gently went to the ground, I pushed him over to one side and he was out for about 3 seconds and woke back up. Patient was very hot and sweaty. He wanted to move to a more private area so I made an area with a privacy panel available to him. Patient stated to me that he has no history of seizure, but suffers from mild anxiety. Myself or one of the associates was with him for approximately 45 minutes just to make sure he was ok. His blood pressure was taken (twice) and water was given. His BP readings were normal. Patient was on his way. Moderna series completed.

27 2021-05-13 dizziness I got the vaccine and the following morning I had the worst headache I have ever had. I felt like my... Read more
Close
I got the vaccine and the following morning I had the worst headache I have ever had. I felt like my head was going to explode, and I took ibuprofen and Tylenol. I also had a fever and excruciating pain at the injection site, this all went away within 3 days. On 05/07/2021 I woke up with a really bad headache and I was dizzy, I took ibuprofen and Tylenol and it seemed to be getting better. And finally on 05/11/2021 I woke up again with a headache and dizziness, this is the day I went to my primary care doctor and he told me that he has seen this pretty frequently with the moderna vaccine. He said that it was brain swelling and inflammation. He told me to take ibuprofen and Tylenol every 6 hours for a week and that if I was still experiencing these side effects then I can come back and he will prescribe me steroids. It has now been 3 days, and my head still hurts and doesn?t feel normal. He also told me that if I get tingling in my fingers or blurred vision to go to an emergency room right away.

Close
Patient had stated to technician that he was very afraid of needles and extremely nervous and that he thought there was a possibility he would pass out based on his previous experiences. Patient was ok after vaccination for about 15 second, then got very dizzy and light headed. He leaned over on the table and remained there for several minutes. I had a wheelchair brought over for him to sit in once he was confident in getting up. He felt more secure in the wheelchair than in the waiting chairs because those have no arms. He stayed in front of the pharmacy for about 30 mins while he recovered. He eventually felt good and wanted to stand and move around on his own. He decided to make a few laps around the store to be 100% sure that he was good before leaving. He assured me several times that he was feeling better.

Loss of sleep (approximately 2 hours of sleep obtained). Pain at injection site still present after 48 hours. Weakness in legs and arms and occasional dizziness for ~24 hours. Confusion related to fatigue for ~24 hours. General fatigue and loss in appetite still present after 48 hours.
27 2021-05-23 dizziness Woke up at 3:00 AM Friday 5/24 having chest pain near my heart and issues breathing. I sat up on the... Read more
Close
Woke up at 3:00 AM Friday 5/24 having chest pain near my heart and issues breathing. I sat up on the corner of my bed feeling dizzy. Every time I would take anything more than a light breath, I would get a tight pain on the left side of my chest, which specifically felt like I had blockage in my heart. As I sat on the corner of my bed I tried to control my breathing and started to rub the area as I was taking breaths. The sharp pain in my chest while taking normal / deep breaths lasted for a few minutes and I feared I was having a heart attack. After going away initially that night, I felt the sensation in a less intense fashion again later on Friday night and once more got a slight tight feeling in my chest while breathing on Saturday. During the initial episode on Friday night, I also got a deafened noise in my ears as if they had to pop as if I was gaining altitude in a plane or something. I got up off my bed to go to the bathroom and sat to urinate in case I was going to faint. The deafened noise went away after about a minute or so and turned into a static / fizzy noise for another minute or two while I was in the bathroom. (The static fizz sounds got louder as I put my chin to my chest for some reason.) I was also sweating profusely throughout this entire process.
27 2021-05-25 mobility decreased The same day as the injection I experienced severe pain a few hours after in my bicep rather than my... Read more
Close
The same day as the injection I experienced severe pain a few hours after in my bicep rather than my shoulder where I experienced pain during the 1st vaccine dose. I also experienced the common fatigue. However, at 12:13a.m on May 25th, I was woken from sleeping to what can only be described as either the most severe case of the shakes that have ever been experienced, or convulsions. I was unable to move, speak, and could hardly breathe. The effects of this lasted well over an hour and a half. It was only after what I was experiencing stopped, that I suddenly became burning hot, but did not have a fever. 98.7° was what was read at the time I started to feel hot. Since then I have experienced severe joint and knuckle pain on my left hand, still bicep soreness, pain in my left forearm, again joint and knuckle pain in my left hand, and headaches.

HE WAS VISIBLY BREATHING AND SOUNDED LIKE HE WAS SNORING AND AFTER ABOUT 20-30 SECONDS HE WOKE UP AND SAID, "OH, DID I PASS OUT?" HE THEN EXPLAINED THAT THIS HAS HAPPENED TO HIM SEVERAL TIMES BEFORE, BUT NOT IN RECENT YEARS. HE HAD ANSWERED "NO" ON HIS QUESTIONNAIRE TO THE QUESTION ABOUT PREVIOUSLY FAINTING AFTER A VACCINE. HE SAT FOR A FEW MORE MINUTES, AND THEN LEFT STATING HE WAS FINE.

27 2021-06-01 dizziness, fall Patient received a vaccine and was told that he needed to stay in the store for 15 minutes. He went ... Read more
Close
Patient received a vaccine and was told that he needed to stay in the store for 15 minutes. He went to purchase a water about 5 minutes after vaccine in a different register and was feeling lightheaded. After the transaction he fainted with the back of his head fell on the hard floor. He was being assisted by the store staff as well as a pedestrian who claimed to be a health care professional. He was given an orange juice, one water and a battery powered fan to provide cool air. He also requested to lay down on the floor, and he ended up laying on the floor for about 30 minutes. After that he stood up and regained color on his face. He then walked out of the store. Staff asked him if he wanted the ambulance to be called and he declined. Pharmacist called patient the next day to check on patient, and was unable to reach the patient.

27 2021-06-06 dizziness 11:05- lightheaded, nausea, chills. Laid on the ground for probably an hour recovering. Once home, I... Read more
Close
11:05- lightheaded, nausea, chills. Laid on the ground for probably an hour recovering. Once home, I noticed my chest feel a deep sore, achey. I chalked it up to the side effects, until i went mountain biking and had to turn around after there was so much resistance and pressure in my chest. I'm glad I turned around when I did. It continued to be a deep constant pressure for over a week after the shot. Eventually the pressure subsided but I also didn't do any physical activities after the mountain biking experience. As i tld the Dr.s this same story they told me I should have gone to the emergency room... Of course I didn't know, so I went about my life just reducing physical activity. I went in for my second shot today and was informed of the new possible linkage between myocarditis and vaccines. What the Dr.'s described (I had two in the room this time because of the way I reacted to the first shot) was exactly what I felt after the first shot. If I was having the same symptoms, as recently discovered, but only after the first one, I wasn't going to try and find out if I would die from this second one or how much worse the inflammation would be. I will disclose, pertinent or not, that I am a small individual at 5'7, 120.

Close
The client has hx of anaphylaxis and was being monitored for 30 min post 2nd dose of the Moderna Covid-19. The client received the vaccine at 11:59 am via documented route. At 12:15 pm the client began looking up at the ceiling unable to move out of that position and stating he was having neck soreness, dizziness and a headache. Assessment revealed muscle tightness in the neck and shoulder area. Client denied chest pain, SOB, itching or swelling in the facial or throat area. The client was escorted by his . Stated he has a hx of schizophrenia and recently had his medication changed. He also stated he was in the ED the day before and was treated for dystonia related from the medication changes. This information was not given during the screening process by either the or client. The options were discussed with the client and he was transported to the ED by EMS at 12:30 pm. At the time of transfer, the client denied neck soreness and had increased ROM but continued to c/o dizziness and headache.

At around 26 minutes after the second vaccine was administered, patient started to have signs of an allergic reaction including dizziness, throat itchiness, and trouble breathing. 27 2021-07-17 fall I received the Moderna vaccine. The pharmacist administering commented on the odd response I had to ... Read more
Close
I received the Moderna vaccine. The pharmacist administering commented on the odd response I had to the shot in my arm and within 1 minute, I said, "I don't feel so good" and began to have my first seizure. I fell out of my chair and hit my head on one of the CVS shelves. My wife was with me and the pharmacist called 911. The nurse came from the back and propped my legs up as I laid on the floor. Within minutes, the fire department and EMS arrived. They took my blood pressure, blood sugar and vitals which all were normal. I then began to have another seizure in which the EMS team assisted. They loaded me onto a stretcher and took me to the hospital in an ambulance. This entire course of events occurred within approximately 6 minutes of receiving my first COVID-19 vaccine. At the hospital, I received a chest X-ray, EKG and blood and vitals tests which all were normal. They concluded that it was an unexplainable reaction to the vaccine. I have no history of seizures and am a healthy 27 year old male. I take no prescription drugs, walk daily, work out regularly, eat a healthy diet and drink a gallon of water a day. Since receiving the vaccine, I have soreness on my head from hitting it on the shelf and a bite mark on my tongue from the seizures. I have been sleeping 12+ hours a day for the last two days.

I took a warm shower, and had to sit on the ground and just let the warm water run. My knees were in so much pain I couldn?t stand. Close
Patient indicates he was feeling very anxious before receiving the shot. Reports that he is overall healthy but had a blood pressure reading of 133/86 at a wellness fair and had an appoint with a doctor to evaluate his blood pressure on 04/01/2021. Denies any known illnesses or health conditions. Reports that about one minute after receiving the vaccine he became very light-headed, dizzy and sweaty. Denies any SOB, throat swelling. The next thing the patient remembers is" waking up with a bunch of people looking at him. An ambulance on-site assessed the patient and felt he should be transported to a local emergency room to assess. The ambulance staff had blood pressure readings of 90/50 and 80/51 . The patient reports he felt "much better" after arriving to hospital. Indicates he was hydrated with fluids and had an EKG while in the ER. His blood pressure reading at the ER was 133/86. Patient reports that the ER doctor indicates that he most likely had a "Vaso vagal syncope episode.". The patient indicates that he did not receive any medications and was told to follow-up and keep his appt. on 04/01/2021 in regards to his high blood pressure. reading.

Close
Patient was given vaccination at the health Center. He was observed and waited for 15 minutes prior to leaving. Drove home. Close to his home, he began to feel lightheaded. However continued to try to make it home and passed out. Crashed car into a tree. Was taken to a local hospital where he had a head CT, hand Xray, CXR and "blood work." He was advised that all testing was normal and that he had a mild concussion. Evening of event, he had a mild headache. Day after the event, the only complaint was tenderness around the vaccine site. He has not had prior reactions to vaccines but states "I work construction and have noticed that I have had vasovagal symptoms with pain in the past."

Close
Pt received his second dose of Moderna at :10 am on 4-8-21. At approx 9:15 he started to feel weak and light headed, stating he felt like he was going to pass out. Asked if he could lay down. Took him into the counseling room, placed him on the floor and elevated his legs. We went to get him a cold water and an ice pak for his headache. Pt laid there for 5 more minutes then sat up and we gave him two sugar cookies. Pt gradually stood up to sit upright in a chair. He drank another cold water and we observed him for 30 more minutes. Approx 9:45 am Pt stated he was feeling much better and was ready to go home. He did have a driver with him whom walked him out to the car and got him to his residence. Upon 5:30 pm on 4-8-21 pt had not experienced anymore symptoms besides tiredness, He was counseled to go to the ER if he experience any other unusual occurences.
28 2021-04-07 dizziness Client received the COVID vaccine (Moderna, lot # 041AB21A) at 1005. Client reported dizziness, and ... Read more
Close
Client received the COVID vaccine (Moderna, lot # 041AB21A) at 1005. Client reported dizziness, and EMT, Nurse and Physician all responded at 1010. The client was sitting in his chair, head back with his eyes closed. The client stated that he was going to pass out and he appeared very pale and diaphoretic. The client was transferred to the reclining chair. At 1015, the client's vital signs were as follows: blood pressure of 110/68, heart rate of 78, respiratory rate of 16, and O2 99%. At 1020, the client stated he was "starting to feel better" and his vital signs were as follows: O2 99%, heart rate 59, and respiratory rate of 16. His color had improved to normal. The client refused benadryl. At 1025, the client's heart rate was 58, respiratory rate was 18, and O2 was 98. He stated he had no medical history, takes no medications, and has no allergies. At 1030, the client's blood pressure was 114/74. He was given a water which he started to drink. At 1040, the client's blood pressure was 112/70, with a heart rate of 57 abd O2 of 98%. The client stated his symptoms were completely resolved and he was able to stand without any return of dizziness. Education was provided regarding V-safe, emergency measure and activation, and primary care follow up. The client has no PCP so information was provided regarding. The client was escorted out to his car, ambulating with a steady gait, and he drove himself home.

28 2021-04-15 dizziness 3-29-21: moments after shot injection, anxiousness, and shakiness develop. Half hour after injection... Read more
Close
3-29-21: moments after shot injection, anxiousness, and shakiness develop. Half hour after injection, extreme anxiety, impending sense of doom, full body shakes, complete inability to focus, burning sensation on skin surface and chills develop (fluctuating between both), pressure at chest, sweaty palms. Admitted to ER @ in with blood pressure of ~180 and heart rate of ~100BPM. O2 levels 96%. Given Ativan. Anxiousness, blood pressure, heart rate, focusing improves. Occasional temperature sensations remain, as well as some difficulty focusing, and feelings of discomfort. Patient has no history of anxiety or issues with needles/previous vaccinations. 3-30-21: fatigue, trouble focusing, anxiousness. Sharp headache pain develops and is treated with Ibuprofen. 3-31-21: fatigue, trouble focusing, anxiousness. Headache has resolved. 4-1-21: fatigue, trouble focusing, anxiousness. In the evening, onset of dizziness attempting to walk. Itchy welts form on right and left hand at wrists. Rash forms on whole of torso front and back. Breathing is staggered. Patient takes 25mg of diphenhydramine and is admitted to ER @ in . Rashes/welts clear up ~30 minutes after. Anxiousness/focus improves as effects of diphenhydraminea are felt. Two EKGs and blood panel is performed, results are normal. 4-2-21: trouble focusing/anxiety, goes away quickly after taking 25 mg of diphenhydramine. Fatigue is present, cannot leave bed. 4-3-21: Nausea/stomach pain begins, and discomfort in upper left abdomen. Burning sensations/chills temperature sensations---feeling feverish but temperature is stable at 98.8F. Loss of appetite. Episodes of anxiety/focusing continue to be treated with 25 mg of diphenhydramine. Extreme fatigue. 4-4-21 through 4-7-21 : extreme fatigue, stomache pain and nausea. Patient has lost 9 lbs since 3-29-21. Pain around upper left abdomen consistent. Patient visits urgent care 4-7-21, is given 14-day course of omeprazole to help with nauseas/pain. COVID-19 rapid test is performed and returns negative. 4-8-21 trough 4-11-21: extreme fatigue, nausea, episodes of poor focus remain. Patient cannot leave bed, but ability to eat improves with omeprazole. 4-12-21 to present: short intermittent episodes of trouble focusing/anxiousness, aggravated by physical exertion and mental stimulation. Fatigue onset after hours of normal day to day activities.

He went into the ER stroke unit. Dr. called mother to let her know that if he didn't have emergency brain surgery he would die. Mother told him to save her son. He survived brain surgery and was put in the Neuro ICU. On 4/3 He was transferred to the Stroke Team floor. On 4/8 he was transferred to Rehabilitation Hospital. Last episode 10+ years ago. Pharmacy tech called as patient was re-seated next to mom. RPh arrived mid conversation as patient began losing consciousness again with right arm muscle contraction lasting roughly 15 seconds. Following episode, he was able to answer questions ruling out mental alteration. Given treatment and education on care for his facial injuries and added 20 minutes to observation period. Patient ambulated to car with mother stating she would drive. Plan in place for administration of the second dose.
28 2021-05-04 fall, dizziness Patient presented to vaccine clinic today for dose #2 of Moderna vaccine. Two minutes after receivi... Read more
Close
Patient presented to vaccine clinic today for dose #2 of Moderna vaccine. Two minutes after receiving the vaccine patient had a syncopal event and dropped to the floor from the chair. He aroused easily, initial blood pressure was 109/56, pulse 45. Patient complained of dizziness and feeling lightheaded. He sustained mild abrasions to the right side of his forehead. He was alert and oriented x 3, pupils equal. Ice applied to forehead. Patient attempted to stand up, however he was instructed to lay on the floor and his legs were elevated onto a chair to prevent him from another fall. Blood pressure on the floor with legs up 114/76, 109/58, pulse 65. When patient attempted to set up on the floor he became dizzy again and laid back down with legs up. After approximately 15 minutes, patient was escorted to the cot on the clinic floor via wheelchair as he continued to report not feel well. Blood pressure retake 98/58, patient provided with water. He reported that he had only had a small amount of fluid intake today, he had eaten lunch two hours prior. Patient reported this had happened several times before when receiving injections, having blood taken and having stiches taken out. After 30 minutes of observation patient was still symptomatic upon standing, blood pressure 98/58. Patient assessed by doctor attending the clinic. It was felt patient should go to ED for further evaluation and IV fluids. EMS summonsed ambulance for further evaluation. Patient was transferred to the care of EMS staff in stable condition. Patient was assessed in EMS vehicle and started to improve. Blood pressure 127/86, pulse 65 per per report from EMS staff. Patient was allowed back into the clinic so he could wait for his ride. He was accompanied by EMS staff on site. He left the facility stable and feeling well.

He was provided juice which he tolerated and stated he felt better within 1-2 minutes. We observed him in clinic for an additional 20 minutes and he left independently with no complaints.

28 2021-05-18 dizziness Patient came in to get his second dose of Moderna. After the inoculation, he was assigned to wait in... Read more
Close
Patient came in to get his second dose of Moderna. After the inoculation, he was assigned to wait in the post-vaccination chair for 15minutes. After 5 minutes in, he began to feel dizzied, chill, sweaty, stomach pain, and wanting to vomit. He gave us permission to call 911 for him. We gave him a cold compressed to put around his neck while he waited for paramedic to arrived. They came and took his vital signs and asked couple questions. His vital signs were good and they discovered that he did not have lunch, he only had breakfast for the day. He felt a lot better after 20 minutes so he got released by the paramedic to go home.
28 2021-05-18 dizziness Ten minutes after receiving his vaccine I went to check on the patient knowing he had had a previous... Read more
Close
Ten minutes after receiving his vaccine I went to check on the patient knowing he had had a previous fainting experience with injections. I offered him water and he accepted stated he was ok. 15 minutes after receiving his vaccine the patient started to feel dizzy and raised his arm to alert me. I went to his side and asked if he was ok and he stated that "it's happening". His head started to fall back and body started to slump to the side. I supported his head and called for the other pharmacist who came over and we were able successfully get the patient to the floor in the supine position. I left the patient with the other pharmacist and called 911. By the time I came back he was awake and talking . He remained in the supine position until the medic came and took vitals. We had him sit up and within a few minutes back into his chair where I remained with him until his wife arrived. I gave him a water and approximately 1 hour after the incident the patient left with his wife.

Close
13 Hours After Dose: Chills set in, which caused back spasming and back muscle seizing in addition to shaking for approximately 20 minutes (it may have been convulsions). Also had a fever, nausea, dizziness, and injection site pain. 24-70 hours later: Fatigue and a headache 70 hours later: Woke up with major chest pains and went to ER. Testing eventually determined it to be myocarditis. Hospital stay was approximately 54 hours.
28 2021-05-20 dizziness 28 year-old-male with no past medical history presented with episode of vasovagal syncope. Patient s... Read more
Close
28 year-old-male with no past medical history presented with episode of vasovagal syncope. Patient states he feels "dizzy, blurry vision, and lightheaded" immediately after receiving the vaccination. The patient was placed on the floor by the nurse who administered the vaccine and his lower extremities were elevated. Patients HR was 68 and SpO2 was 98%. That patient was given fluids and then taken to the medical tent for evaluation. Vital signs were: BP 122/84, HR69, RR18, SpO2 98%, and Temp 98F. After 5 minutes in the medical tent, the patient stated he felt much better and wanted to go home.

28 2021-05-24 impaired driving ability, gait disturbance The day after, I had the normal fever, flu-like symptoms, and my left ankle/right knee ached pretty ... Read more
Close
The day after, I had the normal fever, flu-like symptoms, and my left ankle/right knee ached pretty badly. Starting Monday 05/17, my right knee was unbearably painful. If I moved it at all away from a ~30 degree angle, my entire leg lit up with the worst pain I've ever felt. Not as bad as if I put pressure on it though, that was even worse. I couldn't walk, couldn't drive, could barely get out of bed for days. I got through that with over the counter pain killers and Biofreezing the knee like crazy. Starting Friday 05/21 I believe, my knee pain suddenly went away only to be replaced with pain in my left foot. It's not nearly as bad as the knee was, but the entire left side is in constant pain made worse with pressure. I can drive now that my right leg works fine, but still can't walk without some form of assistance. I was reporting all of this in the V-safe health checker, but it apparently doesn't care outside of 7 days. Tempted to put "permanent damage" for Item 21 as the result, but I'm hoping this goes away soon.

28 2021-05-27 fall After administration, the patient sat in a chair for observation. 2-3 minutes after administration ... Read more
Close
After administration, the patient sat in a chair for observation. 2-3 minutes after administration patient had a loss of consciousness, falling out of his chair onto the carpeted floor. Patient observed having seizure-like contractions of his upper extremities and slight arching of his back while having this loss of consciousness. LOC lasted less than 10 seconds. Patient was placed on his side, and when he regained consciousness could answer all questions appropriately and without delay. Patient was placed in a wheel chair and taken to a private observation area where vital signs could be attained. Patient again had a LOC while being wheeled in the wheel chair to the private observation area. Patient was placed on a gurney, supine. Vital signs taken and patient was found to have a heart rate in the 40s and a blood pressure of 90/66. Patient was ashen and diaphoretic. Patient was observed for 30 minutes in the private observation area where his condition improved to normal before leaving the facility.

Covid vaccine was adminsitered to patient. Patient was asked if he normally does well with vaccines prior to being administered the vaccine and stated yes, but that he is not particularly fond of needles. The patient was helped into a laying position and was shortly given a bottle water. Patient declined the need for an ambulence. Patient is not diabetic.
