Close
Situation: Patient, 28 yrs old, had an appointment for 1st dose Moderna Lot# 007C21A today. Pt felt anxious prior to vaccination. As a precaution, pt was placed on a gurney and he received the vaccine while on the gurney. RN was bedside during the process. Pt started feeling shaky and dizzy 5 mins post vaccination. . Juice and crackers provided. Pt stated that he ate and drank liquids prior to coming in. Encourage to relax and take slow deep breaths Background: . He informed the vaccinator upon arrival that he has a hx of syncopal episode during vaccinations. Pt had a syncopal episode when he got the TB Test. Pt felt anxious prior to vaccination. Allergies: PCN and other abx, unable to state rest of allergies Hx: Asthma, MVA last April 2021, head injury, L wrist surgery Accompanied by mother Assessment: 1020 ? Pt c/o being more dizzy, queasy to throat and chest, lightheaded and started to look pale. VS 99.0F, 65, 98% RA, 97/40 (62), 22. Clear speech noted. 1030 ? VS 105/49 (67), 72, 99% RA, 26. Paler, diaphoretic, increased dizziness, nausea, numbness to hands, anxious, shaky. Mother at bedside, comforting patient. Encourage to take slower deep breaths and continue to lie back. 1034 ? VS 114/61 (74), 72, 100% RA, 22, color is better 1038 ? VS 106/65 (77), 65, 100% RA, 18. Pt is more relaxed. Tightness to throat is better. Clear speech. Can speak complete sentences. 1043 ? VS 103/65 (79), 64, 100% RA, 18. Color has improved. More color to lips, hands are less numb. Pt stated that he is back to ?almost normal.? 1044 ? Called Dr about pt. MD was expecting that pt will be better in a few minutes. If pt is worse or if his symptoms come back while at home, pt need to go to ED or call his doctor. Relayed MD?s recommendation to patient and mother. Both verbalized understanding. 1045 ? VS 102/61 (72), 74, 18, 94% RA 1050 ? VS 116/70 (80), 74, 16, 95% RA. Moved patient and mother to room 6. Pt stated that he is ?feeling way better.? Mother at bedside. Report given to RN 1100 ? VS 103/63, 68, 98% RA semi fowlers on the gurney? conversing with mother. VS 111/67, 72, 100% RA - sitting VS 116/68, 85, 100% RA standing. Denies any dizziness upon position changes. 1110 ? VS 97/65, 67, 95% RA. Pt stated that he feels okay. Drank juice. 1120 ? VS 109/65, 72, 95% RA. Able to stand and walk to wheelchair. 1125 ? ambulated to bathroom. No problems. 1130 ? wheeled to car. Denies any symptoms. Recommendations: Dr was called about pt and expected that pt will be better in a few minutes. If pt is worse or if his symptoms come back while at home, pt needs to go to ED or call his doctor. Relayed MD?s recommendation to patient and mother. Both verbalized understanding. Pt was wheeled to the car and went home with his mother.
28 2021-06-03 gait disturbance, dizziness Just after midnight, I was watching TV with my brother after smoking a medical pre-roll (I'm a medic... Read more
Close
Just after midnight, I was watching TV with my brother after smoking a medical pre-roll (I'm a medical marijuana patient). Shortly after, I began feeling dizzy. I finished my glass of water and the dizziness subsided for roughly ten minutes, before returning even worse than before. I went to get more water and after filling my glass and closing the refrigerator, I was barely able to walk the few steps from my kitchen to the living room to lie down on the couch. At this time, my chest started feeling tight, and I had a light tingling sensation in my feet and lower body. When I closed my eyes, the dizziness got worse, and laying in certain positions made the tightness in my upper chest become painful. I continued to drink water and ate a little, but the episode lasted between 30-60 minutes of mild discomfort ranging to a decent amount of pain. There was a moment when I had considered going to the hospital, but after eating, drinking, and doing some controlled breathing, the pain lessened I ended up falling asleep on the couch. I woke up feeling considerably better, but decided to call out of work so I wouldn't do any strenuous activity. On occassion I still feel like there's a little bit of pressure or tightness in my upper chest, but nothing painful or debilitating like the night of the incident
28 2021-06-15 dizziness, movement disorder Started the day great and went and got the 2nd dose of Moderna on 6/12/21 at 940am. I felt fine thro... Read more
Close
Started the day great and went and got the 2nd dose of Moderna on 6/12/21 at 940am. I felt fine throughout the day and I started getting a little dizzy and disoriented around 5pm and as it was explained to me it would be expected to get side effects. Later in the evening around 8pm I started to get extremely dizzy, tired, and having a low grade fever of 100.5F. I Later developed a headache and I had to go lie down for the rest of the night. As I was sleeping throughout the night and waking up multiple times shivering and being extremely cold, I was taking my temperature throughout the night and It would be climbing up from 100.5F and it reached 103.7F. At that point I wanted to get up and take some fever reducer medicines but I was unable to get out of the bed as I was very dizzy and disoriented and I was having extreme muscle and joint pains that I wasnt unable to move at all. I needed to go to the restroom and get a drink and I was unable to do that. I had considered going to the ER but I waited it out and wouldnt go unless my temperature kept rising. I eventually tried going to the bathroom but at that point I had passed out and woke up in the morning between my bedroom and bathroom. On sunday 6/13 I was continuing to have symptoms and felt extremely ill throughout the day. I woke up and the fever had gone away but I still had the symptoms mentioned above and also had ringing in my ears. Throughout the day I was trying to do stuff around the house but I was unable to do that and go to work. I would randomly pass out at times either on my desk or just sitting on the couch. That was throughout sunday then on monday I was feeling a lot better almost all symptoms had gone away but I was still a bit dizzy and had body aches and was unable to go to work and do basic stuff around the house. Tuesday I was mostly feeling fine but still felt a bit dizzy and disoriented and extremely fatigued but I was able to go to work. Wednesday I am feeling almost 100% normal but I do get dizzy at times and I am still extremely fatigued.
28 2021-06-23 dizziness On May 11 2021, I went to the gym to workout my back muscles in after work (around 3pm). After compl... Read more
Close
On May 11 2021, I went to the gym to workout my back muscles in after work (around 3pm). After completing a heavy set of rack pulls I got light headed. After removing the weight to put it away, I accidentally dropped 25 pounds weight which was abnormal because I lost grip while light headed. I tried to walk off the pain by walking to the other side of the gym and within the next 10 minutes my face started turning pale and my lips dark blue/purple. I was sitting down as I progressively grew more light headed and started blacking out. My brother called over several people to help me maintain consciousness and an employee noted my lip and face color, low pulse and high rate of breathing. I fainted for a couple minutes then took a sip of gatorade and bounced back. I felt like that was a near death experience. Possibly related to some heart issue. A few weeks after I got a physical checkup at my doctor's office and the bloodwork came back clean. I have nothing to show why this episode occurred and feel like I should have some heart tests as a follow up. Before this incident I have been going to the gym without ever having experienced this kind of issue. What was notably odd though is I started having some chest pains not too long after my 2nd vaccination that I originally attributed to a bad sleeping position (I sleep on my side). I would have tightness that at times were consistent. Overtime the pain got weaker as I stopped doing intensive workouts. I thought it could've been a muscle tear but a tear would've healed by now. I still experience a bit of tightness when I do heavy chest exercise or if I compress my chest muscles and squeeze in the middle. I'm submitting this report because its been recently identified myocarditis is a possible side affect of the vaccine.
28 2021-06-23 fall, dizziness Vaccination was administered to the patient, the patient was a little nervous at time of administrat... Read more
Close
Vaccination was administered to the patient, the patient was a little nervous at time of administration. After 5 to 10 minutes of waiting in the pharmacy the patient was lightheaded and dizziness. The patient passed out and fell over, hitting his head on the wall of the pharmacy. The patient was briefly shaking/convulsing per the mother for a few seconds until the patient woke up. The pharmacy staff rushed out to the patient's aid. The patient was confused when he woke up . We had him lay on the floor for a few minutes then helped him up to a chair to sit when he felt better. The patient explained how this has happened to him before when receiving vaccinations, he gets lightheaded and dizzy when receiving vaccinations. The patient explained how he did not take any medications or has any health conditions. The patient refused medical attention and said he felt ok as we waited with him for 5 minutes. We recommended the patient to see a doctor if he as any symptoms. The patient waited for an extra 30 minutes and said he felt fine. The patient's mother and the patient left with the mother driving him home.

28 2021-07-05 dizziness After vaccination on 09 April, the patient expressed to the clinic staff that he was experiencing bl... Read more
Close
After vaccination on 09 April, the patient expressed to the clinic staff that he was experiencing blurry vision. He was evaluated by a provider after vaccination and was release without limitations. The patient was evaluated again on 13 April by his primary care provider and reported headache, vision changes, body ache, fever, chills, and lightheadedness when standing or changing positions. The patient was instructed to hydrate and follow up with his primary care provider for further assessment in 2 days. During his follow up on 15 April, the patient reported a resolution of symptoms. He had continued to increase his water intake. and supplemented with electrolyte beverages as well.

28 2021-07-19 dizziness Felt like fainting; Nervous after the second shot; Dizzy after first and second shot; Rhabdomyolysis... Read more
Close
Felt like fainting; Nervous after the second shot; Dizzy after first and second shot; Rhabdomyolysis; heart rate increased; Malaise; Tired with normal activity after the second shot; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of RHABDOMYOLYSIS (Rhabdomyolysis) in a 28-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 001C21A and 016B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Emotional distress (upset about his parents) on 27-Apr-2021. On 29-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 26-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. In April 2021, the patient experienced DIZZINESS (Dizzy after first and second shot) and FATIGUE (Tired with normal activity after the second shot). April 2021, the patient experienced RHABDOMYOLYSIS (Rhabdomyolysis) (seriousness criterion medically significant), HEART RATE INCREASED (heart rate increased) and MALAISE (Malaise). On 27-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PRESYNCOPE (Felt like fainting) and NERVOUSNESS (Nervous after the second shot). The patient was treated with ALPRAZOLAM on 27-Apr-2021 for Anxiety, at an unspecified dose and frequency. At the time of the report, PRESYNCOPE (Felt like fainting), NERVOUSNESS (Nervous after the second shot), DIZZINESS (Dizzy after first and second shot), RHABDOMYOLYSIS (Rhabdomyolysis), HEART RATE INCREASED (heart rate increased), MALAISE (Malaise) and FATIGUE (Tired with normal activity after the second shot) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 27-Apr-2021, Blood pressure measurement: 148/90 (High) Blood pressure at rest was 148/90 for the entire day. On 27-Apr-2021, Heart rate: 140 (High) Felt his heart in chest beating fast 140. Concomitant product information was not provided. On 27-Apr-2021, the patient visited an emergency room (ER) where he was prescribed an anxiety medication. The patient reported he thought he might have myocarditis after hearing about it on the news. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to MOD-2021-243062 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Around 5.50 pm on 7-27-21 I gave first moderna shot to a patient. After 5 min, he said he is feeling dizzy , stiff and shaky so we called 911. They came around 6.15 pm . They doubted being an allergic reaction , they said may be scared or something else. It was the ambulance , His parameters were fine BP 124/78, HR 67, 99 room air, 16 respiratory rate, 80 blood glucose, Ao4, alert and oriented, no pain, skin and mucous membrane were fine. At the end he signed to them that he does not want to go with them and he is feeling good. The 2 parameds . Hall left around 6.33 pm. They said they can not give me written but verbal report. Also we called his uncle once this happened and he came before ambulance . His uncle took him and left around 6.37 pm. He said they were pressuring him on the vaccine.

Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA. Rather moderate joint soreness, Chills, body aches, slight fever.It all started the night of the vaccine with the soreness at the injection site (1/5/21). Then the next morning I was riding in my car (1/6/21 around 9:45am) and a weird virtigo feeling settled in. After that was when the chills started with the body aches. I checked my temperature before I went in to the shower and it was running 99.7. Then when I was showering I had that uncomfortable feeling when the water hits you right before you get sick. Kind of a werid feeling to describe if you've never experienced it before. I have just been monitoring my symptoms and staying home, and hydrating.
29 2021-01-07 dizziness Client complained of dizziness at 11:09. Will call for a ride home. Offered to call 911 (client refu... Read more
Close
Client complained of dizziness at 11:09. Will call for a ride home. Offered to call 911 (client refused) Suggested client go to ED. Client left to home in a LYFT; stated he has no other way home; instructed to go to the ED
29 2021-01-09 injected limb mobility decreased Moderna vaccine dose #1 received in right shoulder on 12/31/20 at 2:15PM. Injection was uneventful o... Read more
Close
Moderna vaccine dose #1 received in right shoulder on 12/31/20 at 2:15PM. Injection was uneventful other than sensation of pressure. I did notice at the time, but could not fully see, that the injection appeared to be much higher on the shoulder than normal. I immediately came home afterwards and relaxed. Approximately 2hrs later, I began experiencing extreme pain in my right shoulder. As the night progressed, the pain worsened to 10/10 with inability to move my arm. Later that night after requiring assistance to take off my shirt, I noticed that the bandaid overlying the injection site was very high, immediately below and bordering the acromion process. This was concerning but I was hopeful the pain would go away over the next few days. I took tylenol that night. I woke up multiple times during the night because the pain was so severe. When I woke up, the pain and inability to move my arm were still present. I began taking 800mg ibuprofen and 1000mg tylenol alternating Q4 throughout the next few days. The pain and disability remained so severe that I required assistance performing ADLs for the next 4 days. On day four, with the pain not resolved and still severe despite consistent advil and tylenol use, I began having concern for shoulder injury related to vaccine administration. The next day I decided to seek an evaluation by an orthopedist. I am a physician and was unable to perform basic tasks and ADLs. I happened to have a few days off after the injection but would not have been able to work had I not. After an evaluation by the an orthopedic PA, I obtained an MRI of my right shoulder with results shown below - as I expected evidence of rotator cuff tendinopathy and subdeltoid bursitis consistent with SIRVA. As of now, I still have limited range of motion and shoulder pain on the right which has improved slightly but is far from resolved. I still have difficulty with certain ADLs including putting clothes on and off, lifting items, and tasks that require raising my right arm above my head. I am concerned with the possibility of long term and/or permanent damage after reviewing the literature. I am also concerned about how many other healthcare workers the person who gave me my vaccine may be injuring and/or causing permanent harm to.

Close
Client was administer 2nd dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at 1:32pm. Client reported has "sore arm from first dose", but denied any other issues from 1st dose. At 1:44pm, client reported was feeling flushed and slightly dizzy/light headed. Client appeared flushed, clammy and was slightly confused. Client was sitting in chair and was assisted to the floor and clinical assist code was called. VS were: BP: 149/84 and pulse ox was 97% on RA. Initially, HR was in the low 30's, but after lying down, came up to 86 and stayed in the 80-90's during assist. Client began to report chest tightness and feeling foggy and remained slightly confused and at times speech was garbled. Client denies sensation of throat closing and denied shortness of breath. Client was assisted to a cot and transported by ER staff and MD to the ER for evaluation.

Nausea at between 17:30 & 20:15 Jan 6. Mild joint paint. Not all joints just the ones that normally hurt when I get sick. Overall feeling tired and low energy. Jan 7 - Jan 8: Redness at injection site and some minor swelling.

Day 1-3- Sore Arm Day 4- Severe nausea and dizziness, had to request a ride home from work and leave early. Day 5- Severe nausea and dizziness followed by fever and chills, was only at work for an hour before having to leave Day 6- Severe Abdominal pain followed by diarrhea and vomitting and also a temperature hovering around 101.4, took OTC nausea med and made it through most of the work day. Become very nauseated and dizzy and had to leave early. Day 7- Became very disoriented and nauseated, left work for urgent care where initial BP reading was 189/123. Slowly dropped to 153/114 (took a covid test and results were negative, also had blood drawn) Day 8- Stayed home from work and felt fine as long as I was sitting/laying and stationary. Immediate dizzy spells and disorientation upon standing

Pain at injection site - sudden and more painful compared to that of dose 1. Other adverse events that happened with second dose that did not happen with 1st dose: - Insomnia on 1/28/21 night up to 1/29/21 early morning, needed melatonin to help with falling asleep. - Grogginess/lightheadedness on 1/29/21 morning, some mild headache. Proceeded to take 2 Tylenol 650 mg tabs. - Headache, dizziness, and fatigue worsening during 1/29/21 throughout the day. Severe headache/dizziness, especially if moving head quickly, on 1/29/21 evening - prompting to take 2 Advil 200 mg tabs. - The headache and injection site pain were lessened significantly, but still there on 1/30/21. All other symptoms resolved. - All symptoms resolved by 2/1/21.

29 2021-03-14 dizziness Asthma Reaction; Dizzy; Lighted headed; Difficulty breathing; A spontaneous report was received from... Read more
Close
Asthma Reaction; Dizzy; Lighted headed; Difficulty breathing; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer who is a 29-year-old male patient that received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced dizziness, light headed, asthma reaction (asthmatic crisis) and difficulty breathing. The patient's medical history was not provided. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included pantoprazole 40 mg. On 28-Dec-2020, approximately three hours prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: unknown) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 28-Dec-2020, the patient developed dizziness, became light headed, experienced an asthmatic reaction and difficulty breathing. The events were treated with a dose of albuterol. The patient was transported to the Emergency Room but additional information was not provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcome of the events, dizziness, light headed, asthma reaction and difficulty breathing was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
29 2021-03-17 dizziness @1352 reported feeling dizzy, clammy and pale, Nauseous, hand tingling and light headedness. Given w... Read more
Close
@1352 reported feeling dizzy, clammy and pale, Nauseous, hand tingling and light headedness. Given water and provided support. @1357 patient reported symptoms are resolved. @2:20 Patient left the vaccination site with no complaints. V/S 116/72 mmHg, o2 sat 98% on RA. Encouraged to contact his PCP for further evaluation and as needed.
29 2021-03-17 dizziness About 5 to 10 minutes after the shot I felt extremely lightheaded and then fainted. When I came to ... Read more
Close
About 5 to 10 minutes after the shot I felt extremely lightheaded and then fainted. When I came to about 10 seconds later, there was a public health official there rubbing my chest asking me if I knew where I was. It took me a second to fully come to my senses but then I realized where I was and what had happened. I was very pale, felt chills, was sweating, and it took effort to open my hands. The EMTs ran a bunch of tests, my Blood pressure was low (I think the number I remember was 104/33), but the rest of the measurements like blood sugar or the number of ekg like tests they did all came back normal. The EMTs in the field said they think it was a response to the vaccine. After about 20 minutes of the EMTs monitoring me, my numbers came back up and I was feeling relatively normal. I waited another 30 minutes before leaving just to make sure. It has been almost a week and I haven't felt any symptoms close to that since then.
29 2021-03-17 dizziness Patient appeared pale, sweating, and complained of dizziness presenting within 5 minutes of vaccinat... Read more
Close
Patient appeared pale, sweating, and complained of dizziness presenting within 5 minutes of vaccination during the recommended observation time. Patient was given a cold cloth around the back of his neck and his blood pressure was taken and it was 82/58. Patients O2 sat was 98 and pulse was 78. Patient stated that he was allergic to nuts. We asked if he had eaten breakfast this morning and he stated that he had a bowl of cereal. I instructed for someone to have him sit on the ground and to get him some candy and a sugary drink. A package of skittles was presented along with a Mountain Dew. After finishing both the candy and Mountain Dew (aprox 4 mins) the patient started to get a little color back and he stated he was feeling much better. A second set of vitals was then taken which were BP: 106/78 the O2 sat 98 and Heart rate was again at 78. We instructed the patient to please hang around for 30 more minutes and after that time left with the person he was with.
29 2021-03-18 dizziness Fever (high of 102.5) Aches Dizzy Arm swelling Cough/congestion Fatigue
29 2021-03-18 dizziness This patient felt fine with the injection and for the 15 min following. He was dismissed to check ou... Read more
Close
This patient felt fine with the injection and for the 15 min following. He was dismissed to check out and make a follow up appt. While waiting in line to make his appt, he stated to his mother (who had given him a ride and stayed with him) that he felt faint. His mother shouted to staff nearby that he was going to pass out, so a staff person grabbed a chair for him. He sat in the chair, but did not fully lose consciousness. I ran to him with , told someone to get an ice pack, and asked his mother to sit in a chair next to him and place her hand on his right arm. I checked his bp at this time and it was 58/30. He was shaking all over, diaphoretic, pale, and his muscles were weak. He asked for water, so one was given to him, and he promptly drank the whole 16 oz bottle. Over approximately 5 min, he came back to his normal LOC, stopped shaking and sweating, and stated that he was feeling better. He was given a small bag of crackers and another bottle of water, which he quickly consumed before standing up. At this point, he stated that he was feeling hung over after staying out late the evening before drinking and celebrating St. Patrick's Day. Instructed him to make sure he is well hydrated before he comes for his second dose vaccination.
29 2021-03-22 dizziness Patient received 1st dose of Moderna at approximately 12:30pm on 3/18/21. He did not stay the recomm... Read more
Close
Patient received 1st dose of Moderna at approximately 12:30pm on 3/18/21. He did not stay the recommended 15 minutes on site for observation. He drove himself back to vaccination clinic parking lot at approximately 1:40pm and got out of his car hurriedly to get his mask from the trunk before speaking with EMS on site. He then reported to EMS his wife witnessed him have a seizure (eyes rolled back, unresponsive, stiffening of arms and legs) for 2-3 min approximately 1 hour after receiving his shot. He reported when he regained responsiveness he asked his wife what had happened as he reportedly had no recollection of the seizure, they decided to call the patient's sister and she directed them to return to site of vaccination to report his seizure. EMS who evaluated patient reported he denied (and was not exhibiting) postictal signs/symptoms when he arrived back in parking lot at vaccination site. He denied having a history of seizures or any medical conditions. EMS also reported that neither the patient nor his wife called 911 after the seizure. Patient declined any further medical evaluation/follow up. EMS urged him to call 911 if he had anymore seizure activity to which he replied he thought if he just rested Friday and through the weekend, he'd be fine to return to work on Monday.
29 2021-03-22 dizziness Patient just got the covid vaccine and after he sat down for observation. He turned to the nurse an... Read more
Close
Patient just got the covid vaccine and after he sat down for observation. He turned to the nurse and said "I am dizzy." Per LVN, patient slid down his chair, collapse for about 2-3 minutes, witnessed the patient had stiffening of the body, pale, sweating and was unresponsive for 2-3 minutes. 911 called and STAT RN called for assistance. All four LVNs including RN assisted patient to the floor and secured his head. He didn't hit any body part. No nausea and vomiting. Once he was on the floor, he woke up crying and nervous. 911 called. orthostatic BP done. BP standing dropped.

While officer was gone, patient said, "I am going to pass out" and reclined his car seat. Nurse went to patient and shouted his name, slapped his cheeks, wiped his face and arms with cool cloth, applied ice pack to face, chest, performed sternal rub-no response. Awoke alert oriented X 3.

29 2021-03-30 fall, dizziness syncopal episode- 1:33 pm individual fell head-first off from chair in observation area and hit her ... Read more
Close
syncopal episode- 1:33 pm individual fell head-first off from chair in observation area and hit her head. I was called over by the observation person that someone needed attention right away. I ran over the individual was lying on the floor and her husband was sitting on a chair right next to her. He said she fainted and fell forward. The individual appeared to be unconscious when I arrived and was very diaphoretic. I loudly asked if she was okay and then tapped her chest. She looked up at me and said ?oh snap.? She was oriented to person and place and her pupils were equal, round, and reactive. She denied that she had any tingling in her arms or legs. She said she heard everyone talking to her, but thought she was dreaming. She said that she has a history of passing out with finger-pricks (she cannot donate blood anymore because of this), shots, and she passed out when she got a piercing in the past. She said she felt her HR slowly starting to climb, but she felt she would be okay. She said she then started feeling lightheaded and passed out. I took HR BP at 1:35 128/74, 62 and again 5 minutes later 128/80, 62. Individual was given an ice pack for her head. She had a bump on the upper right side of forehead. She said she had not eaten or drank much before her shot. She said her stomach was a little upset. She was given water and granola bars and sat up for a while before standing up. She asked if I thought she should get her head checked out. I said it is never a bad idea to get checked and since she did hit her head hard enough for a bump to happen right away. Individual was feeling better before she left, stating just her head hurt. We told her to ice and ibuprofen or Tylenol to treat discomfort.

29 2021-04-11 dizziness client complained of dizziness after receiving 1st dose of Moderna Covid Vaccine. Client was sitting... Read more
Close
client complained of dizziness after receiving 1st dose of Moderna Covid Vaccine. Client was sitting in post vaccine waiting room when he alerted EMTs he was feeling dizzy. EMTs did first assessment. Vitals 0958: blood pressure 110/50, pulse 92, oxygen 97%. Client diaphoretic, face flushed. EMT gave client water. Vitals 1003: blood pressure 130/70, pulse 94, oxygen 97%. Per client feeling better. joined EMTs. Per client no pertinent medical history or current medications. No history of allergies. Per client had completed 15min waiting time and was getting ready to leave when he felt dizzy. At this time dizziness improving, flushing resolved. Vitals at 1008: blood pressure 140/90, pulse 92, oxygen 97%. PHN asked client if he has hypertension, per client does not regularly follow up with provider. Client alert and oriented, denied chest pain, headache, dizziness improving. 1015 vitals: blood pressure 140/90, pulse 103, oxygen 98%. Per client no complaints, previous symptoms all resolved. Last vitals at 1024: blood pressure 140/70, pulse 104, oxygen 98%. Client alert and oriented, feeling fine, ready to leave. Client did not drive, here with family. Client advised to see primary doctor to follow up on blood pressure and to follow up with them prior to second dose. ER precautions given as well. Client left facility at 1025 with steady gait.

Close
Every night since getting the vaccine around 2:00 or 3:00 AM I am woken up by intense pain and stiffness inside my left elbow joint. The vaccine was administered in my left arm. I cannot go back to sleep until I straighten my arm out and support it with my body by laying on my right side. During the day there is slight tenderness to the elbow joint, but otherwise no pain or symptoms. As of 4/12 it now feels like I have partially torn my Achilles' tendon where it connects to the bottom of my heel in my left foot after trying to lightly stretch it while standing talking to someone in my office. I am fairly active outdoors and consider myself in otherwise good health so these two events post-vaccine seem very odd to me.

This is a secondary VAERS for the same pt. Pt originally was very anxious before the vaccine, got the vaccine and subsequently had lightheadedness and nausea. He was treated for this by laying him down which resolved his sx's almost immediately. Vitals were all normal. He denies CP, SOB, nausea resolved and so did his lightheadedness. About 6 hours after the vaccine, pt was seen in the ER for a seizure. Pt has a hx of a brain tumor with surgical removal. No sz since March 2020, per pt. He was treated for a sz and for sinusitis.

29 2021-04-15 dizziness Patient is a 29-year-old male with no significant past medical history. Presents emergency room for ... Read more
Close
Patient is a 29-year-old male with no significant past medical history. Presents emergency room for a syncopal event. Patient was upstairs in this facility receiving a COVID vaccine. A few minutes after receiving the vaccine he began to feel lightheaded, asked for assistance and had a syncopal episode. Patient was eased to the ground there was no trauma. States he has had previous near syncopal events associated with seeing blood or having needles injected into him in the past. He is without complaint. Denies any chest pain or headache prior to event. Denies any previous history of blood clots or other coagulopathies.
29 2021-04-15 dizziness Immediately after administering the vaccine, pt became pale, dizzy, and felt he was going to pass ou... Read more
Close
Immediately after administering the vaccine, pt became pale, dizzy, and felt he was going to pass out. Pt was moved to floor and legs elevated. BP dropped to 84/49 with a pulse of 103. Provider was called to the immunization clinic and pt was evaluated. After 15 minutes BP stabilized at 105/62. Pt was moved to a sitting position and was given a drink of water and some cookies. After 15 more minutes of observation, Pt continued to improve. BP remained stable at with a BP at 104/66. Pt denied further dizziness and color returned to face.

29 2021-04-23 balance disorder, dizziness Typical side effects began next day(4/18), Arm soreness at injection site, headache, feeling of fati... Read more
Close
Typical side effects began next day(4/18), Arm soreness at injection site, headache, feeling of fatigue, breathing feeling slightly off, but subsided after the second day (4/19). Third day was completely fine (4/20), Morning of fourth day (4/21) wave of dizziness and fatigue began accompanied with feeling of pressure in ears with occasional ringing. Also headache at the back of the head and where the cervical spine meets the skull. Occasional congestion. Hard to concentrate and occasional lightheaded feeling. Going on one week since injection and 3rd day of dizzy spells. (4/24) Treatment: Drinking mostly water. Diet consisting mostly of vegetables and grains (no changes have been made to my diet) Ibuprofen 200mg seems to alleviate earache which in turn relieves some dizziness but feeling of being off balance remains. No previous history of any sort of vertigo or ear infections.

Close
AFTER ADMINISTERING VACCINE, PT START EXPERIENCING NAUSEA, DIZZINESS, VERTIGO AND NUMBNESS. PT WAS CONTINUOSLY MONITORED BY PHARMACIST UNTIL EMT ARRIVED. BY THE TIME EMT ARRIVED, OR VITALS WERE NORMAL, SO PT REFUSED TO GO TO THE HOSPITAL.
29 2021-04-23 inability to stand on -03/25/21 I Injured my back doing an sitting dumbbell overhead press. The injury occurred while p... Read more
Close
on -03/25/21 I Injured my back doing an sitting dumbbell overhead press. The injury occurred while pulling the dumbbell from the ground into an overhead press position. The injury felt muscular in nature, there was no pain after the first few minutes, I was able to complete my workout without any pain. 03/26/21 - Received Moderna Vaccine first dose 03/27/21 - Worked out again with no pain, avoided aggravating the area just in case. 03/28/21 - Woke up with debilitating back pain, unable to fully stand, dull stabbing pain shooting from lower back into hip and then into knee. Following week I was unable to stand upright without intense pain, received Celebrex and muscle relaxers which did little to help with pain, Doctor then put me on 1 week of prednisone, an anti-inflammatory steroid which did not appear to do much. Four hours after starting steroid use I decided to stretch my psoas muscle, despite incredible pain I managed to get it stretched out, I could walk upright with reduced pain afterwards. For the next week the pain would gradually get better. 04/19/21 At this point pain had subsided to about 10% of pain at its worst point and has gradually gotten better, pain is almost non-existant at this point. I noticed that my right quadriceps muscle had atrophied in comparison to my left quadricep muscle. 04/22/21 Began self-administered rehabilitation, slight increase of pain during workouts. Noted that my right quadricep had gotten significantly weaker and had from visual inspection lost about 40% of it's muscle mass, left leg feels hard to the touch while flexed, right leg is mushy to the touch while flexed, one month prior I could do squats of 285x8, now my right quadricep could only complete 5 reps of 15lbs on single leg extensions, my left leg could still do 40+ reps without failure.

Close
On going Uncontrollable body convulsions. Tightness in the chest,behind the knees and calves. Low body tempature 95.8 during episode. Seems to only happen when I lay down or change in room tempature. Feel the need to wrap myself in several blankets. Not a seizure I am fully conscious during episode. Episodes last 10-30 minutes once a day when going to sleep or laying down.

Emergency Services were notified, and arrived, client's vitals were 120/80, 68 (sitting), and 120/80, 62 (standing), blood sugar was 112. He received his vaccine, had no reaction. The next day he was sitting watching TV and felt very weak, had a weak pulse and tried to measure it but did not give a good reading 60/40, felt like he was going to pass out and was sweating and had to lie down. This happened twice within 10 minutes of each other. He laid down and breathed carefully and calmed himself down to get through it, and that lasted for 1-2 minutes. He has had no other reactions since.

He still felt very faint and shaky, and asked for some gatorade. We had him lie on his back and elevate his feet until he felt better. 29 2021-05-09 dizziness, vertigo 30 April 2021: I had slight soreness at the site of injection that morning that gradually got a litt... Read more
Close
30 April 2021: I had slight soreness at the site of injection that morning that gradually got a little worse overall by the evening... no other noticeable symptoms. Had a protein bar and cold brew coffee for breakfast prior to vaccination. Approx. 45 min after the vaccination I ate a donut, then an hour later a ham & swiss sandwich for lunch. For diner approx. 8 hours later, I ate a KFC chicken sandwich and an order of popcorn chicken. 01 May 2021: I woke up with it feeling a bit more sore than in the evening... still very tolerable though... 3/10 overall on a pain chart... throughout the morning through mid-afternoon I felt no other noticeable symptoms. Ate a protein bar and some cold brew coffee for breakfast that morning, but nothing else before my AE. At 17:05 Pacific I get a work-related phone call from a client (I work in IT as an executive support specialist) and assist them for approx. 30-40 minutes. At that point I'm working on my laptop sitting cross-legged in bed. Adverse event: During that call, I start to notice that I'm slightly more sensitive to motion as usual, making me dizzy if I move around too much. By the end of the call, I'm feeling dizzy but I attribute it to hunger. Some time around 18:30 Pacific, I go downstairs to eat. However, by the time I get downstairs and try to prepare some sushi, I feel so dizzy I need to sit down on the couch to stop the room from spinning. I go upstairs a couple minutes later to try and sleep it off. I'm laying on my back at that point. I think I rested for about 25-35 minutes with my room dark. I then get up slowly to see if things got better but everything is still spinning and is getting worse. I try to rest in bed more, alternating laying on my back and my right side but it's still getting worse. Sometime around approx. 20:00 Pacific, I go to the bathroom to puke but nothing really comes out since I hadn't eaten since the morning. I go back to my room to try and sleep it all off. From that evening on 01 May 2021 to 04 May 2021, I'd sleep 12-15 hours on average each day to get rid of the nausea and dizziness. I normally sleep 6-7.5 hours (bad sleeping habits due to work/surfing the web on phone - never resulted in these symptoms before though). It gradually went away until going away almost completely by the 04 May. However, as of 10 May I still feel like the potential for the nausea is there... just ever so slightly lingering as a slight heavy feeling in my head that feels like it will spiral out of control if I start spinning around too much. I'm not sure if that's just due to my relative lack of sleep since 05 May (more bad sleeping habits). Otherwise, I feel back to normal.

He then reported the dizziness had subsided and he developed a headache. The numbness in his arm continued. He was given water, ice pack, and tylenol while at the pharmacy. He felt well enough to go home with his father, but too ill to drive. He did not require emergency treatment.

29 2021-05-18 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Shakiness-Mild
29 2021-05-20 dizziness Patient received his second shot and waited 15 minutes inside the vaccine site, he returned to his v... Read more
Close
Patient received his second shot and waited 15 minutes inside the vaccine site, he returned to his vehicle and reported feeling, "weird". He exited his vehicle and attempted to walk back into the site, but had to sit down on the curb. Traffic Enforcement noticed and called for an EMT. Pt was found to be pale, reported nausea, numbness and tingling to tongue, mouth, and bilateral upper extremities. APH Lead RN responded and found pt to be pale and broken out in cold sweat. Pt reported waves of feeling like he was going to pass out. Pt was given candy to help with blood sugar and an icepack. EMS was en route per IC. Vital Signs monitored during episode. Pt declined EMS transport and was released to his personal vehicle with his girlfriend driving him home.

29 2021-05-23 dizziness Patient received immunization and approximately 7 or 8 minutes later, patient starting feeling light... Read more
Close
Patient received immunization and approximately 7 or 8 minutes later, patient starting feeling light headed. Patient reported that he was having a hard time hearing for a few moments. Patients father requested we called an ambulance. Patient was checked by EMT. Patient was not taken to hospital. EMT told patient they did not believe the adverse reaction was due to the covid-19 immunization itself but rather from the patient becoming tense after he received the shot. Patient reported that a similar reaction occurred with other shots he had received in the past. After being checked by EMT patient returned to pharmacy to report that he was feeling fine about 20 minutes after this event started.
29 2021-05-24 dizziness Patient had Moderna vaccine administered at 7:16pm and become unresponsive and began convulsing at 7... Read more
Close
Patient had Moderna vaccine administered at 7:16pm and become unresponsive and began convulsing at 7:27pm. When patient came back around, he was disoriented and didn't know where he was. Patient blood pressure was 131/93 with a pulse of 89. Patient did remember where he was and that he had received his first covid vaccine. He knew the month, day and some other basic questions. The patient stated that before he become unresponsive that he started to feel very lightheaded and woozy. 911 was called and transported the patient to the local hospital for additional testing and evaluation. Upon further discussion with the ER physician, patient was diagnosed with syncope and low potassium.
29 2021-05-26 gait disturbance Swelling in the brain; Blurred vision; Weakness in the hand; Difficulty walking; This spontaneous ca... Read more
Close
Swelling in the brain; Blurred vision; Weakness in the hand; Difficulty walking; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of BRAIN OEDEMA (Swelling in the brain), VISION BLURRED (Blurred vision), MUSCULAR WEAKNESS (Weakness in the hand) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (Difficulty walking) in a 29-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 032M20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On 14-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 17-Apr-2021, the patient experienced BRAIN OEDEMA (Swelling in the brain) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), VISION BLURRED (Blurred vision) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), MUSCULAR WEAKNESS (Weakness in the hand) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (Difficulty walking) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). At the time of the report, BRAIN OEDEMA (Swelling in the brain), VISION BLURRED (Blurred vision), MUSCULAR WEAKNESS (Weakness in the hand) and GAIT DISTURBANCE (Difficulty walking) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): In 2021, Magnetic resonance imaging head: abnormal (abnormal) He had a brain MRI which shows swelling in the brain. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant product was not taken by the patient. Treatment information was not provided. The patient has weakness in his hand, difficulty walking, blurred vision. The patient started experiencing symptoms 3 days later, and they are ongoing. The patient was hospitalized for these symptoms, and was given steroids to reduce the swelling. Company Comment: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Per EMT Chief Complaint: Dizziness 10:23 AM B/P 128/82 Pulse 46 Respirations 18 10:33 AM B/P 126/80 Pulse 48 Respirations 16 Patient CAO X 4, complaining of dizziness, pupils dilated, fisting with hands, appears nervous, vitals stable, pulse rate low but patient states he is a runner/soccer player. BLS assessment conducted, no issues noted, had breakfast, denies diabetic or similar history. Physician on site evaluated patient, appears to be anxiety, patient declined EMS, released when dizziness subsided. Instructed to monitor symptoms, seek medical attention for anaphylaxis or near syncope symptoms.

Patient had received vaccine and was in waiting area for observance. After around 10 minutes wife came to counter and said he was feeling dizzy. 30 2021-01-05 dizziness Patient had received the Moderna vaccine and was in observation, when he started feeling lightheaded... Read more
Close
Patient had received the Moderna vaccine and was in observation, when he started feeling lightheaded. I took his blood pressure and pulse. BP 115/70, pulse 48. I had him to stay seated and I would check him again. At that time RN came into the room and retook his BP- BP 90/40 P60 R18, Pt then placed onto the floor and feet elevated. Pt became very pale and continued to complain of lightheadedness. we continued to observe pt. Pt explained that he was feeling a lot better. Continued to lay on the floor with feet elevated. BP 138/92 P-62 R-16. Color returned to normal Pt reported that he was feeling better . Placed pt in upright position and RN helped him to chair. RN continued to monitor pt for 15 minutes and pt was sent home. He had no more lightheadedness before he left.

Pt experienced dizziness 5 minutes after being vaccinated and being sent for Post vaccine observation. He was able to assist me but it was like lifting a dead weight (he weighs about 150). He was able to walk to his bed with his arms around my neck holding him upright. He is very tired/lethargic and not himself. Temperature is 99.7F by mouth. He has rested since the incident. Giving him apple juice to keep him hydrated. I need to help him up to a sitting position before he can drink.

Patient received his vaccine at 12:15 PM. Around 1:10PM he stated he started to feel "fuzzy" and "euphoric" almost. He was dazed and said he just felt off. When he stood up, he fell down and felt very dizzy. We were doing a vaccine clinic at his place of employment that day so I was still on site and he came back into the room I was stationed around 1:30pm. He said he felt ok, was talking, breathing fine, just felt a little "off." He had white spots all over his left arm and some on his right. None were raised, red, or itchy. His left hand was red/purple in color. I gave 50mg of diphenhydramine and he stated about 10 minutes later he felt better. I observed him for approximately another hour. He was walking around, talking fine and stated he felt normal when he left. He still had some slight discoloration on his left arm.

30 2021-03-21 dizziness During the 15 minute observation period after injection, patient returned to the check-in desk compl... Read more
Close
During the 15 minute observation period after injection, patient returned to the check-in desk complaining of dizziness. He was brought immediately to exam room where he became pale, diaphoretic, and stated he "felt like he was in a dream." Seated BP was 74/palp. He was placed in supine position on exam table, cool compresses placed on forehead and back of neck. He complained of some nausea, which quickly improved. He never lost consciousness. His color and alertness improved steadily over the next 10 minutes. Repeat BP (lying) was 100/50. After a few minutes he sat up on exam table, dangling legs. BP remained stable at 110/60, HR 84. He continued to improve and stated that he felt better, drank some water and ate some goldfish crackers. Reported that he just remembered he had not eaten since lunch. After another 5-10 minutes he was alert, oriented, able to walk unassisted. Final BP 114/70, HR 80. His wife remained with him and confirmed she could drive him home. Discussed that although I feel confident this was a vasovagal near-syncope, if symptoms recur or worsen, he should go to ER for evaluation. Understanding verbalized.

30 2021-03-21 inability to stand, dizziness Patient got a Covid19 (Moderna) vaccine and about 5 minutes after waiting in the wait area he felt d... Read more
Close
Patient got a Covid19 (Moderna) vaccine and about 5 minutes after waiting in the wait area he felt dizzy. He attempted to get up and and fell to the floor. He was awake, alert and spoke intelligently while EMT team was being expected. After about 10 minutes he sat up on the floor and was doing just fine. He stated that he believed his reaction to the vaccine was because he had not eaten prior to getting it. The EMT arrived after about 25 minutes from when incident started, took his blood pressure and measured his sugar levels and both were fine. Patient declined an emergency room offer from the EMT, ate a chesse burger meal and left the store. Pharmacy has followed with 3 phone calls, but patient is yet to respond.

30 2021-03-26 dizziness After I was administered the shot. I was directed to a space designated for observation for patients... Read more
Close
After I was administered the shot. I was directed to a space designated for observation for patients after they receive the vaccine. Within the first five minutes after I received my vaccine my mouth filled with an intense taste of metal and some numbness. My body became very hot and almost heavy as I tried to stabilize myself to get help from the nurse. I was ushered to an area to lie down as I was going to faint. I was sweating profusely and about three minutes after laying there the room turned cold and it felt such relief from the heat and sweating I felt such a short few minutes before. Both my hands became tingly and filled with the sensation of pins and needles. That symptom did not go away until about 15-20 mins later. As I felt a little more strength and cooled body. I was able to sit up again. Not even five minutes later the heat and sweating came upon me again but this time for a shorter episode. A light pins and needle feeling came about in my chest and tightness in the back of my neck. I stayed in the observation room for one hour until the cycle of symptoms became more stabilized. The nurse was very confused by my symptom of metal taste in my mouth. One other patient had mentioned that but never got sick like I did.

30 2021-03-29 dizziness Approximately 6 hours and 30 minutes after vaccination, patient became slightly dizzy and nauseous, ... Read more
Close
Approximately 6 hours and 30 minutes after vaccination, patient became slightly dizzy and nauseous, and went to bed. The morning after, the patient had body aches and a headache, and took 500mg of acetaminophen at approximately 5am. The patient also noticed swelling at the injection site (raised and approx 5 inches in diameter) and itching at this time as well. The patient took another 500mg of acetaminophen at 2pm, 200mg of ibuprofen at 3pm, and complained of a sensation of hypersensitivity and mild "burning" across the skin. These symptoms subsided by about 5pm, and patient felt well enough to stand up and have a small meal before returning to bed. At that point (~5pm), they developed a low fever (temp fluctuated between 99.5-100.6F), and took 400mg of ibuprofen and another 500mg of acetaminophen, and their temperature reduced to 98.6 at approximately 8PM. Afterwards, the patient had fatigue and some aches, and the swollen arm has not subsided at the time of report entry (~42 hours after vaccination).

Pt became nauseous and dizzy. Vitals checked, Zofran given. Pt monitored for 30 minutes. Pt reported feeling better. Pt ambulated out of clinic with steady gait.

Shot was given in left deltoid but upon needle insertion I could feel that I was not in the muscle. Was still able to inject vaccine. After removing the needle the patient straightened his posture and I could tell that the injection was too high and more in the shoulder area. Patient said that he felt okay and no pain but then returned 3 hours later complaining of shoulder pain and limited range of motion. I instructed him to ice the area 20 minutes on and 20 minutes off and to take Ibuprofen. Area was not swollen. Upon follow up later that evening he said he was having a hard time laying on that side and was more comfortable sleeping in a recliner. He said he was still having pain the following morning and was going to go to an urgent care for further testing.

Close
Patient felt lightheaded and was sweating around 10 minutes after receiving vaccine. He was in front of pharmacy and dropped to his knees. Patient was then sat down again and given water. He stayed there another 30 minuets to make sure he felt ok. After that he felt fine. He said he has a fear of needles and that this was normal for him.

30 2021-04-01 dizziness Patient came for 1st dose Moderna Vaccine. It was administered by FNP at 1740 Nurse Practitioner was... Read more
Close
Patient came for 1st dose Moderna Vaccine. It was administered by FNP at 1740 Nurse Practitioner was called by to waiting room at 1755. The PCT stated that the patient voiced he was feeling light headed. I came into waiting room and noted patient sitting in chair, pale and staring. Patient had syncopal episode that lasted 10-15 seconds. Respirations were even and unlabored during the event. No unusual movements noted. Patient woke up and started to get up but encouraged to rest and drink water. He took a few drinks of water and agreed to go back to the patient exam room. Patient was assisted by NP and to exam room one at 1758. The patient became pale and had another syncopal event just past door frame. Patient was lowered to ground by and NP. He verbally responded in about 2 seconds "Am I in the floor?" Patient sat upright in floor and drank some water for nearly a minute. He was then assisted to exam table to lie back. He stated that he feels fine just lightheaded. Patient rested on exam table and called wife on his cell phone to come pick him up. He left the clinic around 1850 with wife. Patient left ambulatory in no distress. Advised patient that adverse event report would be completed on website.

30 2021-04-06 mobility decreased I have pain in my left shoulder area on and around my deltoid muscle, especially when lifting my arm... Read more
Close
I have pain in my left shoulder area on and around my deltoid muscle, especially when lifting my arm up (e.g., like when I am trying to put on a T-shirt). This pain was severe for the first 3 days or so before becoming only moderate/mild pain. The problem is that it has now been almost exactly TWO MONTHS since I had that injection, and I still have that same mild/moderate pain when lifting my arm. I am surprised that it has not healed, and so I am reporting it. I will note, if it matters, that I don't think they administered this second dose very correctly-- instead of the middle of my deltoid muscle, they placed the injection very high and posterior on my shoulder, almost on the acromion process(I am an RN myself, which is why I feel qualified to talk about proper IM injection technique).

Close

Later that day I started to feel a strange feeling in my head that is hard to describe. It is a combination of light headedness, slight dizziness, and general head fog. These symptoms have persisted for 7 days now. They were mild to start and have gotten increasingly worse the last 2 days. The symptoms make it hard or impossible to focus on work depending on the severity at the time. I feel these symptoms whether I am sitting down or moving around, although it seems to be most pronounced when I am moving. Today was the first day I that I had to call in sick to work. I have not yet sought medical treatment, but as symptoms are worsening, this will be my next course of action. I have found

Pt reported dizziness, tightness in chest and mild difficulty breathing about 2 minutes after receiving shot. No other signs of allergic reaction upon examination. Laid patient down and checked blood pressure which was normal (127/85). Patient stated that he still felt the same after several minutes of observation and felt little to no improvement. Close
Patient received his first Moderna COVID vaccine. While he was waiting the 15 minutes he started to feel pressure behind his eyes, started sweating profusely, felt dizzy, and nauseous. I had the patient go into the IMZ room where I had him sit down. I took his blood pressure. His heart rate was 55 bpm and his blood pressure was around 110/70. He was not having any trouble breathing or had any signs of anaphylaxis (swelling of throat, tongue, lipps, etc). I had him remain seated and talked to him for 5 minutes. He felt like he was starting to come out of it and we took his blood pressure again. His heart rate and gone back up to 65 and his blood pressure was around 135/75. I had the patient remain seated for another 5-10 minutes. Took his bp again and the numbers were similar to the second one that was previously mentioned. He wanted to stand up and see how he was feeling. He stood up right outside the pharmacy for another 15 minutes and said that he felt back to normal. I explained that in the previous case where this happened to a woman they recommended she have someone drive her home and I recommended he do the same. He seemed to think he was fine and I believe he was planning to drive himself home.

Close
Patient is a 30 year old male who has completed a 30-minute observation period with the following signs and symptoms of an adverse reaction: loss of consiousness and other - syncopal episode, dizziness. Pt endorsed that he is nervous after getting the vaccine, then felt dizzy. while sitting down, he tried to distract himself by checking his cellphone then felt anxious and passed out. History of anxiety with procedures and riding the plane per patient. . Hx of having dizziness and felt like fainting on his 1sr COVID 19 vaccine. Per pt, he ate breakfast with oatmeal. Pt also endorsed he is athletic. Pt endorse that he drank 2 beers last night. Denies taking any blood thinners or Aspirin. Staff found patient on the ground with some jerking of arms, LOC lasted for 15-30 seconds per RN. Pt placed on wheelchair and sent to evaluation area set up with gurney. Physical exam shows abrasion on the right tempo/parietal area otherwise no step offs and no laceration. No spinall midline tenderness. Not intoxicated. No focal neuro deficit. Not taking any anticoagulants. Otherwise physical exam unremarkable, improved, and stable. Gave Concussion educational teaching and monitoring for 24 hours and ED precautions. This is not an allergic reaction. This is more likely vasovagal syncope with fall, head injury and abrasion on right tempo/parietal area. To send home with transport. Stable to go home. Called attending Dr., discussed case and plan for patient. Agreed with the plan.

Got shot Thursday May 6th, ran 103 degree temp Friday, Saturday had temp of 100 and felt like was going to pass out once around lunch, then a dizzy spell. Sunday morning (6:00 am) presented with chest pain for about ten minutes that subsided. Sunday night/ Monday morning at approximately midnight (12:00 am) presented again with chest pain that continued as we sought medical attention from local fire department, to which an ambulance was called, meds were given and diagnosis was heart attack from labs drawn at hospital. Took him back for a heart cath and there was no blockage. From everything I was told they couldn't figure out what caused the chest pain. He spent 2 days in CCU. He discharged Wednesday the 12th of May. He is now on Plavix, Coreg, a low dose aspirin, and Atorvastatin.

Close
5/19 PM, soreness. 5/20 AM Woke up full body soreness, headache, chills, blurred vision, exhausted, light headed, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site. 5/20 PM Did not want to move, full body soreness, horrible headache, chills, blurred vision, exhausted, light headed, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site. 5/21 AM Tired, temperature fluctuations, headache, extreme sweating, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site. 5/21 PM Started feeling better, mild headache, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site. 5/22 All Day felt pretty good, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site. 5/23 All Day full energy, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site. 5/24, 4 inch diameter circle around the vaccine site.

Close
APROX. 10 MINUTES AFTER THE VACCINE WAS ADMINISTERED, THE PATIENT STARTED TO COMPLAIN OF LIGHT HEADEDNESS AND STOMACH CRAMPING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PATIENT, I NOTICED THE PATIENT WAS SWEATING AND HAD A PALE COLOUR TO THE FACE, THEIR ARMS WERE IN A CRAMPED POSITION WITH WRISTS FLEXED INWARD. I ASKED THE PATIENT TO RELAX THEIR ARMS AND THEY SAID THAT THEY WERE. I CHECKED THE HEART RATE AND BLOOD PRESSURE, ASKED THE PATIENT TO SIT ON THE GROUND AGAINST A WALL, GAVE THEM WATER AND SNACKS TO HELP BRING BLOOD PRESSURE AND BLOOD GLUCOSE UP THEN CONTINUED TO MONITOR FOR 45 MIN WITH FREQUENT CHECKING OF BLOOD PRESSURE AND HEART RATE. THEIR BREATHING WAS NORMAL AND TALKING JUST FINE.

Site: Pain at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Numbness (specify: facial area, extremities)-Mild, Systemic: Tingling (specify: facial area, extemities)-Mild, Additional Details: Numbness and tingling of the arm in which the vaccine was administered, and difficulty moving fingers at times
30 2021-05-28 dizziness Reporting primary symptoms: headache, fever, lightheadedness, elevated heart rate, arm soreness, mus... Read more
Close
Reporting primary symptoms: headache, fever, lightheadedness, elevated heart rate, arm soreness, muscle soreness, back pain, nausea, suppressed appetite, anxiety, and panic attacks. (see below for more information) Initially, felt faint and lightheaded. Stood up and the feeling worsened. Within five minutes, felt nauseated and clammy. Also, appeared pale in the face. Was given instructions to sit, close eyes, and take deep breaths. Applied a cool, wet rag to the face and neck as needed. Was anxious and may have had a panic attack triggered by the experience. Heart rate had elevated, but not to a concerning level. Within 30 minutes of initial vaccine administration, face was no longer pale and heart rate was lowering. Other symptoms mostly subsided within 90 minutes of the vaccine administration. The next morning (5/19/21), woke with a mild headache, low grade fever, some fatigue, slight nasal congestion, and very sore arm. Took Tylenol for fever and it was mostly gone by the next day (5/20/21). Felt well enough Saturday (5/22/21) morning for lots of physical activity (push-mowed lawn in humid conditions) and only had a mild headache and mild fatigue afterward. No notable symptoms on Sunday (5/23/21) morning, but had indigestion, gas pain, and some soreness (back muscle) late that night. Stayed up a little later than normal. Woke a few hours early (around 4:30 am) on Monday (5/24/21) with throbbing low-to-mid, left-side back pain and worsened indigestion and gas pain. Had anxiety that led to a panic attack. Did not feel well and tried stretching, taking Tums, deep breathing, used the bathroom, and walked around. This was helpful enough to return to sleep. Woke up again at 8:45 am and had a mild headache, some soreness in neck/shoulders, and anxiety about the situation. Took a shower, did some deep breathing, and tried to relax. Drank some caffeine at noon, but the headache was not relieved. Appetite was somewhat suppressed and was mildly lightheaded. Stomach became more unsettle by night. Stopped all caffeine intake and NSAID usage (and still no intake/usage at the time of this report). At night, anxiety over the situation worsened, so tried deep breathing, talking to others about the situation, and stretching. Panic attack occurred, but was able to manage with the aforementioned techniques. Woke the next day (5/25/21) with mild headache, muscle soreness in mid-to-upper back, shoulders, and neck, suppressed appetite, and anxiety. Was able to manage most symptoms with breathing, stretching, relaxing, and talking through the situation. No panic attack on 5/25/21. Went to bed earlier than normal (around 9:30 pm) and woke on 5/26/21 around 9:30 am. Had similar symptoms, but appetite was more decreased and worsened anxiety. Decided to see doctor that afternoon (see item 19 for more information on testing from that visit) and was told to give more time to recover from vaccine side effects. Did not give doctor information about anxiety or panic attacks at that time. Had a panic attack (less severe than previous) Wednesday night and managed with the aforementioned techniques. Thursday (5/27/21) morning woke with no headache and no fever, but still some soreness in neck/shoulder area, suppressed appetite, mild fatigue, and mild anxiety about the situation. No panic attack on 5/27/21. Friday (5/28/21) woke with similar symptoms and decided to visit doctor again about anxiety. Was prescribed Buspar and Zoloft. After taking Buspar (first time ever) at 2:30 pm, experienced an increased heart rate up to 160bpm and a low fever up to 100.2F. Experienced another panic attack during this time. Sought medical assistance from local ER around 3:30 pm. Was seen and monitored until discharge at about 11:45 pm. During stay, tests and levels were mostly normal except during a panic attack that was triggered after blood was drawn. Treated with Vistaril around 11:20 pm and monitored for about 20 minutes before being discharged. Anxiety was relieved after deep breathing and relaxing. Did not take Zoloft. Slept and woke on 5/29/21 with mild headache, unsettled stomach, and mild anxiety. Anxiety is more manageable so far and other symptoms were somewhat improved after eating breakfast. Currently, no plans to continue taking Buspar, but will consult doctor.

Close
04/23 - Heart Palpitations and Extreme Dizziness/Confusion 04/24 - Miraine Kicked in (Had Migraines before) 04/31 - 05/17 - Heart Palpitations come back for a day, go away, come back for a day. Dizziness/Brain Fog/Confusion is maintained the entire time. A few intense bouts of dizziness in public that feel like Panic attacks. Chest pains throughout this time as well. 05/18 - 05/30 - Heart Palpitations mostly gone, Dizziness and Brain Fog linger but appear to be managable.
30 2021-06-02 fall Patient Fainted 2 minutes after vaccine. He was sitting in chair and fell (caught by family) and wok... Read more
Close
Patient Fainted 2 minutes after vaccine. He was sitting in chair and fell (caught by family) and woke up instantly. As I arrived, 10 seconds after fall, his eyes were open but he could not see anything. He was able to state his name, date of birth, and where he was, just couldnt see. "Everything is all black." After closing eyes for 30 seconds, opened and he could see, but everything was green. Vision color was back to 100% after 20 minutes but still blurry. Patient BP was normal. Sweating.
30 2021-06-03 dizziness Patient c/o feeling lightheaded and dizzy during observation period. Was noted to be diaphoretic. ... Read more
Close
Patient c/o feeling lightheaded and dizzy during observation period. Was noted to be diaphoretic. He was placed on a stretcher. His HR was noted to be in 40s and BPs low about 70's systolic. He was monitored for an additional 45 minutes. His BP recovered but his HR remained in the 40s. His physical symptoms resolved. He declined transport via EMS to the ED and was transported home in the company of his wife. Upon follow up call on 5/28/21, he reported being back at baseline. PCP follow up was arranged for him and happened on 5/29/21 at Health Clinic. EKG showed a HR of 50 with an incomplete Right bundle branch block. No further intervention was done.
30 2021-06-03 dizziness First dose: my face went numb and tongue felt itchy 1.5 hours roughly for symptoms. No common side ... Read more
Close
First dose: my face went numb and tongue felt itchy 1.5 hours roughly for symptoms. No common side effects; Second dose: calling it a panic attack. Racing heart, felt like I was passing out, mental fogging, trouble swallowing lasted about 1.5 - 2 hours. After 2nd dose I had the normal side effects, headache, chills, body aches fatigue.. After about 2 days of common side effects I noticed I was having trouble swallowing and it felt like I was being choked pulse food regurgitation and diarrhea. It kept getting worse and worse after a week or so of hell I get an emergency endoscopy showing I have eosinophilic esophagitis. I?ve been put on all sorts of meds that are supposed to be treating this but nothing is working. It?s been near a month now and 2 weeks have been on a hard core elimination diet symptoms are persistent and discomfort it spreading to what feels like intestines, kidneys and possibly other locations I now have to go in for a colonoscopy soon as the meds should be working and discomfort is spreading. Loads of headaches can?t sleep with all the discomfort. Never hungry. Possible permanent esophagus damage maybe more everything is still being diagnosed and no one is really finding any answers why. For the last 6 years I?ve been on a health kick working out almost daily and eating very healthy. No symptoms no warning signs these one or more diseases it has all just started out of the blue post vaccine nothing else in my life has changed.

Patient had his 1st. Moderna vaccine shot on May 4th. at 3 pm, he drove back to work at 3:30 pm, he fell on cement floor by standing on his feet after 3:30 pm and before 4 pm, he had severe head trauma that required to have two surgeries to remove his left and right side scalp to give room for his brain to swell, he was in ICU for 16 days, he is in hospital.

30 2021-06-13 dizziness, inability to stand Immediately after injection patient stated he did not feel well and passed out. He was extremely dia... Read more
Close
Immediately after injection patient stated he did not feel well and passed out. He was extremely diaphoretic and once he woke up began dry heaving and vomiting. He stated he was too dizzy to stand and just wanted to lie down. We called an ambulance to come and treat him. He explained to the paramedics he had been out drinking and partying late the night before and did not eat or drink anything before he came to get his vaccine. We determined that he was more dehydrated and hungover than having an actual reaction to the vaccine itself.
30 2021-06-15 inability to stand, dizziness Roughly 20 minutes after injection I quickly started to feel nauseous and light headed. I made me wa... Read more
Close
Roughly 20 minutes after injection I quickly started to feel nauseous and light headed. I made me way back to the pharmacy (barely) which was around 50' or less away. On my way there my vision started to fade away and go white then would come back. I made it to the counter, said I was sick, and collapsed on the ground as I could no longer stand. I quickly became more sick, became very hot, and started sweating badly. I needed to vomit but since I had not ate that day (not uncommon for me and the pharmacist was aware before I received the shot) I could not. At the same time as I was in the floor I had to put all of my concentration into not shitting my pants in front if everyone staring at me. I remember them asking me if I needed an ambulance and I don't remember responding or being able to process what was going on. They did call and ambulance and by the time they arrived I was feeling better. After collapsing they took my blood pressure while waiting for the ambulance and they told me afterward it was 81/61. When the EMT's were there they tested it several times and said it was normal. They also tested my blood sugar which was 111. They ran an EKG and said everything looked fine. They recommended I go to the hospital but I declined as I was afraid to get billed for it as well as not having a way back to my vehicle or most importantly someone to watch my dog. Though I probably should of gone. As an added possible beneficial piece of information, I went through a similar experience years ago when donating plasma.
