Close
Patient had Moderna Dose 1 vaccine administered at 8:55am and at 9:05am patient advised observation nurse that he was feeling cool, nurse then asked if the patient was feeling dizzy and right after patient?s head slumped over and his eyes rolled back and he went unconscious for 10 seconds. Immediately after, observation nurse ran and grabbed the patient's feet so he wouldn?t slide off the chair and removed his mask. EMS was called right away. Patient was diaphoretic, clammy and pale. Patient then was alert and oriented x4. Blood pressure was low at 90/56 and pulse at 66. Patient did not have anything to eat prior to coming in for vaccine. No known allergies.Crackers were given to patient and EMS arrived to the scene. Blood pressure was taken by EMS and blood pressure was 90/74. Patient was taken to hospital via EMS.
30 2021-06-22 fall, movement disorder trouble picking things up and raising his legs; Could talk but not rational; Fell on cement floor; B... Read more
Close
trouble picking things up and raising his legs; Could talk but not rational; Fell on cement floor; Bleeding from nose; Confused; Brain Swelling; Multiple skull fractures; Passed out; Brain trauma; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of CRANIOCEREBRAL INJURY (Brain trauma), BRAIN OEDEMA (Brain Swelling), SKULL FRACTURE (Multiple skull fractures), LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out), FALL (Fell on cement floor), EPISTAXIS (Bleeding from nose), CONFUSIONAL STATE (Confused), MOVEMENT DISORDER (trouble picking things up and raising his legs) and SPEECH DISORDER (Could talk but not rational) in a 30-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On 04-May-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 04-May-2021, the patient experienced CRANIOCEREBRAL INJURY (Brain trauma) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability, medically significant and life threatening), LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability and medically significant), FALL (Fell on cement floor) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), EPISTAXIS (Bleeding from nose) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and SPEECH DISORDER (Could talk but not rational) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability). In May 2021, the patient experienced CONFUSIONAL STATE (Confused) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability). On an unknown date, the patient experienced BRAIN OEDEMA (Brain Swelling) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability, medically significant and life threatening), SKULL FRACTURE (Multiple skull fractures) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, disability, medically significant and life threatening) and MOVEMENT DISORDER (trouble picking things up and raising his legs) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and disability). The patient was hospitalized from 04-May-2021 to 20-May-2021 due to BRAIN OEDEMA, CRANIOCEREBRAL INJURY, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS and SKULL FRACTURE. The patient was treated with Surgery (On 07-May-2021, right part of skull was removed surgically to control brain swelling.) for Brain oedema; Surgery (On 08-May-2021 surgery was performed to remove multiple skull fractures.) for Skull fracture; Rehabilitation therapy for Confusional state; Rehabilitation therapy for Movement disorder and Rehabilitation therapy for Speech disorder. At the time of the report, CRANIOCEREBRAL INJURY (Brain trauma), BRAIN OEDEMA (Brain Swelling), SKULL FRACTURE (Multiple skull fractures), CONFUSIONAL STATE (Confused) and SPEECH DISORDER (Could talk but not rational) was resolving, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out) had resolved, FALL (Fell on cement floor) and EPISTAXIS (Bleeding from nose) outcome was unknown and MOVEMENT DISORDER (trouble picking things up and raising his legs) had not resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. On 26May21 patient moved to a rehabilitation facility where he still remains 9Jun21. He awoke on 17May21 but was still confused. He is now making good progress and can now walk and talk but needed therapy to relearn these. He will need out patient therapy when they release him. He still requires surgery to replace bone flap and has to wear a helmet. The goal is that he will be normal in 6 months but he is still having trouble picking things up and raising his legs. No concomitant medications provided. No treatment information provided. Limited information regarding the events has been provided at this time and a causal relationship cannot be excluded. It is unclear what caused the LOC and fall that appears to have resulted in the skull and brain injuries and resulting symtoms; Sender's Comments: Limited information regarding the events has been provided at this time and a causal relationship cannot be excluded. It is unclear what caused the LOC and fall that appears to have resulted in the skull and brain injuries and resulting symtoms

Close
~a week and a half after Vaccine, I experienced 'room spinning' vertigo and dizziness at around 1am. I was sick for the next few hours, vomited for around the first hour after. Symptoms of dizziness for the next two days, then Vertigo/dizziness/vomiting again the following night. After around 3 more days, the symptoms subsided. I had my 2nd Moderna shot on 5/18/2021 (Lot 036C21A) and on 6/10/2021 the symptoms began again. After the first case, I saw online Urgent care and was referenced to an in-person visit to a primary care doctor. I was 'diagnosed' with BPPV, which I've never experienced symptoms of before. They ran me through several tests at the office, but by the time I got to the primary care doctor the symptoms had subsided again. I'm currently still experiencing a light dizziness 24/7 since 6/10/2021.

30 2021-07-16 fall Patient received his first Moderna COVID vaccination and went and sat down in front of the pharmacy.... Read more
Close
Patient received his first Moderna COVID vaccination and went and sat down in front of the pharmacy. About 5 minutes after his shot, a woman walking by heard him say he felt like he was going to pass out and caught him as he was falling out of his chair. Staff member heard the commotion and immediately got my attention. I instructed him to call 911 and went out to the patient. As I got to the patient he was beginning to regain consciousness. The woman said the patient had hit his head on the shelving that was behind the chair. I gave him some water and had him stay seated until EMS arrived. EMS checked him out and released him into the care of his family.
30 2021-07-21 mobility decreased you read that correctly, the 2nd dose was THE WORST! I am going to attempt to type this again, yall ... Read more
Close
you read that correctly, the 2nd dose was THE WORST! I am going to attempt to type this again, yall timed me out while typing. If the CDC hadnt asked then I wouldnt have bothered with your reporting system timing me out. Symptoms started the day of the shot, started with soreness and some sinus issues, however things escalated quickly! I received a high fever at one point (think 104 if I remember correctly) and everything went to DOWNHILL, stupid hot cold swings of massive extremes. One moment I would feel so hot it was like standing on the surface of the sun, then suddenly so cold it was like I was frozen on Pluto. I would get cold grab a blanket and be hot, then take it off and freeze, literally no in between, I was either severely cold or extremely hot. Experienced all the sinus issues, running, drainage and dryness back and forth, arm was basically useless, fatigue and lethargic symptoms were stupid extreme, I remember leaning up in the bed and trying to open a water bottle only to find out I physically was not capable of squeezing the cap enough to turn it, I had to attempt with every fiber of my being and last ounce of strength to turn that dang lid and eventually got it, but if it hadn't turned i likely would've died, just didn't have the strength to move. After 3 days of AGONY around noonish or 1ish I started to feel a bit better, like a switch flipped and the hot cold spells stopped. Things got better after that, but oddly some weird symptoms seemed to persist and currently still persist. Had very, very vivid and strange dreams for a while after (these seem to have subsided) and odd tightening of muscles that persist. Currently my jaw is tight on the right side and when opening it leans to right and sometimes pops. something in my arms, legs and wrists (I think its a ligament) tightens up and becomes sore. Not sure what that's all about, but I was asked to report this stuff so here it is!

Approximately 15 minutes after the vaccine was administered, the patient reported feeling hot and lightheaded. They begin vomiting and sweating heavily within 30 minutes after the vaccine. They felt very dizzy and were unable to walk from the clinic to their car and had to find a ride home from the facility. They were unable to return to their shift that evening.

Close
Vaccine was administered without complications. approx 5 mins after vaccine was given, patient reported feeling light headed, feeling like they were going to pass out. Patient was laying down, eyes open but was lethargic, still responding but slow to respond. HR was 47BPM however patient reported he was a runner and normally had a low HR. Blood pressure was 66/44 , patient was pale and diaphoretic. Pt was conscious the whole time, was put in supine position, cold compress applied. Patient denied chills, shortness of breath, difficulty breathing, nausea, chest pain. Pt was monitored, given oral fluids, and within 15 mins after event, vitals returned to baseline, HR remained bradycardic less than 60, no additional treatment was given and patient left after observation around 8:00pm.

Close

His companion asked for help from EMTs stationed in the room. After I spoke with the patient and at my suggestion, the EMTs helped the patient onto a gurney so he could recline and recover. The patient was fine after 15 minutes, declined further care, and walked out of the room in the company of his companion.

Patient fell backwards out of chair 3min after administration (later noted was lightheaded right before collapse). Unresponsive, seizure-like behavior initially. EMS administered epinephrine 0.3mg autoinjector into left thigh. By 3:15pm (5min after collapse, 8min after vaccine administration), patient was responsive. Patient eating snack bar by 3:34pm. Patient notes he has exhibited this behavior before with other vaccines and worksite wellness blood draws. Clinic nurse noted patient did not collapse until watching neighbor coworker receive vaccine. Co-workers noted this is a behavior they have witnessed him exhibiting before. Patient called and requested boost dose scheduling the following week; recommended he receive it in a healthcare setting and coordinated local hospital distribution for an appointment.

31 2021-03-13 dizziness Patient, Patient's wife, and Pharmacist were in immunization room talking post vaccination when afte... Read more
Close
Patient, Patient's wife, and Pharmacist were in immunization room talking post vaccination when after a few minutes the patient stated "I don't feel very good, it's happening." and his eyes rolled backwards. Patient was sitting and did not fall. Patient came to about 20 seconds later. Patient was helped to the ground and 911 was called. Patient was sweating, dizzy, and pale. EMT's arrived and took patient's vitals which were all normal. Patient told EMT's that this often happens post immunization and even when just visiting the doctor. Patient recovered and EMT's concluded patient did not need additional treatment. Patient left on his own accord with his wife.

Close
Patient was lying horizontal in his chair, he had lost consciousness in what appeared to be a syncopal episode. Patient was safely moved to the floor by healthcare team. Patient regained consciousness and appeared to be confused, sweaty, hot, and pale. Patient was assisted to gurney, laying flat with feet elevated until he reported his dizziness, light-headedness was resolved. patient accepted a water and snack. His color returned to his face. Patient was then alert and oriented. He was discharged from the clinic.

Close
Patient received vaccine and was fine until after a few minutes. He started to say he felt lightheaded. He placed is head between his knees, he started to sweat and I gave him some water at his request. He sat back and started to get pale and more sweaty, he complained about pain in his arm and neck. He then began to slightly shake and passed out. He was awoken very quickly by his wife who was standing in front of him. We kept talking to him and I checked his pulse and called 911. After about 30 minutes he was feeling much better and did not need to go to the hospital. His vitals were strong and he walked out on his own. I contacted him 3 hours later and he was resting but feeling fine.

31 2021-03-23 dizziness, fall Approximately 5 minutes after patient was vaccinated patient stood up and warned to staff technician... Read more
Close
Approximately 5 minutes after patient was vaccinated patient stood up and warned to staff technician that they were having a reaction. Patient then slightly stumbled as if they were about to faint. Staff technician caught patient by the arm and staff pharmacist helped bring patient slowly to the ground to lay flat. Patient noted no signs of difficulty breathing, throat closing or other respiratory symptoms. Patient breathing improved per patient once he was down on the floor and noted that while he was fallling he slightly lost consciousness. Local Fire department came to the scene and assessed patient's blood pressure and pulse oximetry. Patient BP remained stable at 115/81 while both laying flat, sitting on a chair, and standing up straight upon firefighter instruction. Paramedics were cancelled and patient opted and signed to drive himself home. Staff pharmacist persuaded patient to stay another 10 minutes after firefighters left to be monitored.

31 2021-04-06 dizziness At approximately 9:00 PM (roughly 11.5 hours after vaccination) I became extremely light headed wit... Read more
Close
At approximately 9:00 PM (roughly 11.5 hours after vaccination) I became extremely light headed with slurred speech. I experienced tunnel vision and dizziness. My face turned white, and my lips were a blue color. I sat down immediately, which improved my condition temporarily. But, within 2 minutes I began experiencing tunnel vision and dizziness again while sitting upright. I laid down on my back and elevated my legs. My vision returned and but I remained dizzy and pale. I experienced some numbness and tingling in my extremities. My wife attached a fingertip pulse oximeter to my finger at this time (we did not have a tool to check blood pressure on hand). My blood %SpO2 read between 95 and 98% and pulse ranged from 95 to 101 bpm. I did NOT experience: difficulty breathing, swelling of the airway, nor itching. Since I was not having difficulty breathing, and my symptoms seemed to indicate low blood pressure or potentially low blood sugar I decided to wait it out and see if my symptoms worsened. While laying on the floor, I consumed a glass of milk and a few oreo cookies, hoping to counter hypoglycemia (if that's what was going on). After approximately 15 minutes my condition began to improve - I could sit up slightly with only mild dizziness and color began returning to my face. After approximately 30 minutes, I was able to stand and walk to my couch and lay down. After around an hour, I was feeling almost back to normal with only a slight dizziness and tiredness remaining. 12 hours after the adverse event (24 hours post vaccination) I feel okay, slightly lightheaded but generally fine. I intend to call a doctor and discuss if any further tests are necessary.

Close
Vertigo and dizziness (which I?ve never experienced before) began this morning and can think of no other probable explanation, thought I?d share.

At 1120 am pt was complaining of feeling light headed, nauseated, diaphoretic. The patient stated " I feel like I am about to pass out." Pt was taken to recovery area and vital signs were taken. Initial vs BP 100/42, P:58, R: 18, 98% Spo2. Pt no LOC during assessment and while being monitored. Pt denies any known medical history and no current medications. NKDA per patient. 1130: BP retaken showing 102/70, P:72, Sp02: 98% R;18. No change in pt mental status A&O x4. 1145 last set of vital signs taken, pt ambulated prior to vital sign, denies any dizziness. BP: 118/70 P: 60, R:18, Sp02 98% RA. Pt advised he was feeling back to baseline prior to vaccine administration. Pt was monitored for 30 minutes, pt released home.

Approximately 10 mins. after receiving vaccine, the patient started c/o feeling warm and cold at the same time, headache, dizziness, confusion and hands feeling heavy. Patient stated that he is allergic to Benadryl. Assessment: Person was alert and responsive to questioning. Patient denied of mouth and neck swelling. None noted. Patient denied of SOB or trouble breathing. Noted facial redness and perfused sweating. Nail-beds pink, resp. 24 with deep breathing off/on. Trembling noted while checking pulse 92. Patient called wife on cell phone with a little difficulty in dialing cell phone. Wife spoke with patient and also EMT. 31 2021-04-13 dizziness So I got the vaccine on January 23rd and the Sunday following I started noticing I was getting very ... Read more
Close
So I got the vaccine on January 23rd and the Sunday following I started noticing I was getting very dizzy I went to the ear doctor they said it was not my inner ear so I went to a heart doctor and they did a tilt table test and the tilt table suggested orthostatic hypotension. The heart doctor did alot of heart tests and the heart is good. My vision was blurry with constant headaches went to an eye doctor and I have onset strabismus in my right eye and then I went to a neurologist because the tips of my toes were numb . The heart doctor has me on fludrocortisone and metropolol because my heart rate was very high all the time ever since the vaccine it was stuck at 130 to 150 beats per minute no matter if I was resting or sitting. My pupils oscillate and ever since the adverse reaction started I have had pupillary athetosis or hippus. Horrible brain fog can't think clearly or sleep well insomnia came with all of this as well. I go to the mayoclinic, because dysautonomia is expected.
31 2021-04-14 fall, dizziness Patient received vaccine and was asked to move to observation area. Shortly after sitting down the ... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine and was asked to move to observation area. Shortly after sitting down the patient came back to pharmacy counter and stated he was feeling dizzy. Just as the pharmacist was telling him to sit back down he fainted and fell on the floor. He recovered rather quickly (matter of seconds?) and tried to sit up right away. Pharmacist asked him to stay on the floor for a moment, the store's first responder (MIC) was called over to pharmacy. After a minute of sitting on floor the patient got up on his own accord and transferred to a nearby chair. His BP was taken twice per emergency protocol of pharmacy. Patient initially appeared calmmy and BP was 132/81, pulse 44, respirations 18 at 12:25p. BP was 142/89, pulse 48, respirations 16 at 12:35. Patient was given both a water and a Gatorade while he was seated. Patient stated he had not eaten anything yet for the day. Patient was repeatedly offered medical services (i.e. "Do you want a medic? Do we need to call an ambulance?") The patient repeatedly refused any further medical treatment. After further observation patient was able to stand, check out at the pharmacy and left the store on his own accord.

31 2021-04-30 vertigo, dizziness Hearing Loss; Extreme ringing in the Ears/ buzzing all the time/tinnitus got worse as of today; Dizz... Read more
Close
Hearing Loss; Extreme ringing in the Ears/ buzzing all the time/tinnitus got worse as of today; Dizziness; Vertigo; Headache; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of DEAFNESS (Hearing Loss) in a 31-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Ringing in ears. On 12-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 13-Apr-2021, the patient experienced DEAFNESS (Hearing Loss) (seriousness criterion medically significant), TINNITUS (Extreme ringing in the Ears/ buzzing all the time/tinnitus got worse as of today), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), VERTIGO (Vertigo) and HEADACHE (Headache). At the time of the report, DEAFNESS (Hearing Loss), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), VERTIGO (Vertigo) and HEADACHE (Headache) outcome was unknown and TINNITUS (Extreme ringing in the Ears/ buzzing all the time/tinnitus got worse as of today) had not resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No concomitant medications reported. No treatment information provided. Company Comment: Based on the information provided which includes a strong temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 vaccine and onset of the reported events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Headache is consistent with the product safety profile; Sender's Comments: Based on the information provided which includes a strong temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 vaccine and onset of the reported events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Headache is consistent with the product safety profile

Close
About 1 and 1/2 minutes after the patient received the vaccine, he knelt down because he felt "like a ton of bricks" and then he passed out. The patient said he started feeling light headed and laid down for a little. He started feeling better and sat down. Patient stated he had not eaten anything that morning. 911 was called as soon as the patient fainted and an ambulance promptly arrived. Paramedics checked his blood pressure and blood sugar, which was 48. They gave him glucose tabs and his sugar improved. He felt better and did not want to go to the hospital and left on his own.

I asked him to sit in in the post-vaccination area for 30 more minutes while I monitored him. He refused EMS services, but I was able to get him to have a family member pick him up to take him to the emergency room.

Close
I experienced a fever going to sleep at 05/25/21 at 2300h. My temperature reading was 97 F. I woke up on 05/26/21 at approximately 0120h feeling the need to urinate and was very sweaty, hot and thirsty. I sat down to urinate, and I felt dizzy standing back up. I was feeling very thirsty so proceeded to walk to get some water. I fainted after walking about 10 feet. I regained consciousness, and I drank water and ingested an Advil with the help of my wife. I felt a lot better after drinking the water, but still had a mild throbbing headache. I went back to sleep, and the fever symptoms came and went which affected my sleep quality. I drank more water any time I woke up. I took 2 more Advil as well at one time waking up. I woke up around 1300h on 05/26/21 feeling a lot better and a little more well rested. My fever symptoms are gone, but I am still a little sensitive to cold and feeling a little weak.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA. About 10 minutes after I got the shot I felt a small pain in the left side of my chest. It lasted about two minutes before passing so I wasn't very concerned, I thought it was just part of the shot. About an hour after the shot the pain in my chest came back much worse. Ten minutes after the chest pain my arms felt numb. I struggled with opening and closing my hands. I have terrible insurance, no primary care physician and don't have the money for hospital bills so i didn't want to go to the hospital. I slept a couple hours hoping I'd feel better when I woke. It didn't help. The pain and numbness lasted about two days, most of which I tried to sleep through. I still have a off feeling in my chest that I don't know how to describe. My family tried to getting me to go to the ER but I resisted for the reasons mentioned. I'm supposed to get my second shot on the eleventh but I'm scared of what will happen.

Close
Patient arrived to clinic for 2nd dose of Moderna covid vaccine. D/t past vasovagal reaction, patient escorted by superviser and nurse to an exam room for administration and observation. Pt reports not eating today, and did not take AM dose of Keppra. Patient councled on covid vaccine 2nd dose w/ 30min observation period, consented to administration. Vaccine administered to R deltoid at 10:25AM. After 10 min patient reported feeling lightheaded, BP 140/80 HR 80. After 20min pt w/ N/V, multiple instances of heaving, minimal clear vomitus expelled into emesis bag. Tolerated sips of juice. Additional nurse brought in to assist. Pt offered cold pack, somewhat effective. Refused intake of saltine crackers and other light snacks. VS 99.2, 142/82, 100, 20, 96% on RA. brought in to assess patient. Orders for VS q10min for 20min, continue observation, encourage snacks. Patient w/ increased restlessness, verbalized anxiety, c/o feeling itching/burning sensation around chest, neck, face and upper back. No visible redness or raised skin, no difficulty breathing, VSS minimal change. PT states "This is what happened before, I need to go to the hospital". order for PO 25mg benadryl x1. Administration tolerated well. Ambulance contacted, pt preped for d/c to hospital. VSS upon d/c 99.2 122/84, 78, 18, 97% on RA. States he felt better, dizziness and anxiety reduced, appears calm, continued N/V. Pt glad to go to hospital, concered about worse side effects occuring hours after vax administraiton. EMTs given nursing report and paperwork, pt discharged 11:45AM.

They gave me meclizine to take as needed and told me I should go to an ENT to get checked further. The doctor then took the wax out with a tool but bruised my ear drum due to this and gave me ofloxacin to clean the blood and said it would heal soon. I ended up going to the hospital two more times on 4/26/2021 and June 20/2021 and they just gave me amoxiciilin in June and said to see the ENT again I went to the ENT once in April and again in June and asked about ear wax and dizziness. 31 2021-07-19 dizziness Upon administering 1st dose of Moderna, patient had adverse reaction. After about 1 minute post admi... Read more
Close
Upon administering 1st dose of Moderna, patient had adverse reaction. After about 1 minute post administration, patients eyes rolled back, begin to shake and slumped back into his chair. I tapped him on his shoulder numerous times and yelled his name as appeared unresponsive. At this point I notices his lips were turning blue so I administered an epipen in his right thigh and yelled to Technician to call 911. Within 2 seconds of the epipen administered, patient was responsive. I asked him his name, birthday, and where he was. Patient was able to provide all correct answers. He stated he felt a little warm and dizzy. I continued to watch patient and ask questions until EMS arrived. I also provided him with a cup of water. Patient stated he did not have any allergies prior to the administration of the vaccine. After this incident he said he felt lightheaded before when giving blood. When EMS arrived his vitals were within normal limits and declined being checked out at the Hospital.

32 2021-01-07 posture abnormal, dizziness Fifteen minutes after vaccine administration, patient was sitting outside and had an episode of vaso... Read more
Close
Fifteen minutes after vaccine administration, patient was sitting outside and had an episode of vasovagal syncope. He became diaphoretic, thousand yard stare, limbs stiff, and then slumped for less than 5 seconds while sitting. He was lowered to the ground and legs elevated, supplemental oxygen provided. He came to within 15 seconds of initial symptoms. He stated he felt hot and ?woozy.? Vital signs: BP 107/69, HR 88, SpO2: 99, Resp: 16, temp 98.8. Blood glucose 127. Patient states he was out in the sun the day prior and did not hydrate as he should have. Cool water was provided and he received 500mL of saline IV. Patient was monitored for 2 hours post episode and was released back to work feeling good without any further issues. Patient stated he had a previous sync opal episode upon receiving some anxiety producing news in the past and states that this episode felt similar.

The following day I became increasingly fatigued, roughly 30 hours later I took a 2 hour nap. I became nauseous, dizzy, full-body tingling, laid on the floor near the toilet for about 20 minutes. My wife reported my lips became purple and I was pale. I assumed it was hypotension (vasovagal?) of some kind as I've had this happen after blood draws in the past. I drank a bunch of water to get my blood pressure up and smelled peppermint oil to decrease nausea. I was okay thereafter, but I slept around 13 hours that night.

Pt received dose # 2 COVID vaccine at approx. 0750. States he began to feel nausea, light headed and heart racing almost immediately. Did not report symptoms and returned to work after 15 minute wait. At approx. 0847 pt presented to primary care clinic with symptoms continuing. Vital signs at this time: 125/85 HR 67 SPO2 100% Temp 97.5 oral. ECG indicated mid and precordial left ST elevation. Based on pt history of prolapsing Mitral Valve Leaflet Syndrome, recent COVID vaccine and abnormal ECG, pt was transferred to the ER. Pt was not provided any medication at ER and was discharged home.

Felt hot at first, then chilled, and continued to switch between hot and cold. These symptoms lasted for about 5 hours with varying levels of severity. My temperature high was 98.3 F according to the infrared forehead thermometer I used throughout the duration of symptoms.

Patient stated "feeling better now." Patient instructed to go to urgent care or Emergency room if symptoms persist. Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to instruction. 32 2021-04-03 dizziness Felt a bit odd on the couch, little shiver and what felt like adrenaline. I got up and went into the... Read more
Close
Felt a bit odd on the couch, little shiver and what felt like adrenaline. I got up and went into the bathroom where the incident occurred. I used to be on 10mg of Ramipril years ago and moved to 5 due to light headedness when standing up. Yellow tinted vision, bright and sparkly. Getting up too fast with heart pressure meds prescribed for albumin /T1D and not for heart pressure. The secondary use of Ramipril is normal for type 1 diabetes after 20+ years. So I went to 5mg and haven?t had that issue since. I should also mention that when this used to happen to me I would lay down and recover with no problem. Back to the incident it felt exactly like that but on steroids. I was in the bathroom looking for Tylenol and I got light headed, yellow tinted vision, bright and sparkly, ringing in the ears, dizzy, and confused. I remember thinking I should probably get down on the tile floor and lay down like I?m used to from the episodes years ago with 10mg Ramipril causing the same symptoms but never anything so extreme. Next thing I know I?m on the ground waking up where I fainted and hit my head pretty hard on the way down. I probably have a minor concussion. Iced my head in the back where I hit it last night and this morning. Surprisingly 0 bumps, etc other than a little bit sore. Trying to remember going down is impossible. There is a strange, I guess it?s not strange as I fainted, but to me being 1 moment thinking what I should do then the next moment still thinking that same exact thing but coming to on the bathroom floor with parents yelling over top of me as I was at their house is strange. I recall what almost felt like a dream while I was out but I was wondering why everyone was asking if I was ok, of course I?m ok I thought. Then I realized what happened and crawled around on the floor the rest of the night if I needed anything and was checked every hour through the night which was horrible but necessary. Also my blood glucose was a 220 at the time of the incident according to my CGM so it didn?t have to do with low blood sugar. In any case I feel better today but in a fog with a slight headache.

Patient came in excited to get his first moderna covid vaccine. Got his dose at around 1230pm and was instructed to sit down for 15 minute post -vaccine to make sure he felt ok before leaving. We pulled a chair up to where he was so he could sit down. He reported to be warm, weak, and dizzy. He remained seated but was alert. He has no allergies, no medical conditions, no prior reactions to vaccinations. He last ate at 8:30am. He said he felt warm, but I took his temp again and it was 96.7 degrees. We gave him some water and he remained seated. After several minutes, he was able to get up and was fine with moving his chair away from the front registers and towards the side wall (within sight of pharmacy). 32 2021-04-17 fall This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes th... Read more
Close
This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (unconscious), HAEMORRHAGE (bleeding from forehead), EPISTAXIS (bleeding from nose), FACIAL BONES FRACTURE (nose is fractured), FALL (fell down from chair on the face down towards floor) and MALAISE (not feeling well) in a 32-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 06-Mar-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (unconscious) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), HAEMORRHAGE (bleeding from forehead) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), EPISTAXIS (bleeding from nose) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), FACIAL BONES FRACTURE (nose is fractured) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), FALL (fell down from chair on the face down towards floor) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and MALAISE (not feeling well) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (unconscious), HAEMORRHAGE (bleeding from forehead), EPISTAXIS (bleeding from nose), FACIAL BONES FRACTURE (nose is fractured), FALL (fell down from chair on the face down towards floor) and MALAISE (not feeling well) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant medication not reported. Treatment includes IV; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
32 2021-04-17 mobility decreased I went to bed 2h after the vaccine, but woke up at ~6h after to find that the injected arm was mostl... Read more
Close
I went to bed 2h after the vaccine, but woke up at ~6h after to find that the injected arm was mostly limp at the shoulder--I could only move it a bit before encountering muscle weakness and pain. I went back to sleep on and off until getting up at 17h after, at which point I could move the injected arm forward but not backward/outward. At 18h after, I took 1 capsule of Ibuprofen. By 22h after, I had regained full muscle range, with still some pain when moving it backward/outward.

While standing in line to schedule his second dose, the patient appeared to fall into the patient in front of him, in addition to landing on both his knees. After the event, the patient reported that after receiving the vaccine that he felt dizzy, and decided to sit down after receiving the vaccine in the waiting room. After a few minutes after feeling comfortable, the patient decided to stand up and get in line to schedule his second dose. He then proceeded to fall while waiting in line. He reported "seeing black" in addition to reporting sustained dizziness at the time of the fall. He also appeared to look pale. The patient was encouraged to lay supine as a wheelchair was brought to transport him from the waiting room to the urgent care for observation. The patient appeared to be in good spirits.

32 2021-04-20 dizziness I began to feel nauseous and lightheaded while brushing my teeth around 10:30 pm several hours after... Read more
Close
I began to feel nauseous and lightheaded while brushing my teeth around 10:30 pm several hours after I received the first injection of the Moderna COVID vaccination. I sat down and started feeling very hot. I passed out a few moments later. I woke a few minutes or seconds after passing out and was evaluated by EMTs. They said my vitals looked good, but strongly recommended I go to the emergency room for further evaluation. The ER performed and EKG and bloodwork, both of which were normal. I was told this was most likely vasovagal syncope and sent home. I have had a previous history of fainting from injury or injections. This was different because the fainting has previously occurred minutes or seconds after the triggering event versus hours. Since that night, I've been tired and experienced occasional lightheadedness. I saw my primary care doctor today (4/21) and he advised me to fill out this report.

32 2021-04-22 dizziness Received my shot, talked with the nurse for about a minute or two afterwards in the back and she inf... Read more
Close
Received my shot, talked with the nurse for about a minute or two afterwards in the back and she informed me that i needed to wait 10-15 minutes before i left. i go to the waiting room and set my alarm for 10 minutes. i texted my mother i was done and leaving to go back home soon and that my second appt was on May 11. she texted back, i responded once again that i will call her when i get home in just over an hour. Since i had no idea what to expect if something "did go wrong", i picked up my packet of information i received prior to my shot and started browsing through. i saw the possible serious side effects column and started to go through the list. At the time, about 5-6 mins now afterwards of my shot, i had no difficulty breathing, i did have a little tingling in my tongue, i read "a fast heartbeat", and put my hand on my chest and asked myself, IS MY HEART GOING FASTER? i looked at the paper again and put my hand back on my chest, and that was the last thing i remember until i was brought back to conscious by the nurses and doctors. i was told the guy in the waiting room ran after i passed out. when i came back to they walked me into the back, i was dizzy and profusively sweating and was drenched from head to toe , shirt and pants were SOAKED in sweat, they took my vitals for the next 40 minutes (3 or 4 times) i dont remember it too clearly until i started coming back to. Blood pressure was up and down and i was white as a ghost, they gave me fluids and i hung out until i felt superbly better about 40 minutes later. Then on my drive home, i had to pull over again, because i was getting light headed and felt like i was going to vomit. made it home, 90 minutes later, took a baby aspirin and slept the rest of the afternoon for about 5/6 hours before waking back up to eat some dinner.
32 2021-04-22 dizziness DVT; armpit turned purple with no sensation; armpit turned purple with no sensation; excruciating pa... Read more
Close
DVT; armpit turned purple with no sensation; armpit turned purple with no sensation; excruciating pain; axillary swelling in the right arm pit; body aches; headache; chills; brain fog; lightheadedness; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of DEEP VEIN THROMBOSIS (DVT), SKIN DISCOLOURATION (armpit turned purple with no sensation) and SENSORY LOSS (armpit turned purple with no sensation) in a 32-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 003B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event. Concomitant products included APIXABAN (ELIQUIS), OXYCODONE HYDROCHLORIDE, OXYCODONE TEREPHTHALATE, PARACETAMOL (PERCOCET [OXYCODONE HYDROCHLORIDE;OXYCODONE TEREPHTHALATE;PARACETAMOL]), PARACETAMOL (TYLENOL), OXYCODONE, DOCUSATE SODIUM (COLACE) and HYDROCODONE BITARTRATE, PARACETAMOL (NORCO) for an unknown indication. On 22-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 28-Mar-2021, the patient experienced FEELING ABNORMAL (brain fog), DIZZINESS (lightheadedness), MYALGIA (body aches), HEADACHE (headache) and CHILLS (chills). On 29-Mar-2021, the patient experienced SWELLING (axillary swelling in the right arm pit). On 31-Mar-2021, the patient experienced DEEP VEIN THROMBOSIS (DVT) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), SKIN DISCOLOURATION (armpit turned purple with no sensation) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and SENSORY LOSS (armpit turned purple with no sensation) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On 02-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PAIN (excruciating pain). On 30-Mar-2021, SWELLING (axillary swelling in the right arm pit) had resolved. At the time of the report, DEEP VEIN THROMBOSIS (DVT), SKIN DISCOLOURATION (armpit turned purple with no sensation), SENSORY LOSS (armpit turned purple with no sensation), FEELING ABNORMAL (brain fog), DIZZINESS (lightheadedness), PAIN (excruciating pain), MYALGIA (body aches), HEADACHE (headache) and CHILLS (chills) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Treatment medication - Eliquis

Close
Received vaccine at approximately 1040am. Patient then moved out to the monitoring area where approximately 5 minutes later stated he felt dizzy and proceeded to syncopize. Weak thready pulse. patient diaphoretic. Patient was transferred to the first aid area and vs obtained and revealed 82/40. He returned to baseline . He was monitored for an additional 30 minutes with no further incidence. He left clinic with wife at side.

Patient disoriented on arousal, legs were elevated by pharmacists to help aid recovery. 911 called and paramedics came about 10 minutes later to bring patient to emergency room. 32 2021-05-02 inability to stand, balance disorder "Symptoms started approximately one week after getting the vaccine. Initially had trouble getting up... Read more
Close
"Symptoms started approximately one week after getting the vaccine. Initially had trouble getting up from seated position. Sometimes feels off balance. He felt leg weakness and imbalance. He states it started to get better in last 1-2 weeks. He still feels tired. He says it is 50% better at this time. Patient can get up from seated position reliably at this point. He denies any autoimmune diseases or FH of Guillane Barre syndrome. Recommend MRI brain, C-spine, and T-spine at that time which subsequently revealed scattered T2/FLAIR hyperintensities suspicious for demyelinating disorder" - Neurologist Note on 5/3/21

32 2021-05-06 dizziness 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine while sitting I felt dizzy, started to see stars and was light... Read more
Close
5 minutes after receiving the vaccine while sitting I felt dizzy, started to see stars and was light headed. I also felt nauseous. The pharmacist had me place my feet up on a chair in front of me, gave me an electric fan to point at myself and an ice pack that I applied to my head and back of neck. As the stars began to subside I felt a lump in my throat. The pharmacist then instructed me to continue to focus on breathing. Within 25-30 minutes I was clear of all adverse affects.
32 2021-05-06 mobility decreased Upon presentation for 2nd dose, patient related that he had a stiff, sore arm with limited range of ... Read more
Close
Upon presentation for 2nd dose, patient related that he had a stiff, sore arm with limited range of motion requiring evaluation by a healthcare professional. He showed photos of his arm with a circle around what appeared to be an injection in the front part of the deltoid muscle area. Patient related that he visited FNP (noted in this report) for evaluation within a few days of the shot. Per patient history, he declined imaging or other scans and elected to treat symptomatically using Naproxen. Per patient, symptoms subsided after a couple of weeks to the point range of motion generally returned but soreness remains. Patient desired to receive his second dose to complete series which was administered.

32 2021-05-09 dizziness Patient came to Pharmacy counter a few minutes after receive 2nd covid Imz. Patient stated he felt ... Read more
Close
Patient came to Pharmacy counter a few minutes after receive 2nd covid Imz. Patient stated he felt very warm and like he may pass out. Patient has had this happen with out vaccinations, thinks it may be a fear of the needle. Ice Pack applied to Pt neck, given cold water and a fan provided. Patient immediately felt better. Had patient finish half a bottle of water and remain seated under direct observation for 10 mins. Patient left with no problems and was doing fine when I called him several hours later.

32 2021-05-12 dizziness client complained of dizziness after receiving 1st Moderna. EMT responded and PHN joined shortly. F... Read more
Close
client complained of dizziness after receiving 1st Moderna. EMT responded and PHN joined shortly. First vitals at 1419: blood pressure 145/92, pulse 92, oxygen 97%. Client sitting in chair, alert and oriented, slightly pale. Client stated sitting down at 1415, and felt "disconnected" for a few seconds and dizzy. EMT gave client water. Per client no headache, blurry vision, nausea, chest pain, shortness of breath. Client stated current medical history: migraines, no medications and no allergies. Client asked to stay 30 mins total for observation, client stated sat down at 1415. Vitals at 1428: blood pressure 143/92, pulse 94, oxygen 97%. Per client still dizzy, but improving. Client stated feeling a migraine was coming on. Vitals at 1437: blood pressure 140/90, pulse 90, oxygen 97%. Client stated dizziness improving, skin color normal, headache same. Last vitals at 1447: blood pressure 138/88, pulse 89, oxygen 98%. Per client dizziness resolved, headache same, but normal for his migraine. Per client felt fine to drive home. ER precautions given, advised to follow up with provider. Client left facility with steady gait at 1450.

32 2021-05-27 dizziness Approximately 7 mins after the patient received his first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine, he r... Read more
Close
Approximately 7 mins after the patient received his first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine, he reported that he wasn't feeling well. A nurse and a medical technician addressed his concerns and the patient was diaphoretic, lightheaded, pale, and vomiting. We immediately provided 1 adult dose of epinephrine, laid him down with his feet elevated, and contacted EMS. Once he was stable to walk we moved him into a private room to be further assessed by EMS. Vitals were taken every 5 mins until the patient was transported to a local hospital.

32 2021-05-31 vertigo Dizziness on standing; Muscle pain; Fatigue; Nausea; Headache; Fever; Blacked out; Hives; This spont... Read more
Close
Dizziness on standing; Muscle pain; Fatigue; Nausea; Headache; Fever; Blacked out; Hives; This spontaneous case was reported by a patient and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Blacked out) in a 32-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 022C21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concomitant products included ACRIVASTINE (BENADRYL ALLERGY RELIEF), PARACETAMOL (TYLENOL) and IBUPROFEN (ADVIL [IBUPROFEN]) for an unknown indication. On 16-May-2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 16-May-2021, the patient experienced URTICARIA (Hives). On an unknown date, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Blacked out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), DIZZINESS POSTURAL (Dizziness on standing), MYALGIA (Muscle pain), FATIGUE (Fatigue), NAUSEA (Nausea), HEADACHE (Headache) and PYREXIA (Fever). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Blacked out), URTICARIA (Hives), DIZZINESS POSTURAL (Dizziness on standing), MYALGIA (Muscle pain), FATIGUE (Fatigue), NAUSEA (Nausea), HEADACHE (Headache) and PYREXIA (Fever) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
32 2021-05-31 gait disturbance, dizziness, fall from 5/25/21 note: 32 y.o. male with a history of DVT (left leg; on Xarelto), recurrent PE, EtOH a... Read more
Close
from 5/25/21 note: 32 y.o. male with a history of DVT (left leg; on Xarelto), recurrent PE, EtOH abuse, anxiety, and depression presents to the emergency department complaining of right leg pain since the last two days. He reports to receiving his Moderna COVID-19 vaccination three days ago. Thereafter, he noticed his leg pain to occurs. He also notes to intermittent pleuritic chest pain, but not currently. He notes that his leg is not as swollen compared to his previous DVT. He has full sensation and motor control of his digits. He admits to dizziness. He denies changes in breathing, abdominal pain, recent surgeries, recent travels, recent hospitalizations, or family history of blood clots. History is from the patient Old records reviewed. Last ED visit on 3/2/21 for pleuritic chest pain. Recent hospitalization 2/8 to 2/9 for pulmonary embolism in the setting of Xarelto non-compliance. US LLE Dplx (9/26/2020) DVT in the left popliteal, posterior tibial, peroneal and anterior tibial veins. US LLE Dplx (2/8/21) Nonocclusive thrombus in the left popliteal and posterior tibial veins. US RLE Dplx (5/25/21; today) DVT in the right femoral and popliteal veins. from 5/27/21 note: Patient is a 32 y.o. male with history of EtOH abuse and recurrent DVT/PE known to be noncompliant with Xarelto presenting to the ED with altered mental status. Of note patient was discharged from the hospital this afternoon where he was treated for DVT with heparin, previously on Xarelto but due to noncompliance was discharged with plan for Lovenox. Patient is alert and oriented x3, however intermittently not responding appropriately to questions and does not appear to be the best historian. Per EMS patient was found down, unresponsive in a bush. Patient admits that when he left hospital he went to gas station and drank "18 ounces of wine." EMS states when they arrived to scene patient had unsteady gait, frequent falls, no signs of significant head trauma. Patient was tachycardic in route and noted to be hypoxic in route. Patient currently complaining of mild headache but denies chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, back pain or any further symptoms once again believe patient to be a poor historian.

Close
Felt fine as I got the shot, after 3-4 minutes I felt light headed, and passed out. After a few minutes (at most 5) woke up and immediately felt better. I believe this was due to the needle not the shot as I have felt light headed in the past almost any time I have gotten a shot. This was the first time I passed out though (usually I am already laying down, or able to without getting up. I was in a chair and could not).

32 2021-06-09 dizziness, motor dysfunction Within 30 minutes I felt confused and light headed and it reminded me of feeling like I had a concus... Read more
Close
Within 30 minutes I felt confused and light headed and it reminded me of feeling like I had a concussion. I had dark spots in my vision and intense pressure in my head. As I had been told to expect random side effects I went home and went to sleep early. The next day I had a lack of motor function with continued intracranial pressure and confusion. I called my doctor and went to the Emergency Room where my Blood Pressure was recorded to be Hypertensive and then retaken. I was given a CT scan and sent home. I was unable to work the rest of the week and was out of work after being sent home sick the following week. I continued to experience intense intracranial pressure and an inability to form short term memories for three weeks after vaccination. I still continue to experience intracranial pressure and episodes of hypertension but have more ease in forming short term memories. Intracranial pressure has nonetheless decreased significantly compared to the immediate onset following inoculation. My medical testing is ongoing.

I am reporting these symptoms on the third day after my shot and I have improved but only slightly.

32 2021-06-28 decreased mobility Ventricular hypokinesia; Chest pain; Hypokinesia; Malaise; This case was received via FDA VAERS (Ref... Read more
Close
Ventricular hypokinesia; Chest pain; Hypokinesia; Malaise; This case was received via FDA VAERS (Reference number: 1342336) on 15-Jun-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 15-Jun-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by an other health care professional and describes the occurrence of VENTRICULAR HYPOKINESIA (Ventricular hypokinesia), CHEST PAIN (Chest pain), HYPOKINESIA (Hypokinesia) and MALAISE (Malaise) in a 32-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. No Medical History information was reported. On 24-Mar-2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 25-Mar-2021, the patient experienced VENTRICULAR HYPOKINESIA (Ventricular hypokinesia) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), CHEST PAIN (Chest pain) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), HYPOKINESIA (Hypokinesia) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and MALAISE (Malaise) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). At the time of the report, VENTRICULAR HYPOKINESIA (Ventricular hypokinesia), CHEST PAIN (Chest pain), HYPOKINESIA (Hypokinesia) and MALAISE (Malaise) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 25-Mar-2021, Angiocardiogram: unknown (Inconclusive) unknown. On 25-Mar-2021, C-reactive protein: increased (High) CRP 6.3mg/dL. On 25-Mar-2021, Echocardiogram: unknown (Inconclusive) unknown. On 25-Mar-2021, Ejection fraction: decreased (Low) LVEF 45-50%. On 25-Mar-2021, Electrocardiogram ST segment elevation: unknown (Inconclusive) near diffuse ST elevations with the exception of lead V1. On 25-Mar-2021, Red blood cell sedimentation rate: unknown (Inconclusive) ESR 20. On 25-Mar-2021, Troponin: increased (High) Troponin elevated peak 11.9 ng/mL. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Concomitant medication was not reported. Treatment information was not provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was not applicable. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information cannot be obtained.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information cannot be obtained.

Numbness; Palpitations; Chills; Nausea; they were found anemic, with low blood pressure; severe adverse reaction; Intestinal cramps; Pain in knees and heap; Irregular heart rate; Intestinal colic; Diarrhoea; Bone pain; Reduced level of consciousness; they were found anemic, with low blood pressure; pain in their articulations; pain in their neck, heap; pain in their finger nails and toes nails; weren't able to stand up; huge fatigue; Fever; inflammation in their lymph nodes/Swollen lymph nodes; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of DEPRESSED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Reduced level of consciousness) in a 32-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 042b21a) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 15-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 16-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PYREXIA (Fever) and LYMPHADENOPATHY (inflammation in their lymph nodes/Swollen lymph nodes). On 04-May-2021, the patient experienced DYSARTHRIA (pain in their articulations), NECK PAIN (pain in their neck, heap), ONYCHALGIA (pain in their finger nails and toes nails), DYSSTASIA (weren't able to stand up) and FATIGUE (huge fatigue). On 18-May-2021, the patient experienced ANAEMIA (they were found anemic, with low blood pressure). On an unknown date, the patient experienced DEPRESSED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Reduced level of consciousness) (seriousness criterion medically significant), HYPOTENSION (they were found anemic, with low blood pressure), VACCINATION COMPLICATION (severe adverse reaction), GASTROINTESTINAL PAIN (Intestinal cramps), HYPOAESTHESIA (Numbness), PALPITATIONS (Palpitations), HEART RATE IRREGULAR (Irregular heart rate), ABDOMINAL PAIN (Intestinal colic), DIARRHOEA (Diarrhoea), BONE PAIN (Bone pain), CHILLS (Chills), NAUSEA (Nausea) and ARTHRALGIA (Pain in knees and heap). On 30-Apr-2021, PYREXIA (Fever) and LYMPHADENOPATHY (inflammation in their lymph nodes/Swollen lymph nodes) outcome was unknown. At the time of the report, DEPRESSED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Reduced level of consciousness), DYSARTHRIA (pain in their articulations), NECK PAIN (pain in their neck, heap), ONYCHALGIA (pain in their finger nails and toes nails), DYSSTASIA (weren't able to stand up), ANAEMIA (they were found anemic, with low blood pressure), HYPOTENSION (they were found anemic, with low blood pressure), VACCINATION COMPLICATION (severe adverse reaction), GASTROINTESTINAL PAIN (Intestinal cramps), HYPOAESTHESIA (Numbness), PALPITATIONS (Palpitations), HEART RATE IRREGULAR (Irregular heart rate), ABDOMINAL PAIN (Intestinal colic), DIARRHOEA (Diarrhoea), BONE PAIN (Bone pain), CHILLS (Chills), NAUSEA (Nausea), ARTHRALGIA (Pain in knees and heap) and FATIGUE (huge fatigue) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. No relevant concomitant medication was reported. Treatment information was not provided. Company Comment : Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 29-Jun-2021: Follow up received on 29-JUN-2021 was in native language On 29-Jun-2021: Translated document received on the date 9-jul-2021 is significant. patient details were updated, events were updated.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

33 2021-02-04 mobility decreased Patient complained not being able to raise left arm above shoulder right since 1/8/21 because of pai... Read more
Close
Patient complained not being able to raise left arm above shoulder right since 1/8/21 because of pain in shoulder. He recevied moderna dose one on 1/7, same side inj IM in deltiod. Exam: hand and arm strength equal right/left. Biceps reflex 2+ billateral. No swelling/pain on palpation of left deltiod. Over injection skin is intact. no point tenderness. No palpable Left acillary lymph nodes. MD search, no description of similar event so the pain may be temporarally after the vax, but no correlation. Disposition: Explained to patient, agreed to give him second shot on the other shoulderdeltiod. Ask him to to consult his physician re the the incidental symptoms on left shoulder.

Patient received the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. He reports symptoms of feeling faint; patient appeared very pale and diaphoretic. Vital signs 5 minutes post-vaccination: HR 39, BP 103/43, SpO2 96% on room air. Patient given water and candy in case of hypoglycemic episode. Patient remained pale and diaphoretic -- 911 called for further assistance at 1440. Patient denied shortness of breath, difficulty breathing, itching, rash, nausea/vomiting, or other signs and symptoms of anaphylactic reaction. EMS arrived at 1445 and assessed patient -- care taken over at that time. Vital signs improved after water and candy, patient refused hospital transfer. Wife beside patient at this time.

33 2021-03-04 gait disturbance, dizziness the patient, was given the vaccine at roughly 10:15am. At about 10:30am, after waiting 15 minutes af... Read more
Close
the patient, was given the vaccine at roughly 10:15am. At about 10:30am, after waiting 15 minutes after the shot, the patient stood up from his chair in the waiting area. He staggered over to the pharmacy drop off window and stated that he felt like he was going to pass out. His eyes rolled back and he collapsed. Another patient was approaching the counter at the same exact time and was able to catch him on his way down. By the time I ran from behind the pharmacy counter, he was awake, breathing heavy and confused. One of the pharmacy technicians called 911 immediately and started the emergency response. he was able to regain his composure and move himself back the chair. The EMTs arrived and took his vitals, and discussed what happened. They eventually determined that he was ok and was free to go. The patient did not go to the hospital.

33 2021-03-24 dizziness, mobility decreased At appox. 1313 a male party with a probable shellfish allergy reported feeling tingling and flush im... Read more
Close
At appox. 1313 a male party with a probable shellfish allergy reported feeling tingling and flush immediately after being vaccinated. His vaccinator, brought him over to the triage area to be evaluated. Upon RN 1's initial assessment at 1315 BP 159/85 HR102. Stated that in addition to a shellfish allergy he has a family hx of hypochondria and stated "I'm having a hard time distinguishing between what's in my head and what is real" 1324 BP 132/83 HR 90 Pt stated that the tingling/swelling feeling was going down but that he did notice what he described as "chest tightness" but thought it was anxiety related. Denies difficulty breathing or rash at injection site. 1339 BP 144/91 HR 84 had another cool wave and chest tightness. Denies SOB 1347: pt states "I'm having another minor wave" 1349: Pt states that throat is still scratchy or itchy but that he had an itchy throat this AM b/c of seasonal allergies. benadryl offered to the pt 1350: 50mg of benadryl administered by RN 1 1402: BP 144/98 HR 85 stated he felt better, chest tightness was improving. RN 2 discussed with pt that the way symptoms had progressed that if symptoms did not resolve completely within 15 min clinic staff would call EMS for further eval. 1415: Pt returned from bathroom and stated he didn't feel 100%. When asked to elaborate he said he was a little dizzy, was having some difficulty breathing and "rubbery legs" at this point RN 2 discussed with pt that clinic staff feels more comfortable having him evaluated for continued chest tightness and new SOB. Pt agreed to that. 1416 Requested EMS through Deputy. 1424 EMS was on site. EMS evaluated the patient and decided to transport him to the hospital for further evaluation. Patient left his car in the lot. Advised state office of this so it won't get towed if it's here over night. RN 2 will follow-up with patient tomorrow. 1429 RN 2 tx care to EMS with consent of pt and was being transported to ED. RN 2 provided client with her contact info and told pt that she will plan to call for further f/u with client tomorrow, 3/25. 1402 on 3/25: pt returned phone call and stated that he was much improved from yesterday. Was given another dose of antihistamines at ER and observed for further reaction. Plans to follow up with allergist to discuss potential for second dose. If he gets another dose of the vaccine he plans to do it at an allergists office.

33 2021-04-04 dizziness I received the shot in my left arm. Two things happened upon injection (1) I immediately began to bl... Read more
Close
I received the shot in my left arm. Two things happened upon injection (1) I immediately began to bleed from the injection site. I have been told the provider may have hit a capillary; it bled for about 45 seconds. (2) within 20 seconds of injection I felt faint and began to sweat; this was rather short and subsided within 2-3 minutes. I was concerned that because I began to bleed immediately after injection that the vaccine may have also been expelled, too. But given the following reaction just described and the soreness I continue to feel in my arm, I assume the vaccine was successfully injected. The shot provider was surprised at the bleeding, as was I, but unsure of the exact reasoning behind it.
33 2021-04-04 dizziness Patient lost color in his face, felt sweaty, lightheaded, and warm a few minutes after first dose (1... Read more
Close
Patient lost color in his face, felt sweaty, lightheaded, and warm a few minutes after first dose (10:04 AM). The warmness lasted 2-3 minutes, and then he felt cool. The lightheadedness subsided about 10:15 AM. This is when his mother called me over and told me what was going on. His BP (using automatic cuff) was 110/58 with a pulse of 55. He denied any other sx, and said he ate Special K Protein and soy milk for breakfast. We gave him a bottle of water to sip, and he continued to sit with his head near his knees. At 10:30 AM, his BP was 101/56 with pulse of 51. He said the lightheadedness returned slightly, but the sweatiness subsided. By 10:43 AM, he said he felt all better. At 10:36 AM, he took his pulse manually, and it was 66. By 10:43 AM, he felt "all better" and his BP was 135/75 at 10:54 AM, with a pulse of 57 (per automatic cuff).

33 2021-04-12 dizziness, vertigo At 11:08 patient slumped down in chair and stated "oh no, here it goes." Patient lost consciousness ... Read more
Close
At 11:08 patient slumped down in chair and stated "oh no, here it goes." Patient lost consciousness at 11:09am. I continued to speak to him and he was unable to hear initially. He did cry out and gasp and tighten then started to have a few slow jerky movements bringing both arms and body up from the chair. It appeared as if he may vomit and I repositioned to ensure he would not slide off of the chair. The movements lasted about a minute and then he started to come to. He described feeling dizzy, disoriented, nauseous, and sweaty. During the event his pupils were non responsive. At 11:17 he went pale and started feeling as if he was spinning and experiencing tingling. He was still reclined in the chair and sitting up aided with the tingling. He was given a cold pack to help regulate and given ice water at 11:18. He stated he had not eaten yet today as he usually doesn't eat until 11. His temperature had dropped to 96.1 vs 97.5 prior to the vaccination. BP was checked at 11:25 and was 120/72 which is lower than usual for him and to be expected with the LOC. After drinking his water, I had him attempt to stand while grasping the wall/table for 2 minutes to assess his steadiness, then standing unassisted for 2 minutes. After he felt steady enough we had him walk 10-15 feet and stand for another 2 minutes. Patient was feeling tired and instructed not to drive home. The situation was conveyed to his wife and they were instructed to seek ER/Urgent care if any of his symptoms reappeared. They stayed in the area to eat lunch and I checked in again at 12:12pm with the patient and he is feeling better after eating but still tired. I also recommended following up with his primary as I will be sending her a copy of this report.
33 2021-04-12 dizziness Patient received first dose of COVID vaccine at 1:10pm without issue. During his 15 minute waiting p... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of COVID vaccine at 1:10pm without issue. During his 15 minute waiting period post vaccination, at approx 1:15pm, patient experienced a syncopal event, + for striking his head. He never lost vitals, and promptly woke up. at 1:22pm, his vitals were initially BP 90/42, HR 45, pulse ox 100% on room air, and RR 16. He complained of dizziness and blurred vision, but was AOX3 with all cranial nerves intact. 911 was called for patient to be assessed. Vitals were then checked again at 1:29 pm, BP 110/62, HR 62, pulse ox 100%, RR 16. At this time, all of patient's symptoms had resolved. EMS arrived at 1:39pm and checked his BS which was 114. At this point patient no longer wanted to go to ER. EMS spoke with on call provider who gave verbal okey for patient to no go to the ER, but gave strict ER precautions such as headaches, vomitting, vision changes, etc. Patient was able to teach back. Patient reports that this (passing out) frequently occurs to him anytime he has to get shots or blood work done and he has seeked medical attention afterwards before with no resolution. Patient left at 1:46pm. He walked home.

He later told another front end associate following up with him that he actually had consumed whiskey. It is strongly believed that this played a large roll in his adverse reaction. It is believed that he experienced a mild syncopal reaction that was potentiated by the alcohol consumption.

33 2021-04-19 dizziness 03/28: At 9 PM (9 hours after shot), I rapidly experienced fatigue, fever (101 degrees), chills, ach... Read more
Close
03/28: At 9 PM (9 hours after shot), I rapidly experienced fatigue, fever (101 degrees), chills, aches, and slight nausea. I took my vitals during this time: SPo2 of 98-99%, BP was 123/80, and heart rate was in the mid-to-high 80s. By midnight, I felt much better and assumed everything was over. 03/29: Woke up feeling fairly tired. As I was trying to do my normal morning routine of cleaning up, taking out trash, etc. I noticed a shortness of breath. No fever or other symptoms from the night before. I checked my SPo2 levels with 3 different oximeters, and all gave readings in the 93%-94% range. My heart rate, which is usually in the 80s and 90s when moving about, was in the low 70s, bottoming at 72. This was nerve racking. This along with intermittent dizziness persisted for 24 hours. I got COVID tested and it came back negative. Flu came back negative, too. A consult with a doctor inferred that "everyone has different vaccine side effects." Not helpful. This shortness of breath/fatigue/low blood oxygen saturation continued persistently for the next 48 hours. I was essentially advised to stay home and rest. I noticed some lymph node swelling, too. By day 4, I was feeling much better. My heart rate had gone back up into the 80s, and my blood oxygen sat. had increased to 96-97%. I was still somewhat tired and got winded very, very easily. It's been over two weeks since my second shot upon writing this. I didn't want to report, but I can't make heads or tails as to why this happened. The only change in my health was taking the vaccine. I don't have any blood clots, asthma, or underlying issues. However, these side effects, if they are as such, need to be discussed. I know others who got the Moderna vaccine with similar anecdotes. The difference is, living with a clinician, I monitor my vitals all the time and knew enough to take measurements.

33 2021-04-22 dizziness Within 5 minutes of getting the shot, I got really lightheaded, and was given a bottle of water and ... Read more
Close
Within 5 minutes of getting the shot, I got really lightheaded, and was given a bottle of water and more time to be monitored beyond the standard 15 minutes. Approximately 4 hours later, I developed flu-like symptoms for 36 hours, including an excruciating headache. I want to Urgent Care on the 3rd day (April 3rd) due to my headache and run blood work. That same day, I noticed that I was easily getting lightheaded. Even today (April 23rd) I continue to have lightheadedness every day, with certain things triggering it (e.g., tie my shoes, holding breath during deep breathing exercises to alleviate chest pain, lifting weights). Anything that requires my head to be below my chest makes me lightheaded after 2 seconds. I thought I was going to have a stroke or brain aneurism on the night of Easter Sunday due to my headaches, so I stayed up all night thinking that I could stay alive.

33 2021-04-28 gait disturbance, balance disorder 33-year-old male without past medical history presenting with 10d of nausea and vomiting associated ... Read more
Close
33-year-old male without past medical history presenting with 10d of nausea and vomiting associated with dysequilibrium. Patient notes he received his second dose of Moderna on April 9. On April 16th, patient woke up and started to feel disequilibrium, unsteady on his feet. This was associated with nausea and vomiting. Patient will vomit about 2-3 times per day nonbloody nonbilious. He notes that the vomiting is associated with movements of his head. He went to urgent care where he was given prescription of meclizine. This did not work. Was also given prescription for prednisone and Augmentin for question of vestibular neuritis. This did not help either. Patient then went to see ENT today. He was told that his symptoms were not consistent with a vestibular process. He was recommended to go to emergency room for further evaluation. Patient has not been able to really hold down any food or liquids. He denies any fevers, chills, headache, vision changes, neck stiffness, abdominal pain, constipation or diarrhea, chest pain, dyspnea. In the ED, patient afebrile, HR 67, BP 135/97, RR 18, SpO2 96% on RA. Labs notable for Hb of 17.3. CT head -10 millimeter periventricular hypodensity in right parietal lobe chronicity.
33 2021-04-28 joint stiffness stiff joints, primarily around digits. lower cardio vascular strength.
33 2021-04-29 dizziness DIZZINESS
33 2021-04-29 inability to stand, balance disorder, mobility decreased 1 week after vaccine (rec'd vaccine 4/9, sx start 4/16) developed acute onset nausea, disequilibrium... Read more
Close
1 week after vaccine (rec'd vaccine 4/9, sx start 4/16) developed acute onset nausea, disequilibrium, and vomiting which was stable and patient was able to work. Then on 4/23 developed severe N/V and disequilibrium - could not move his head or stand up without needing to vomit. Received prednisone, antibiotics, and had ENT evaluation without notable results; no hearing loss/tinnitus. Eventually referred to hospital by ENT. Found to have lesion on CT head and subsequently had brain MRI (4/27/21) that showed multiple enhancing white matter lesions concerning for MS vs ADEM. LP was essentially normal (2 WBC, normal protein, normal glucose) with infectious serologies/PCR pending at time of submission. Received pulse dose steroids (1000 mg) per Neurology.

33 2021-05-02 dizziness Two minutes post-vaccination, mother noticed redness on patient's neck, and "side vein slightly bulg... Read more
Close
Two minutes post-vaccination, mother noticed redness on patient's neck, and "side vein slightly bulging". Five minutes after vaccination, mother noticed the patient was pale on forehead, followed by "overall paleness" a minute later. Patient reports feeling slightly light-headed five minutes post-vaccination. He said he also felt warm and slightly sweaty. Eight minutes post-vaccination, his mother said his earlobe "lost color". The patient reported feeling cool and sweaty around this time and still light-headed. 19 minutes post vaccination (at 10:06 AM), patient informed me of how he was feeling, and I checked his blood pressure. It was 93/47, with a pulse of 55. He felt very hot to the touch, but his temp was 96.8 degrees. He brought a water bottle to sip water as needed, and he was given a cool cloth for his neck/forehead. At 10:10 AM, patient reported feeling weak and didn't want to talk. At 10:13 AM (~25 min post vaccination), patient reported feeling a "bit better", and his BP was 104/57 (checked by other RPh). 34 minutes post-vaccination he reported feeling much better and was much less light-headed/able to talk. At 10:26 AM (~39 min post-vaccination), BP was 137/75, and his pulse was 60. 42 minutes post-vaccination, he said he was "mostly back to normal; ~90%". Then, 46 minutes post-vaccination, he said he was 95% better, and he said he was "good to go" 51 minutes post-vaccination.

The paramedics were called and when they came they took the patient's blood pressure and pulse ox and everything was normal. Symptoms were as follows: extreme stiffness/soreness/pain in entire neck, feeling of being strangled, shortness of breath, trouble swallowing, acute weakness and fatigue, cannot hold head up, feeling of falling forward, base and top of spinal cord pain and numbness, shooting pains and numbness in head and neck, loss of appetite, weakness and very minor pains in both arms, dizziness, brain fog. The neck and base of spine are still the most afflicted at this point in time and fatigue is ongoing. According to the patient's parent, no medical care was sought.
