Diagnosed with sepsis; Diagnosed with acute arthritic response; Felt feverish/fever of 103.8; Unable to walk; Joints were swelling; Felt dizzy; Sore in the knees and joints; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of SEPSIS (Diagnosed with sepsis), ARTHRITIS (Diagnosed with acute arthritic response) and PYREXIA (Felt feverish/fever of 103.8) in a 33-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 047A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 28-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 29-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PYREXIA (Felt feverish/fever of 103.8) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), JOINT SWELLING (Joints were swelling), DIZZINESS (Felt dizzy) and ARTHRALGIA (Sore in the knees and joints). On 30-Apr-2021, the patient experienced GAIT INABILITY (Unable to walk). On 03-May-2021, the patient experienced SEPSIS (Diagnosed with sepsis) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant) and ARTHRITIS (Diagnosed with acute arthritic response) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). The patient was hospitalized on 03-May-2021 due to ARTHRITIS and SEPSIS, and then for 3 days due to PYREXIA. At the time of the report, SEPSIS (Diagnosed with sepsis), ARTHRITIS (Diagnosed with acute arthritic response), PYREXIA (Felt feverish/fever of 103.8), GAIT INABILITY (Unable to walk), JOINT SWELLING (Joints were swelling), DIZZINESS (Felt dizzy) and ARTHRALGIA (Sore in the knees and joints) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant medications were not provided by the reporter. Patient received antibiotics (unspecified) in the hospital for treatment of events. Patient received Moderna COVID-19 Vaccines at outside facility on 4/1/21 and 5/19/21. On 7/11/21, patient presented to ED with sudden onset right eye vision loss while driving earlier that night. He states that he completely lost vision in the right eye for 2 to 3 minutes. It has since come back but now is blurred. He denies any headache or eye pain. Visual acuity screening reveals Right Eye 20/25, L Eye 20/20 and bilateral 20/25. The pupil is reactive. There is no evidence of retinal detachment by ultrasound. CT CTA did not reveal any evidence of carotid artery disease. COVID-19 status positive on 7/12/21. Patient is admitted to the inpatient unit with neurology consult. Neurology assessment: description sounds highly consistent with amaurosis fugax, and in the setting of known extensive cardiac history and possible hypercoagulability in the setting of positive COVID, would be concerned for an embolic event. Positive COVID despite getting Moderna vaccine x2. No respiratory symptoms, but concern for possible hypercoagulability event (embolic TIA causing some transient right eye vision loss). Patient is still admitted as of 7/12/21 with additional tests being performed.

On an unknown date, the patient experienced DIZZINESS (Felt faint/ felt dizzy) and FALL (Fell to the ground). The patient was hospitalized on 18-May-2021 due to ALTERED STATE OF CONSCIOUSNESS, ARTHRALGIA, BALANCE DISORDER, COLD SWEAT, HEADACHE, HYPOAESTHESIA, HYPOAESTHESIA ORAL, NASOPHARYNGITIS, PARAESTHESIA, PARAESTHESIA ORAL and TREMOR. No treatment information was provided. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 01-Jul-2021: Follow-up received on 01-Jul-2021: contains no new information (NNI).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded
33 2021-07-18 fall, movement disorder, dizziness It completely messed me up. After I got the vaccine I got the normal symptoms, fever, chills, cough,... Read more
Close
It completely messed me up. After I got the vaccine I got the normal symptoms, fever, chills, cough, and then I started having trouble breathing and very major back pain and chills. I ended up getting pretty bad hypothermia my body tempt dropped down to 91.2, my whole right side of my body was completely numb to the point I could not move my right arm or leg. 2-3 days later I ended up passing out in my bedroom. I was out of work for about a month and a half. I remember being very weak and trying to call for help and I just blacked out completely confused. I woke up again and then I tried to get up but I was to weak so I fell down in my bed. I blacked out again. I woke up very confused not knowing where I was. it took me a minute or two to realize I was still in my bedroom. I could not breathe so I drove to the hospital. They said I had double pneumonia, they gave me antibiotics, They also gave me an emergency inhaler that I am still using sometimes. I still sometimes have attacks that I cannot breathe and sometimes I cough off phlegm out of my lungs. Also, palpitations rapid and slow palpitations. Also, light headedness, I walk around and I felt very dizzy so I would have to sit down and catch my breath. I lost taste and smell. My oxygen levels dropped too below 95.

Systemic: Chills-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Exhaustion / Lethargy-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Tingling (specify: facial area, extemities)-Medium, Systemic: Visual Changes/Disturbances-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Additional Details: Within 5 minutes of receiving vaccine, patient alerted store personnel that he was "seeing stars" and have impaired hearing (sounds like underwater). Within 10 minutes, he started feeling chills and sweating; he reported feeling weak, unable to walk or drive and had tingling on his forearms. He was offered acetaminophen and Benadryl. He refused Benadryl but took on tablet of acetaminophen 500mg. At about 25 minutes post-injection, he reported feeling better and refused paramedics.

34 2021-02-20 dizziness Patient complained about feeling dizzy about 10 minutes after receiving vaccine. Before that time, h... Read more
Close
Patient complained about feeling dizzy about 10 minutes after receiving vaccine. Before that time, he and I had been talking, and he said he had felt fine. He was put in a reclining chair and continued to feel dizzy, experienced a mild headache, slightly scratchy throat and skin and nausea. For a minute or so, he stopped answering my questions. At that point, I was becoming concerned this could be an allergic reaction, versus vasovagal episode. His vital signs were done, essentially normal with exception of elevated BP. he was given diphenhydramine 50 mg IM and stated about 5 minutes after that, that his symptoms were slightly better. 911 was called when he seemed to be getting worse, not lucid. . EMTs assessment was same as mine, allergic reaction versus vasovagal. His EKG NSR, vitals remained the same. BP still high, not dropping. EMS staff suggested he go to ED, which patient declined. He was feeling better about 1 hour later.

I don't recall the events for the next 60 seconds. My wife said that I fell on the bed, was unresponsive, saw foaming at the mouth, had seizure, and urinated in my pants. She adjusted the bed so that my head is up, and threw cold water at my face, mouth and teeth, which made me responsive, and then walked me to the bathroom. During the night, I had fever, Chill, pain at injection site, vomit, nausea, headache, light-headed. I didn't have appetite in the morning and had nausea and headache. I felt better ~3pm when I could finally eat rice, yogurt and chicken. I am feeling well now, but worry that the seizure had caused any long term damage.

Close
lost 70-80% of sight; dizzy; ringing in ear; all sounds were coming down a tunnel; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning a 34-year-old old, male patient who experienced 70-80% blindness, dizziness, and ringing in his ear. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant product use was not provided/unknown by the reporter. On 10FEB2021, prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number not provided) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. Patient got first dose of Moderna vaccine on 10FEB2021 in left non dominant arm. Patient notes he has always had a reaction to anything external going in his body. After receiving vaccine, he felt fine for about 5 seconds then felt dizzy, lost 70-80% of sight and had ringing in his ear. Patient said all sounds were coming down a tunnel. Patient asked for a place to lie down and symptoms resolved about 2 minutes later. Patient wants to know if it is safe to get second dose. Also wants to know if he can change vaccination facility for second dose. Treatment information was not provided/unknown. The events resolved on same day.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 34 year old, male patient, who experienced a serious unexpected event of blindness transient, among other non-serious events, after receiving first dose mRNA-1273 (Lot# unknown). Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.

Close
Patient entered to observation after receiving the covid vaccine. started to report feeling dizzy and fainted. patient began to keel over, and was escorted by two nurses on the floor. Patient did not hit his head, and no sustain injury on the way down. Patient was placed on supine position with legs elevated. Peep breathing exercises encouraged. Vitals were initiated and recorder. Patient had a syncopal episode, responded to sternal rub. Patient lost consciousness again and once again responded to sternal rub. Vitals were initiated and EMS was activated. Patient vitals were stable with one orthostatic hypotension. Patient reported feeling better and refused to go to the hospital with EMS. Patient was escorted out of building visibly looking better, no pale noted, left site at 1:30 PM.

On 01/26/21, developed visual disturbance to lateral part of left eye with focal blurriness and red color around objects that lasted approximately 1 hour. On 02/16/21, developed severe neck pain and lightheadedness. Symptoms of lightheadedness, left arm pain, left shoulder pain, neck pain, and numbness/tingling in left hand continue to present. On 03/31/21, visual disturbance returned to lateral part of left eye with zigzagging patterns and blurriness. Treatment initiated on 04/01/21 with cyclobenzaprine 10mg oral daily. Prednisone initiated on 04/05/21 with 40mg oral daily x 3 days and 20mg oral daily x 3 days.

34 2021-04-07 dizziness Patient was vaccinated with COVID19 vaccine. Within approx 2mins patient became clamy, pale, and ha... Read more
Close
Patient was vaccinated with COVID19 vaccine. Within approx 2mins patient became clamy, pale, and had a syncopal episode. Patient was seated at the time of the episode. Patient regained conciousness and stated this has happened once before when having blood drawn. EMS was onsite of vaccine clinic and responded immediatley. Patient was evaluated by EMS and it was decided patient will be brought to the hospital. While being put into the rig the patient again said he felt faint and had another syncopal episode. EMS loaded patient into the rig and brought him to hospital. ALS was called by EMS which they met with enroute to Hospital
34 2021-04-07 fall He received the Moderna vaccine dose #1 at 10:27. He sat in a chair for his 15 minute monitoring pe... Read more
Close
He received the Moderna vaccine dose #1 at 10:27. He sat in a chair for his 15 minute monitoring period. He was noted at 10:36 to be unresponsive in the chair as well as pale and limp. He was moved to the floor where he had agonal breathing and HR >100. His neck was tilted to facilitate respirations. He was clammy and continued to be unresponsive for 90 seconds. EMS called. He had a period of postictal agitation with bilateral lower extremity failing for approximately 20 seconds. He then became responsive but still pale and clammy. He moved to a sitting position after 4 minutes of being awake and alert. EMS arrived, assessed him and left without transport. He left with his cousin who is driving him home. Instructed him to seek medical care for evaluation of this and prior episodes. Instructed him to seek clearance before next vaccination.

Some lightheadedness upon vaccine given. Lightheadedness constant with body aches, body chills, headache, nausea and fever. These symptoms have been constant for going on 6 days. I can't smell or taste as of 4/8/2021, but I do not know if that is from seasonal allergies or vaccine. As of 4/9/2021, still have headache, body aches and weakness.

Pt became unresponsive after his dose. He started to slouch in the chair and shake. He was unable to communicate. I was able to get him to the floor and that's when he started to regain some of consciousness. After feeling better he stated that he wasn't able to hear anything during the episode. He did not wish to seek medical care.

34 2021-04-09 dizziness felt like he was about to pass out; felt dizzy; felt like his heart was racing; felt like he had a c... Read more
Close
felt like he was about to pass out; felt dizzy; felt like his heart was racing; felt like he had a cold; felt like he wanted to sleep; felt nauseous; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of PRESYNCOPE (felt like he was about to pass out) in a 34-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 018B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No medical history reported). On 29-Mar-2021 at 8:45 AM, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 29-Mar-2021, the patient experienced PRESYNCOPE (felt like he was about to pass out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), DIZZINESS (felt dizzy), PALPITATIONS (felt like his heart was racing), NASOPHARYNGITIS (felt like he had a cold), SOMNOLENCE (felt like he wanted to sleep) and NAUSEA (felt nauseous). On 29-Mar-2021, PRESYNCOPE (felt like he was about to pass out), DIZZINESS (felt dizzy), PALPITATIONS (felt like his heart was racing), NASOPHARYNGITIS (felt like he had a cold), SOMNOLENCE (felt like he wanted to sleep) and NAUSEA (felt nauseous) had resolved. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No concomitant drugs were reported. On 29 Mar 2021, the patient went to emergency room and was monitored for a couple hours, not medical treatment was provided for side effect relief.; Sender's Comments: This case concerns a 34-year-old male with a serious unexpected event of presyncope, palpitations, and nonserious unexpected dizziness, somnolence, palpitations, nasopharyngitis and expected nausea. Event onset Day1 after first dose. Events resolved. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

?Covid arm?. Swelling and itching in left arm at injection site one week after injection. Felt a sharp pain/?pinch? in left armpit starting two days prior to appearance of swelling. Swelling currently feels the size of a small chicken egg. Armpit still feels slightly ?pinched? and movement in that armpit feels very slightly restricted. Swelling sore is itchy and red, although it is currently hard to tell if the redness is from scratching or inherent to the area.
34 2021-04-11 dizziness client complained of dizziness after receiving 1st dose Moderna Covid Vaccine (lot# 0421321A, Exp. 5... Read more
Close
client complained of dizziness after receiving 1st dose Moderna Covid Vaccine (lot# 0421321A, Exp. 5/7/21). At 1415 client reported to EMT feeling dizzy. EMT performed first assessment and gave water. Vitals: blood pressure: 110/70, pulse 77, oxygen 96%. Client alert and oriented. Current medical conditions: HIV and diabetes. Medications: clonazepam, alprozolam, aprovasc, metroprolol, bictegravir, metformin, and aspirin. Informed client we would extend his observation period. Within 5 minutes client stated improvement. 1530 vitals: blood pressure: 130/80, pulse 76, oxygen 96%. Client stated feeling much better. Vitals 1440: blood pressure 140/90, pulse 68, oxygen 97%. Client stated symptoms had resolved. Client advised to consult with provider prior to receiving second dose. Client drove himself today, stated feeling fine to drive. Last set of vitals at 1448: blood pressure 138/84, pulse 82, oxygen 96%. Per client dizziness resolved. ER precautions given. Client left facility at 1450 with steady gait.

34 2021-04-13 dizziness Pt reported feeling lightheaded in observation area after given vaccination. Pt drank some of the wa... Read more
Close
Pt reported feeling lightheaded in observation area after given vaccination. Pt drank some of the water he had with him and then rested his head on the ground. Pt reported worsening feeling so moved back to shot administration area for closer observation. Pt again rested head on ground and appeared to go limp and pass out briefly. Pt quickly came back and was alert and orientated. 911 called. Pt remained awake and alert on ground until EMS arrived. EMS noted dehydration and labile BP\Pulse. Pt transported to local hospital.
34 2021-04-13 fall, dizziness Patient was given a timer and asked to stay in the area. He felt fine, so he walked to the bakery a... Read more
Close
Patient was given a timer and asked to stay in the area. He felt fine, so he walked to the bakery area and spoke with another pt, at the muffins display. He said his arm felt "weird" and said that happened to her, too. He said he started feeling lightheaded and was leaning against the case. He said, " I blinked, fell to the ground and next he saw people standing around him." He said, no nausea, just lightheaded and he hit the side of his head lightly. Staff helped him into a wheelchair and took him to the office. I spoke with him in the office and asked him if he wanted to go to the hospital. I received this information from the patient when I asked him if he could tell me what happened. He was sweating and pale, but no nausea, no disturbance in his vision and his blood pressure wasn't elevated. He told me again that he took no regular medication, but a couple of years ago he had been dizzy after a tetanus shot. I asked again if he had any discomfort or pain anywhere and he said only his arm felt sore near the shot. I asked again if he felt like he would like to go to the hospital and he said no. His family came and picked him up.

20mins after the shot. I rapidly developed a fever and had trouble seeing. Felt like fainting. Really nauseous stomach and diarrhea. Chills but with a high fever. Threw up 25mins after shot. Immediately after that felt really nauseous and couldn?t see straight. Vision was black and I was seeing stars. Felt like hallucinating really bad. Couldn?t focus my vision. Got home and showered with a really hot shower and immediately started feeling better. 45mins to 1 hour after shot started feeling way better! Just sluggish the rest of the night. For some reason was fighting going to sleep and fell asleep sitting up. Next day much better!

Close
Side effects started after 4 minutes of the shot. I started with nausea, followed by shortness of breathe as well as heart pacing at a faster rate. The feeling was uncomfortable, so I stood up to walk around. After 15 seconds, I felt very nauseous as weak. Hey went to sit back down, but felled while trying to sit. I was able to sit back up and started to shake/shiver and sweat heavily. This happen for over 15 minutes, than it felt as it was coming and going.(the side effects) for the next 40 minutes, I felt very weak and stiff in the left arm. After another 20 minutes, I started to feel better/normal. My arm started to feel less stiff. Waited another hour and half total before discharged from the clinic.

34 2021-04-25 dizziness, fall On 04/25/21 at 12:30pm, patient received first dose of Moderna Vaccine. Patient was clear-headed and... Read more
Close
On 04/25/21 at 12:30pm, patient received first dose of Moderna Vaccine. Patient was clear-headed and alert, but appeared anxious at the time of receiving the vaccine. 15 minutespost vaccination, patient suddenly fainted to ground within pharmacist?s sight. RPh on duty immediately ran to patient and called for help. Patient remained laying down, until he was able to open his eyes and safely sit up. RPh on duty and front end managers were at the scene, patient was provided with water and offered 911/ambulance for help. Patient denied, stating he "is fine" and wanted to sit down before deciding before calling 911. Per pt, he didn?t think he hit his head when he fainted, but he fell on the side of his temple. RPH on duty observed patient for another 30 minutes until 1:15PM. Per patient, he only had a small breakfast and a kombucha in the morning. He also has history of fainting/anxiousness from vaccine about 20 years ago, and another fainting history while he was taking an exam. Patient mentioned he was very anxious prior to receiving the shot. Patient doesn't have any medical history and is not taking any medications or other illicit drugs. Patient lives by himself so he doesn't have anyone to watch over him when he goes home and at 1:15PM. Patient stated he still feels dizzy, nausea, and arm tingling. Front end manager called 911/Ambulance, medics arrived around 1:20PM. blood glucose, blood pressure, pulse and oxygen were checked. Medics also checked patient?s memory (asked what day it was, what year, who the president is, etc). Medics told patient that he can decide the following options: 1: to have family/friend to come pick him up and take him home OR 2: they can take him to nearby hospital for checkup. Patient lives alone so he decided to go to the hospital to have check up to "make him feel better". Patient was transported to the hospital around 1:37 PM. Both RPh on duty and front end managers were at the scene the whole time. Patient seemed to be in full command of his faculties and was following instructions at time of departure. Prior to leaving the premise, patient was advised to have someone accompany him at next dose appointment by RPh on duty. Caring call was made around 9:20AM the next day 4/26/2021. LM was left and wait for patient response. Store Director and Pharmacy Manager were notified. Pharmacy District Manager was called for alternative administration options for second dose.
34 2021-04-25 fall Patient had a syncope episode and fell to ground
34 2021-04-26 dizziness, vertigo anaphylaxis reaction; severe allergic reaction; throat closing up/throat started swelling; dizzy; la... Read more
Close
anaphylaxis reaction; severe allergic reaction; throat closing up/throat started swelling; dizzy; lack of appetite; vertigo; headaches; started to feel hot; breaking out in a rash/skin began to break out; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION (anaphylaxis reaction) in a 34-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 039A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 05-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 05-Apr-2021, the patient experienced ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION (anaphylaxis reaction) (seriousness criterion medically significant), ALLERGY TO VACCINE (severe allergic reaction), PHARYNGEAL SWELLING (throat closing up/throat started swelling), DIZZINESS (dizzy), DECREASED APPETITE (lack of appetite), VERTIGO (vertigo), HEADACHE (headaches), FEELING HOT (started to feel hot) and RASH (breaking out in a rash/skin began to break out). At the time of the report, ANAPHYLACTIC REACTION (anaphylaxis reaction), ALLERGY TO VACCINE (severe allergic reaction), PHARYNGEAL SWELLING (throat closing up/throat started swelling), DIZZINESS (dizzy), DECREASED APPETITE (lack of appetite), HEADACHE (headaches), FEELING HOT (started to feel hot) and RASH (breaking out in a rash/skin began to break out) had resolved and VERTIGO (vertigo) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Treatment included: Epinephrine given in hospital, Benadryl and Predisone Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the events a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
34 2021-04-27 dizziness Pt developed dizziness, and weakness shortly after vaccination. He notes that he had significant anx... Read more
Close
Pt developed dizziness, and weakness shortly after vaccination. He notes that he had significant anxiety prior to the vaccination. No respiratory issues or airway issues reported. No skin involvement reported or GI symptoms. Pt was noted to be pale. BP 78/50, HR 77, SP02 93%. BP and SP02 improved to 90/72 and 97%. Pt improved without intervention. EMS was offered but pt elected to drive home. He was encouraged to call for a ride but he declined and stated that he felt well enough to drive.

Close
Client received the 1st COVID vaccine Moderna Lot #007C21A expiration date 10/12/2021. Client reported cold sweat, nausea, and slight headache to our Medic and requested for a blood pressure check. Client was sitting in chair and also stated to Medic "I participate in intermittent fasting, last time I ate was yesterday. I felt dizzy 8 minutes into my 15 minute waiting period." Medical history includes history of anxiety and bipolar disorder, currently takes medication lamictal. Interventions done for client include laying down in gravity chair and vital signs were taken at 12:03 PM: BP 158/96; pulse 78, respirations 18. Orthostatic vital signs were taken at 12:08 PM BP 162/100; pulse 78. Client was alert and oriented x4 during whole interaction with Medic . Client refused 911 call. At 12:16 PM client verbalized symptoms resolved and nurse recommended for stable vitals before being able to leave facility. Final vital signs were taken at 12:25 PM: BP 148/82; pulse 76; oxygen saturation of 99%. Client left facility walking safely with steady gait at 12:30 PM.

34 2021-05-07 dizziness, fall at approximately 2:13pm pt had a syncopal episode in the observation area of the clinic. Pt fell fro... Read more
Close
at approximately 2:13pm pt had a syncopal episode in the observation area of the clinic. Pt fell from chair to linoleum floor approximately 3 feet landing on his stomach, chest and right side of his face. an EMT in the observation area immediately called for help and attempted to rouse the patient. after being unconscious for about 15 seconds total, patient awoke and knew his name, where he was, and what had happened. PT was sit-pick maneuvered to a stretcher in semi-fowlers position, taken to a private area and assessed. PT's head, neck and back were palpated for tenderness, deformity, injury and discomfort. PT denied head neck and back pain. Upon assessment of mouth, pt did bite the tip of his tongue with a small amount of bleeding, approximately less than half a millimeter . Initial vital signs were taken at 2:16pm blood pressure 84/60, pulse rate 56, respiratory rate 18 lung sounds clear and equal in all 4 quadrants, pupils equal, round reactive to light, tracking motion, 4 mm in diameter. PT questioning revealed prehypertensive, no known medical or food allergies, no over the counter or prescription medications, pt stated that he did have a syncopal episode about 3 years ago when he was sick with the flu and bearing down on the toilet. PT stated after he got the vaccine he sat down, was moving his arm, felt dizzy, blacked out, and woke up on the floor. PT stated he was dizzy upon initial assessment, but other wise denied pain or discomfort. PT vitals Reassessed at 2:21pm BP 106/74, PR 60, RR18, LS clear PEARL -4mm. PT was instructed after about 30 minutes of observation to sit up for 2 minutes, PT denied dizziness or discomfort. PT instructed to stand in place for 2 minutes, pt denied dizziness or discomfort. PT vital signs reassessed at 2:52 pm BP 134/86, PR 68, RR 18, LS clear, PEARRL 4mm. PT was escorted to his vehicle by a paramedic where his family was waiting to drive him home. PT was encouraged to seek additional medical attention as soon as possible for further evaluation. PT left clinic site at about 3:10pm

34 2021-05-17 dizziness Prior to vaccination the patient reported that in the past he had passed out after giving blood. Abo... Read more
Close
Prior to vaccination the patient reported that in the past he had passed out after giving blood. About a minute after administering the COVID-19 vaccine the patient reported feeling dizzy. He then passed out in the chair. We safely moved the patient to the floor. Then within approximately 15 seconds the patient sat up and then stood up on his own. We asked the patient to then be seated in the chair while he recovered. We called 911 as soon as he passed out. Patient was somewhat confused initially but quickly regained his bearings. He began sweating and said he was very hot. We checked his blood pressure and it was 100/80. Patient continued to recover and said he was feeling better. We had him wait until EMTs arrived. He told them he did not need any care. We took his blood pressure again and it was now 110/75. He said he felt well to go to the EMTs and pharmacist.
34 2021-05-21 dizziness Patient stated that he was lightheaded. He was given water and remained seated for 10 minutes. Felt... Read more
Close
Patient stated that he was lightheaded. He was given water and remained seated for 10 minutes. Felt better and had to use the bathroom. Walking there he fainted but his wife caught him protecting his head. His pulse and breathing were checked and the on-duty pharmacist stayed with him until the EMS arrived. By that time he was able to sit up and drink more water. He was not taken away by ambulance but was evaluated and walked out on his own.

He all of a sudden was thirsty and told mom to grab water and when she was getting the water he became dizzy and fell on the floor from the chair. He injured his right side of lip where it was bleeding. He was then given water and was fine but was still feeling little dizzy. Manager called 911 and after paramedic came he was taken to the hospital. Paramedic checked the glucose level which was normal and the BP was 91/50.

Close
I received the Covid 19 Moderna vaccine on 5/14/2021; approximately at 6pm. I experienced about 5 hours later adverse reactions. I went to be around 11pm. Upon laying down I began to get dizzy and my heart began to pound rapidly. This strong heart pounding would last 5 hours straight. An hour later my throat started to get a tight feeling with tingling under the chin area and my saliva production began to slow drying out my mouth. Breathing became more labored and difficult. At this time my heart was still beating strong. I had intense Insomnia. The one time that I tried to lay down; when my body would try to doze off for a second; my body would suddenly jolt me awake with an intense shaking and heart pounding.

Close
I am a healthy individual with no pre-existing conditions. I had Covid-19 in August of 2020. I was in bed for 5 weeks with most of the symptoms and regularly had fever exceeding 104. When I was allowed to return to work, the Dr. gave me light duty orders to not exceed 5 hours worked per day for 2 months. After receiving the first vaccination dose, my arm became incredibly sore. These symptoms lasted for almost 2 weeks. The morning following vaccination, my body began to ache and hurt on touch to the point where the cover woke me up in pain. These symptoms lasted nearly three days during both day and night. I became nauseous about 24 hours following the vaccination. These symptoms lasted almost 4, 24 hour days. I became dizzy, periodically, about 24 hours after receiving the vaccination. These symptoms lasted for almost 7 days. I had low grade fever on three occasions that I knew about, I treated with Tylenol. These symptoms lasted 3 days after vaccination. I had a horrible headache (I never have had headaches before) I could not open my eyes or expose them to light. Most of the pain was concentrated on the left side of my head. These headaches started 3 days after receiving the vaccination and lasted 5 days later until day 8. I used Tylenol, which seemed to have little effect and slept all day.

Close
sore shoulder; chills; fever; passed out; sore; Bruise near the eye; falling down; dehydration; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out) in a 34-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 023C21A and 044B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 27-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 26-May-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), PAIN (sore), CONTUSION (Bruise near the eye), FALL (falling down), DEHYDRATION (dehydration), ARTHRALGIA (sore shoulder), PYREXIA (fever) and CHILLS (chills). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out), PAIN (sore), CONTUSION (Bruise near the eye), FALL (falling down), DEHYDRATION (dehydration), ARTHRALGIA (sore shoulder), PYREXIA (fever) and CHILLS (chills) outcome was unknown. He was given IV fluids as a treatment . No Concomitant medications were reported by the reporter. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

A little over ab hour after receiving the vaccine I noticed a burning sensation in my sinuses. After receiving the Moderna vaccine the patient was observed in the monitoring area (he was designated 30 minute in pre screening). He complained of fainting symptoms and described past similar episodes related to vasovagal type stimulus (IV insertion) as well as panic attacks. The patient was placed supine, vitals signs were monitored and IV normal saline bolus administered by on site paramedics. The patient rapidly improved and refused transport and further care against medical advice. He was advised to seek immediate medical evaluation at a hospital and advise his physician and he was picked up by another party and di not drive.

Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA After receiving the vaccine, I felt my throat swell up a bit, which caused me to slightly panic during the 15 minute observational period; however, it went away after approximately 5 minutes. I initially wasn't convinced it had anything to do with the vaccine. Later that day, I went into work for third shift. At approximately 1:30 am (approx 11 hrs. after the vaccine), I began to feel very ill. I developed flu like symptoms and a headache, which caused me to leave work. I continued having flu symptoms, chills, nausea, body aches, and a very severe migraine on and off until I woke up on 01-22-20 at approximately 6:00 am. At this time, the migraine had subsided and I just had some minor body aches,, which over the next 24 hrs. also went away. The migraine should be noted as debilitating to the point I was dizzy, my mind was foggy, but worst of all, the pain was so bad I was constantly nauseous and my eyes were regularly watering. I never was tested for COVID-19; however, I believe my family had potentially had the virus in October. My wife and I exhibited many of the signs and symptoms of the virus, including my wife losing taste and smell for an extended period of time.

At about 10 minutes post injection I began feeling dizzy, lightheaded and hot. Left arm began itching. Discovered hives on my upper arm. 15 minutes later hives had spread to my left shoulder and neck. Dizziness persisted. Hives began to resolve. 40 minutes later they permitted me to leave but said I could not drive, because the dizziness persisted. Advised me to take a benedryl tablet by mouth before bed and again in the morning and to follow up with my PCP.

HCP stood next to patient and he remained upright in the chair but his head rolled back, he became pale and sweaty and passed out. Patient recovered and 10 minutes later repeated the episode. 35 2021-03-18 dizziness WEAKNESS, NUMBNESS IN ALL LIMBS, CHEST PAIN, NAUSEA, DIAPHORESIS, VASOVAGAL EPISODE Narrative: 35 yo... Read more
Close
WEAKNESS, NUMBNESS IN ALL LIMBS, CHEST PAIN, NAUSEA, DIAPHORESIS, VASOVAGAL EPISODE Narrative: 35 yo male was seen at urgent care on 03/16/2021 after his covid19 vaccine. Pt stated he first developed chest pain, followed by dizziness, weakness. Felt like he was going to pass out, also had nausea, numbness in all limbs. Chest pain resolved after a few minutes. Pt has no hx of heart disease or diabetes. He had not eaten anything that morning. Denied previous issues with other vaccines. He had not been exposed to COVID19 (not that he knew of). Provider diagnosed patient with vasovagal episode. Patient was placed in supine position and given juice at the urgent care clinic. His blood pressure was 96/61 upon arrival and went up to 104/71. Baseline BP for patient is around 106-132/64-81. All symptoms resolved and pt was discharged home. PMH for patient includes: GERD, tinnitus, asthma

Limited movement in shoulder and Weakness when lifting light objects. In certain positions shoulder crackles, pops, and rips audibly. This was not occurring prior to injection.

RN explained the vasovagal response to the patient, who explained that this has happened to him in the past "every time he got a shot". Pt reported feeling much better while lying on cot with a cold compress. MD recommended not drive, friend offered to drive pt home with family. Pt. given water to drink, advised to seek care as needed.

Close
Vaccination at 11:15am. Onset of soreness / flu-like symptoms around 9pm. Patient awoke around 3am to use the bathroom and fainted (lost consciousness and collapsed) on the floor. Patient's wife tried to help patient back into bed, once patient was standing patient lost all muscle control and experienced muscular spasms in legs (possibly arms). Patient's wife laid patient flat on floor; patient's eyes rolled into back of head. Patient was unresponsive for approx 1 minute, by the time wife retrieved phone to call for help, patient was again responsive and displayed extreme flu-like symptoms (severe shaking, sweating, and thirst). Patient remained laying on ground for 10 minutes before being able to sit and return to bed.

I check again another 10 minutes later and it has lowered (pulse 80). BP still elevated so I mentioned it could be due to the nervousness to the reaction or just that he has hypertension and he should get it checked out. This occurred a few min after a warm shower and upon entering bed for sleep. Preceding episode my skin felt sensitive to the touch, to the point it was uncomfortable to use a wash poof during shower. The episode lasted at its highest intensity for 2-3 min, after peak it lasted for 20 min total. I was unable to get up during the peak to grab warm clothing or a blanket. I had no control over my body mobility.

35 2021-04-17 fall Patient received his first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. After 5 minutes of sitting, he decided to ... Read more
Close
Patient received his first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. After 5 minutes of sitting, he decided to walk around the store to shop. The patient experienced syncope and fell face first to the floor, cutting his lip. The patient was bleeding from his lips. Customers and pharmacy technicians tended to the patient. He was alert and responsive the entire time. The pharmacist called 911 and an EMS team was dispatched. The patient rose and sat in a chair. He was given water. He stated that he just felt overheated and that the store was very warm. EMS arrived, evaluated the patient, and stated that the patient just experienced a bout of syncope. They asked if the patient would like to go to the hospital and the patient declined. EMS left and the patient remained seated, resting for an additional 20 minutes. The patient left the pharmacy. The pharmacist spoke with the patient several hours later and the patient reported he was doing fine at home resting. The pharmacist counseled the patient to contact his primary care provider regarding the incident.

35 2021-04-23 fall Patient was administered Moderna Covid-19 vaccine, given a bottle of water, and asked to sit in the ... Read more
Close
Patient was administered Moderna Covid-19 vaccine, given a bottle of water, and asked to sit in the observation area for 15 minutes. Approximately 4-5 minutes later, the patient was observed to be slumping in the chair, and fell to the floor. It was not clear whether he hit his head. The patient was incoherent, and was asked to lie on his back. He tried to get up, and was positioned to a sitting position on the floor. called 911, and conveyed all necessary info. A paramedic who happened to be shopping in the store intervened and tried to make an assessment of the patient. He asked several questions to determine patient awareness,(year, date, president). When Fire & Rescue arrived, they performed a general assessment including cardiac monitoring. After roughly 15 minutes, the patient appeared to have regained his faculties. Although it was strongly suggested that he be transported to the hospital for further observation, the patient declined, and left the store of his own accord with his mother.

Close
Immediately felt weak and light headed the same as the first shot, but did not incur breathing difficulties. Gradually became weaker as the day went on. 13 hours later, at 3AM, awoke due to severe pain, chills, and fever that progressively worsened to about 103 degrees and did not drop below 100 for another 17 hours. Resting heart rate elevated over 30 bpm and respiration rate doubled. Pounding heart made it impossible to sleep. Had to double beta blocker dosage to reduce heart contractility to prevent chance of further scarring of ventricular tissue due from any myocarditis caused by the vaccine. Could not leave bed and could barely stand to go to the bathroom. Lost 5 pounds in one day. Couldn?t eat. Felt nauseas. Contemplated going to ER but didn?t feel I?d make it without passing out. Still having difficulty walking any distance without feeling like passing out more than 72 hours after vaccination absent any arrhythmia. Experienced non-sustained arrhythmias after the first vaccine dosage doing normal household activities that required me to stop what I was doing to prevent a defibrillator shock. I have a feeling of brain fog, difficulty concentrating or sleeping. It was a struggle to drive a vehicle to restock of fluids and electrolytes today. I fear this vaccine is making my health worse.

Close
Received 2nd dose of vaccine, 5 days later his left leg started hurting and swelling. He had severe headache afterwards, dizzy and blurred vision. 04/24/2021 he complained of not feeling right, coughed and passed out. Had fever and chills when he came to. Wife called 911 and was talking and walking. Was awake and talking in ambulance, oxygen level was low. Once arrived at hospital, he became restless and passed away within 3 minutes. Autopsy was performed due to his age - 35 and no pre-existing illnesses - was determined he died of Pulmonary Thrumbo Embolism
35 2021-05-03 dizziness Patient received Moderna vaccine and was waiting in our waiting area as per protocol. He approached... Read more
Close
Patient received Moderna vaccine and was waiting in our waiting area as per protocol. He approached our counter about 10 minutes later saying he felt sweaty, dizzy, and said "I can feel the blood thru my veins". Patient was asked if he would like us to call 911 and he answered yes. 911 was called and EMS arrived approximately 4 minutes later. Patient was given water and pharmacist stayed with him until EMS arrived. He left the building with EMS about 10:22am under his own power. Patient did not lose consciousness at any time.

Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine mild fever and extreme shivering was preceded by slight feeling of physical exhaustion, and perhaps exacerbated or triggered by brushing teeth and washing hands in cold water and urinating (very slight body temperature drop), which evolved into almost-teeth-chattered uncontrollable shivers for 1+ hr and an extremely slow increase to 101-102 degree fever over the next three hours. Patient took a full dose Advil (ibuprofen) which seemed to relieve symptoms after perhaps 4+ hours of sleep. Patient was physically unable to meaningfully move or reposition themselves in bed for 1-2 hours due to exhaustion, but could have perhaps done so if roused by necessity.

35 2021-05-23 dizziness Patient began to sweat and feel faint. Patient did not lose consciousness but became very dizzy. Pat... Read more
Close
Patient began to sweat and feel faint. Patient did not lose consciousness but became very dizzy. Patient was given water but did not feel better. Patient was then helped to the floor to lay down. We placed something under his head to make him more comfortable and then proceeded to elevate his feet. He remained laying down for about 5 minutes. Then the sweating stopped and he was no longer dizzy or pale. We returned him to the sitting position for another 10 mins and then helped him test standing at which point he said he felt better and would like to go shopping. I walked around with him for about 5 minutes to make sure he continued to feel ok.

I woke up the next morning feeling a general muscle soreness throughout my body. I was also experiencing mild chills and mild dizziness. I took a 1000mg dose of acetaminophen and a 400mg dose of ibuprofen about an hour after I got up and rested for several hours. The symptoms started to dissipate at around 1pm but the soreness slightly persisted throughout the day. Symptoms were gone the next day.

35 2021-05-27 fall Patient came in for the first dose of the COVID19 Moderna vaccine and reported that he hasn't had a ... Read more
Close
Patient came in for the first dose of the COVID19 Moderna vaccine and reported that he hasn't had a vaccine in 12 years. I reassured him that it was a good time to get this vaccine due to the pandemic and tried to keep in good spirits; he appeared a little nervous. After the vaccine, he stood up and walked over to our waiting area. He walked regularly and sat down. Patient was sitting for a few minutes before the pharmacy technician saw him "slide" down his chair and onto the floor. Patient was unconscious but easily arousable. Regained consciousness after a few seconds. Patient was still breathing and had a pulse. After patient regained consciousness, he said he has a history of passing out after getting his blood drawn/getting a vaccine.

35 2021-05-28 impaired driving ability, dizziness Starting the day of the vaccine in the evening, I had fever, felt tired and chills. Temperature 101-... Read more
Close
Starting the day of the vaccine in the evening, I had fever, felt tired and chills. Temperature 101-102 . I took ibuprofen and went to sleep. I had chills the whole night. I woke up the next day and had headache, dizzy, nauseated. I continued to take ibuprofen every 4 hours. Mild fever during the day and no fever at night. Nausea was improving. Headache was not improving. The following day, I felt a little better, a little nauseated, headache, dizziness and diarrhea and left work early to go home. Took Zofran for dizziness and it helped a little. I did a telehealth visit over the phone and I was sent to get Covid test (negative). Symptoms did not improve so I went to ER the follow day. I was sent home with a prescription for higher dose Zofran and was told to stop ibuprofen and start Tylenol. I went home and tried to rest. Symptoms are slowly improving. I was unable to drive for a whole week. I had these symptoms for about 7 days. Headache, diarrhea and nausea went away, but I still felt fatigued. The fatigue lasted for about another week (total of 2 weeks).

35 2021-06-13 inability to stand, movement disorder, fall No side effects from first shot. Second shot was different. Got my second shot about 2PM and aroun... Read more
Close
No side effects from first shot. Second shot was different. Got my second shot about 2PM and around 1-2 AM I was getting ready for bed. At first I was just feeling tired but then I started shaking uncontrollably and muscles in my neck and back were spazzing out. I lost all control of my body and fell over, convulsing for an unknown amount of time. I apparently foamed and/or drooled all over myself. I woke out of this effect around 3:30 AM. This was Friday/Saturday. Its Monday now. I still cannot stand straight and cannot create complex thoughts in my mind. I had a hard time perceiving colors for the first day and a half to two days after the seizure or stroke I suffered. I still have a migraine that feels like an elephant is sitting inside my skull. I still cannot perform complicated thoughts nor can I do complicated things with my hands because of a lack of motor skills. I successfully pulled every muscle in my back and neck and cannot stand upright. I'm 35 and now need a cane. Its already been 3 days and things really have not changed. Won't catch me lining up for a booster shot. NO THANK YOU. I did not seek medical attention because lets face it the healthcare system is a joke I would have needed a ride to a hospital, increasing my odds of getting the virus, to have them hold me as long as they can to stab me and poke me and take samples, give me no results, and a humungo bill. I will die before I go to a hospital ever again because the amounts of testing I required at the time would have covered back and neck and brain scans of various types and those tests are stupid expensive and 99% of the time I've ever got one they said oh I'm sorry we don't know what's wrong go see my friend who is a specialist blah blah blah and its the "doctor-go-round" where you blow all your money on morons that only care about lining their pockets.
35 2021-06-20 dizziness After receiving the vaccine I felt completely fine, just the regular sore arm. Two days later I thou... Read more
Close
After receiving the vaccine I felt completely fine, just the regular sore arm. Two days later I thought I was getting bit by mosquitos because I was experiencing hives, I even had to call the health department to take car of the mosquitos but that wasn't the case at all, because they were hives and not mosquito bites. I was also receiving heat flashes throughout the night and that is still going on until this day. I was prescribed Prednisone 20mg 3 times a day for four days by my PCP and I did not see any changes for the random hives that I was experiencing throughout the day. Another problem that I have been experiencing was being dizzy at random times as well. I was advised by my PCP to go to the dermatologist to receive an allergy test but haven't been able to get around too it.
35 2021-06-28 joint stiffness After receiving the first dose I went through the typical symptoms that were mentioned. I had muscl... Read more
Close
After receiving the first dose I went through the typical symptoms that were mentioned. I had muscle aches, tiredness, and soreness. That lasted about a day and was back to normal in two days. On the 5th day after getting my shot I woke up to extreme pain in my left shoulder (dose 1 injection site). I could pinpoint exactly where the needle must have gone in, because that area was the most painful. I had full mobility of the shoulder but moving it would increase the pain substantially. This extreme pain lasted about two weeks. It took about a month for the constant pain to go away. I now experience days where I can feel tightness and light pain in the shoulder at the point of injection. It is nothing serious and usually goes away overnight. This occurs at least once every few weeks.
35 2021-06-28 posture abnormal, dizziness, balance disorder Three weeks after receiving the first dose (on 02/01/2021) I woke up with extreme dizziness and imba... Read more
Close
Three weeks after receiving the first dose (on 02/01/2021) I woke up with extreme dizziness and imbalance, I felt as if I was constantly leaning to the right. I would get extremely nauseous from walking, working, or just sitting and turning my head. When I would lay down on my right side I felt as if fluid were building up and that something was going to pop. Advil, caffeine, and alcohol made my symptoms worse. I was able to find some relief by laying down on my left side and through sleep. After a week, I went to see Dr. at Clinic. They were unable to figure my issue, but they ruled out BPPV. They also did a blood and urine test at this time. After two weeks the dizziness started to fade a little, but I was left with headaches, imbalance, tiredness, and pressure behind my ear and eye. I noticed that any kind of stress or anger would make the symptoms much worse. I visited Dr. at ENT Clinic. She did several tests and was unable to find any obvious cases of my symptoms. She suggested I might have had migraines, even though I had no history of them. She told me to give it a month and come back if I was still having problems. After one Month the dizziness was pretty much gone, but I still was experiencing imbalance, headaches, and pressure. Instead of getting dizzy I would get sharp shooting headaches that would last a couple of seconds. I still had what felt like pressure behind my eye and ear. I also still was unable to lay on my right side. I visited ENT Dr. again and we decided to do an MRI with contrast. The MRI came back negative. We decided to start me on vestibular physical therapy. After 3 months I have gotten to the point where I do not feel imbalance every day. I still will have days where I feel like I am leaning to the right, but those are getting less frequent. I still occasionally get headaches, tightness, and fullness in the area. I would say I am about 75 percent better. I feel what happened in my head is somehow the same reaction I had in my left arm. I reported this reaction in a different report. I would like to point out that both times these reactions occurred I drank alcohol the night before.

36 2021-02-03 fall, dizziness Fainted; Disoriented and didn't know what was happening; Feels a little dizzy; Lethargy; Tenderness ... Read more
Close
Fainted; Disoriented and didn't know what was happening; Feels a little dizzy; Lethargy; Tenderness in the arm; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer who was a 36-year-old, male, patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced fainted, tenderness in the arm, lethargy, disoriented and didn't know what was happening, and feels a little dizzy. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 14 Jan 2021, prior to the onset of events, the patient received the first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 25L20A) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On the evening of 14 Jan 2021, the patient had tenderness in the arm and felt lethargic. On 15 Jan 2021, the patient fainted when he woke up in the morning. The patient's legs gave out and he fell into the wall. The patient was disoriented and didn't know what was happening. The patient reported the event as happening pretty quick and described it as "like he had very low blood sugar". The patient reported that sometimes when he gets up too quickly, he feels a little dizzy. No treatment information was provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome of the events, fainted, tenderness in the arm, lethargy, disoriented and didn't know what was happening, and sometimes when he gets up too quickly, was unknown. The event, feels a little dizzy, was considered not resolved.; Reporter's Comments: This spontaneous report refers to a case of a 36-year-old male patient who experienced events of fainted, tenderness in the arm, lethargy, disoriented and didn't know what was happening, and feels a little dizzy. The events developed on the following day after the administration of the mRNA-1273 vaccine (Lot # 25L20A, expiration date-unknown). No treatment was reported, and outcome is resolved for dizziness and unknown for all other events. Based on the information provided which includes a temporal association, a causal association cannot be excluded

Patient developed sudden onset vertigo with recurrent vomiting. He was brought to the emergency department and was evaluated under the stroke protocol and underwent CT, CTA, and MRI of the brain which did not reveal an etiology of his symptoms. He had a neurology consultation and the most likely cause was thought to be vestibular neuritis on the left side. He was treated with Zofran, Reglan, Meclizine, IV fluids, and Valium with partial relief and was discharged home with outpatient follow-up. Symptoms are unresolved at the time of this report.

Pt had second dose of vaccine. Moderna. Pt felt tingles in figures, pt felt light headed. Pt was moved to medical room and checked out. Vs taken and stable . Pt felt better after 20 mins. Pt was released to observation area. Checked out.

Woke up a few minutes later and put myself to bed; felt fatigue, aches, chills, and like I might have been running a mild fever. Slept unusually well; woke up this morning feeling perfectly fine. Not particularly concerned but felt like I should report it.

36 2021-03-09 balance disorder, vertigo Woke up on Friday morning (3/5) with severe neck pain and vertigo. Tried to walk to bathroom and was... Read more
Close
Woke up on Friday morning (3/5) with severe neck pain and vertigo. Tried to walk to bathroom and was falling over to the right side and felt very nauseous. Starting throwing up. Arrived at ER around9:30AM and was diagnosed with vertigo and discharged a few hours later. He slept most of the day but woke up for a few minutes to take medicine on Friday evening and told me his vision was blurry. He went back to sleep and slept until Saturday (3/6) morning around 9:30. He told me his vision was still really blurry so we went back to the ER. They did an MRI and MRA and saw that he had two strokes. The strokes have affected his vision and he still has blurry vision and is not able to see well peripherally.

Close
Sinus pressure started the same night as the vaccine. The symptoms gradually worsened throughout the night. He recognized that the fullness was worse when he was laying down. By the next morning, the fullness became more of a dizziness, he felt unstable, nauseated, weakness, and intermittent tightness in his chest. His symptoms have been mostly stable until this morning (12MAR2021) he woke with a disturbing feeling of fullness in his nose and sinuses. Then suddenly had a significant flow of blood from his RIGHT nostril. As of this evening he still has congestion in his sinuses, and intermittent tightness in his chest.

36 2021-03-14 dizziness Initial side effects (24 hours) soreness in upper arm. Within 36 hours I started getting extreme lig... Read more
Close
Initial side effects (24 hours) soreness in upper arm. Within 36 hours I started getting extreme light headed. Within 3 days I started having pins and needle sensation in my right arm, from my shoulder to my finger, mainly my pinky and ring finger. I progressed to my left arm and right leg. I've had back pain since then but not sure if it's related. The pins an needles I feel every now and then but not as bad. The light headedness has not gone away, I can't shake it. I've seen my Dr, he put me on an anxiety medication. My blood work came out good. I started the anxiety meds and started seeing a Therapist , but I don't really see a difference, it's nice to see someone but not getting better. I'm coming off the anxiety med because a side effect is light headedness and that's not helping me much. I have not got the second dose and do not plan on getting it.

Close
Patient is a 36 y.o. male who received the Moderna Covid-19 Vaccine, mRNA-1273 (PF) 100 mcg/0.5 mL IM Susp, Lot 044A21A on 3/15/2021. The patient experienced the following reaction(s) during the immediate of observation: 3:21pm Patient c/o "feeling faint." Patient requested to lay down on mat. Patient alert and oriented. No loss of consciousness noted. Patient reports having fear of needles causes him to feel faint. Patient was treated/managed as follows: 3:23pm VS BP 130/78, HR 73, RR 18, O2 sat 97% on room air. Patient reports symptoms resolving. 3:33pm VS BP 132/86, HR 78, RR 18, O2 sat 96% on room air. Patient reports feeling better. Patient given educational material regarding vaccine and advised to continue to self-monitor per the CDC guidance. 3:36pm Escorted to car by nurse.

36 2021-03-22 mobility decreased, fall After 24 hours right arm was sore, swollen with large amount of redness around injection area, could... Read more
Close
After 24 hours right arm was sore, swollen with large amount of redness around injection area, could not raise it above the shoulder. Entire body was weak and fatigued. 48 hours everything seemed back to 'normal'. Roughly 80 hours later from the vaccination, suddenly body cramped up and had trouble speaking and pronouncing words. Fell to the ground and had hand spasms similar to bells palsy or cerebral palsy. Could not speak fluently or get up on my own. After 45 minutes to 1 hour, when paramedics were called and came they sat me up. Within a few minutes, like a switch, I could speak normally again and could walk on my own. Walked out to the ambulance and waited for 15 minutes or so, and everything seemed fine and back to 'normal'. Declined to go to hospital, and since that episode things are still 'normal'.

CAD Incident No. 2021-00018948 "Moderna COVID 19 Vaccine EUA" Patient received his first dose of Moderna vaccine then proceded to the observation area. Shortly therafter he told the EMT that he waas stating to feel dizzy and lightheaded. Two Paramedics at the patient side. Advise the Patient that we would like to lay him down. 36 2021-03-29 dizziness Patient had flu-like symptoms while deployed at start of pandemic (approx. Jan/Feb 2020), but testin... Read more
Close
Patient had flu-like symptoms while deployed at start of pandemic (approx. Jan/Feb 2020), but testing was unavailable. His symptoms (URI-like) completely resolved. He received Moderna dose 1 on 02 Feb 2021 without incident, and Moderna dose 2 on 02 Mar 2021. Approximately one week later, he developed mild, dull, diffuse chest pain and shortness of breath which has persisted since. He was seen in clinic for chest pain and dyspnea on 15 Mar 2021. Patient noted his chest hurt ?all over? especially with deep or with normal inspiration. Reclining, laying down, and sleeping on his right side increased his pain (he did not trial sleeping on his left). Leaning forward decreased pain. He endorsed feeling short of breath, and stated he felt light headed twice while going up stairs, without passing out. He denied recent illnesses and other symptoms. He is a very physically fit Active Duty Marine, who has continued running despite his symptoms. During this encounter and later f/u encounter, he expressed he did not believe running made his symptoms significantly worse. Vital signs were within normal range and he did not appear in distress. Cardiac and lung exam were normal, and no friction rub or murmur was appreciated. EKG showed sinus bradycardia, with HR consistent with his known, athletic-type normal variant heart rate. No other abnormalities were detected. Due to limited ancillary services within clinic, he was sent to USNHO ED for evaluation. There, he had basic labs (including Trop I) drawn, which were normal. EKG and portable chest xray were also unremarkable, and he was discharged with Motrin 800mg PO TID. He was seen in clinic again 29 Mar 2021 for continued, unchanged symptoms, and reported he had been taking his Motrin only in the mornings and afternoons. Vital signs were unchanged (normal limits). Exam, including heart and lung, were normal. EKG again demonstrated sinus bradycardia, consistent with his normal resting heart rate. He was started on empiric therapy for pericarditis. He was released from clinic and will follow up in several weeks.

36 2021-04-03 fall After the pharmacist administered the vaccine the patient started slumping in his chair and stopped ... Read more
Close
After the pharmacist administered the vaccine the patient started slumping in his chair and stopped talking. The pharmacist patted his shoulder and said his name to try to get his attention. The patient's forearms turned red, and he was breathing heavily but then the pharmacist couldn't hear his breathing for a couple of seconds, after that the patient took a deep breath and his forearms started turning back to normal color, but his face was very pale. All took place in less than 2 minutes. The pharmacist gave him a bottle of water and he waited in the pharmacy for a total of 30-35 minutes.

36 2021-04-07 dizziness Within one minute of receiving the shot I felt disoriented and had trouble determining if I had butt... Read more
Close
Within one minute of receiving the shot I felt disoriented and had trouble determining if I had buttoned my shirt correctly. For the next two and half hours I had trouble recalling basic things that I should have been observing such as which highway my driver had taken me home on although I knew where I was at. I also experienced irregular breathing. To be specific, I would take a very large breath, a very short breath, or miss a breath. This started as a series of one to three irregular breaths every five minutes or so. My breaths became more irregular in the next hour. While driving to my employers office about fifteen or twenty minutes after my shot, my right eye closed and I could not open it for about seven seconds. My breathing also became deep and the pace was not under my control. Once at the office I sat in my manager's office to be observed. I experienced more intense episodes of the above listed symptoms such as both eyes closing and the left one watering. The watering continued into the next day periodically. At least two times while my eyes closed I had to put my elbow on the desk and my hand on my head to make sure I didn't fall out of the chair. I also felt very uncomfortable causing me to moan. This happened one time. After this my manager called my parents and they came to take me home. It took them one hour to get there. While waiting I felt light headed and the breathing irregularities became less intense. When they got there I mainly felt disoriented. The disorientation could be best described as slightly impaired or slowed decision making. I would also like to know if I should receive the second vaccination.

36 2021-04-08 fall, dizziness Patient sat in observation area after receiving vaccine for 15mins. After his time was up, he was as... Read more
Close
Patient sat in observation area after receiving vaccine for 15mins. After his time was up, he was asked if he was feeling okay, if so he may leave. He stood up and walked to pharmacy counter to inform pharmacy staff he was not feeling well, that he was having chills and felt dizzy. A pharmacist was called to check on the patient, as the pharmacist reached to patient to ask about his symptoms, the patient started to fall. The pharmacist caught the patient from behind and gently sat him down. A second pharmacist was called while another technician dialed EMS. EMS arrived to evaluate patient and determined he was dehydrated. They offered to take patient to ambulance to give him IV fluids, the patient declined. Stated he was fine, gave his statement and was able to walk out on his own power.

36 2021-04-14 dizziness After patient received his shot, while sitting during the 15 min waiting period. The patient began g... Read more
Close
After patient received his shot, while sitting during the 15 min waiting period. The patient began getting lightheaded and hot, his color went out of him and his eyes began rolling back in his head. His eyelids turned a purple color and he appeared to momentarily stop breathing. Myself and another pharmacist got him on the ground and supported his head with a coat. When he "came to" and was talking to us. He described feeling better on the cold floor and his color began coming back. I was speaking with him the entire time. While we were out with his 9-1-1 was called and paramedics arrived 15 min later. by the time paramedics had arrived the patient had gotten up and back into the chair himself, was lucid and had color back in his face. Paramedics arrived and took over. He was given the green light from them and remained in the pharmacy area for a total of about 30 minutes before heading home. The patient was admittedly nervous for the shot and had not eaten or had anything to drink the whole day to that point. I believe he passed out from a variety of factors not related to the actual ingredients in the vaccine but cannot confirm this.

36 2021-04-21 dizziness Approximately 2 minutes after administration of the vaccine, patient stated he was feeling light-hea... Read more
Close
Approximately 2 minutes after administration of the vaccine, patient stated he was feeling light-headed, tingling sensation in fingers and beginning to sweat. He was instructed to sit back down, stay for a total of 30 minutes and let the pharmacist know if his condition worsens (his mother was with him). I, asked a technician to provide him with a bottle of cold water. After 4 to 5 minutes, his mother notified me his condition had worsened and the patient looked pale and sweat was visible on his forehead. Another pharmacist stepped in to assist because I was with a different patient. This pharmacist, aligned 3 to 4 chairs so the patient could lie down. He stayed with him until he stated he felt better, which was approximately 5 minutes later. For the record, the patient did not mention a headache or symptoms of a migraine. Patient called pharmacy on 4/14/21 and stated he's been suffering from a headache/migraine since the day of administration. The pharmacist recommended to follow up with PCP.

36 2021-04-21 vertigo, gait inability I believe I experienced multiple symptoms as a result of my vaccine. My experience matches exactly a... Read more
Close
I believe I experienced multiple symptoms as a result of my vaccine. My experience matches exactly as described in the article. ON 4/1/21 at approximately 4pm I awoke from a nap experiencing acute vertigo, nausea and headache. I also was experiencing fever and chills. I began treating with excedrine but did not have an effect. The vertigo was very acute, my eyes were skipping and I was unable to walk. Nause was so intense that any attempt to leave my bed resulted in vomiting. I was unable to eat and could barely drink for the first 24 hours. Friday 4/2 at approx 7pm I took a dose of Promethazine which began to help the nausea. Extreme headache/migraine lasted for 3 days. During this time I also experienced extreme neck pain, as well as pain near base of skull, behind my ears, and on my temples. Symptoms were steadily improving each day, so I did not seek medical care during this time. I feel I became fully recovered by 4/18. I just had my second vaccine dose on 4/21 and I am very nervous about experiencing a relapse of symptoms.

36 2021-05-01 joint range of motion decreased erythematous rash with blistering on left arm and hand. Loss of ROM of left wrist.
36 2021-05-02 impaired driving ability, dizziness First I noticed that my eyes were very sensitive to light, I was also feeling light headed and dizzy... Read more
Close
First I noticed that my eyes were very sensitive to light, I was also feeling light headed and dizzy on my walk back to the car. (about 30 minutes after injection). I had someone else drive because I felt like I could not drive in my condition. On the ride home, about 40 minutes after injection, I began to have an increased heart rate and had a hard time swallowing. It was also slightly difficult to breathe. I felt like my head was cloudy and I had a hard time concentrating. I felt like my brain was responding about a half a second slower to what I saw. Like if I wanted to turn my head, I would think try to turn my head and my body would react a second later. When I got home, about 1 hour after the injection, my girlfriend told me my hands were freezing cold. I was also having a hard time walking in straight because I was so dizzy. I was still having some minor trouble breathing and swallowing. It was difficult to drink water. After about 2 hours my breathing returned to normal. My mind was cloudy all day, I felt like I was drunk. On the second day, I woke up with an intense headache. It lasted for 3 days. My arm started to hurt on the second day as well, no pain at all the first day. My head was still cloudy and I had difficulty trying to recall memories or answer questions. By the third day this was basically gone. I was extremely tired for three days total. My mind remain cloudy for about a week.

36 2021-05-05 dizziness Patient experienced lightheadedness, dizziness, nausea blurred vision and chest pain within 10 minut... Read more
Close
Patient experienced lightheadedness, dizziness, nausea blurred vision and chest pain within 10 minutes of receiving second dose of Moderna vaccine. Blood pressure was 80/60 initially but rebounded in 10 minutes to 90/62, pulse regular and steady at 63 and 02 sat 99%. He was initially diaphoretic and pale. Patient monitored for 20 minutes, given food and water. After 20 minutes he returned to normal coloring , chest pain and all other symptoms completely gone. He was allowed to leave facility.

patient began feeling light headed 5 minutes after being given the vaccine, then feeling tingling in hands then in body, he then started feeling tightness in stomach area then in arms. Patient was instructed to take deep breaths and was able to speak in full sentences when he was asked about his address and if he's had a reaction to vaccines in the past. He responded that he felt lightheaded after his Tetanus vaccine in the past but never severe reactions. EMS was called and he was take to hospital by ambulance.

36 2021-05-12 mobility decreased, gait inability I got the shot around 3:15PM on Monday 4/26/21. Woke up Tuesday 4/27/21 with a minor headache and ju... Read more
Close
I got the shot around 3:15PM on Monday 4/26/21. Woke up Tuesday 4/27/21 with a minor headache and just felt out of sorts. Around noon that day I had a seizure at work and was rushed to the ER. While at the hospital waiting for a room to open up, I had another seizure. This one was much worse than the first. They had to intubate me and I spent 5 nights in the ICU. Another 3 on the Neurology floor for observation. The seizures caused Rhabdomyolysis which caused damage to my kidneys and significant muscle loss/damage. I wasn't able to walk at all for 3 days. After that I started to be able to get up out of bed and move around a little more each day.

36 2021-05-14 vertigo, balance disorder, dizziness Dizziness, unbalance. Vertigo was there occasionally the first couple days for hours or minutes, con... Read more
Close
Dizziness, unbalance. Vertigo was there occasionally the first couple days for hours or minutes, continues endlessly for now. I had a case of vertigo 8 or 9 years ago but no issues ever again with the ear or hearing or balance. After the first shot I twice thought I had a blockage or something in the ear. Tried drops, wax remover whatever you can find, nothing helped. Eventually it subsided but never gave real vertigo or long lasting balance issue. After 2nd shot was immediately an issue. Constant sweating and 99.5 fever for the 11th, 12th and 13th. 3 days straight of just sweating. Vomiting on around or just after midnight on the 13th, into the morning of the 14th. End of the 14th leading to the 15th the Veritgo has a light migraine attached. The migraine is mostly in the right eye has any migraine I've had is, comes with some light nasal pressure right at the eye socket. No issues with nasal drip or stuffy nose. Slight blurred vision which either creates the migraine or is from it. I also had migraines in the past but no more than 1 a year for the last 5 years, nothing I have medication or treatment for any longer. This vertigo has a low grade migraine with small dot of blurred vision from one eye, my right eye. I dance with my daughter which is usually holding hands and spinning until her feet come off the ground. The first recognition that something is terribly wrong in my ear was that the moment I spin I can't rotate more than once rapidly without becoming incredibly unstably dizzy. That regardless of the vertigo, migraine or anything has been true since the 2nd shot when I spin I am at a total loss of balance. There is constant dizziness, blurred vision, migraine

Close
3 days after I received my 2nd dose of Moderna Vaccine at the same facility (Which I received on 4/16/2021), I've had a series of what could be panic attacks. 1 on 4/19/21, 1 on 4/30/21, then another on 5/8/21, which then continues to stay with me on a milder intensity, but is lasting still today. In my previous 4 years of working, I've only missed a less than a 1 handful of days of work due to health conditions, but suddenly after receiving my 2nd dose of Moderna vaccine, I've had a myriad of what I initially thought were heart attacks where I was unable to drive to work (had to pull over twice on the road due to serious risk of being in an accident / having unprovoked panic attacks the morning of 4/19/21 and 5/8/21). Had extreme SOB and could seriously considered calling 911 on all 3 of my first episodes. Went to Urgent Care on 5/10/21, and have had several phone visits with my primary care physician since then and was placed on medical leave until 5/22/21, although I still am experience some side effects even today.
