36 2021-05-24 mobility decreased Received second dose of Moderna COVID 19 vaccine at 10AM Thursday 05/20. T+12-18hrs: Feeling flushe... Read more
Close
Received second dose of Moderna COVID 19 vaccine at 10AM Thursday 05/20. T+12-18hrs: Feeling flushed. Slightly confused. Body aches build over the night. Wake up with mild/moderate pain in back, knees, arm. Groggy. Went to work on something with a friend at 10:00 AM (T+24Hrs), but had to return home because.... T+24hr: ....headache growing. Went home and found fever at 102°. Slight chills, bit mainly just heat without sweating. Fever hit 103.2 at peak. Went through 10lbs ice to keep the fever in check. Headache from T24hr-T36HR feels like a spike through the top of frontal lobe to my left eye. T+32hr: Headache still intense. Only back pain now. Appetite slowly increasing. T+48hr (Saturday morning). Back pain persists, but mild. Headache gone. Have a relatively normal day. T+60hrs (Sat. Afternoon): Back pain increasing. Stop all unnecessary lifting/moving. T+68hrs (early Sunday morning): Go to ER with the back pain. Absolutely excruciating spasms from top of sacrum - roughly LI/12T. Lower back stiff as wood. Given shot or Toradol, dose/prescription to flexiril. I specifically request this plan because usually takes care of the spasms; basically, get me able to move and the pain/spasms will go away. NOTE: I have a history of back issues in this area, but I have not had an episode in years and certainly never had an episode that works like this with no relief. From about 2017-2019, I r T+70-78hrs: Feel normal. T + 78-88hrs: lower back pain comes back with an absolute vengeance. T+90hrs (early Monday morning): Return to ER. Back pain worse than Sunday morning. Receive toradol shot and prescription Prednisone. Back pain gone by around 10:30 AM. Decide to take prednisone Tuesday morning as its getting a bit late in the day by the time pharmacy fills the prescription. T+90hrs: Back pain returns in similar fashion as Sunday afternoon. Still. Barely mobile. T+96 hours: Wake up with lower back pain similar to Sunday/Monday morning. Took prednisone and flexiril this morning. Please help me.

36 2021-06-05 injected limb mobility decreased 12 hours after second dose patient experienced following symptoms: headache, fever, chills, body ach... Read more
Close
12 hours after second dose patient experienced following symptoms: headache, fever, chills, body aches, pain at injection site. All symptoms subsided in 28 hours after injection except headache which persisted for about 4 days. 12 days after second dose patient experienced intense pain and redness at site of injection leading to loss of mobility in left arm, and outbreak of hives across torso, upper arms and legs, which have persisted for 5 days (to date of Adverse Event report). Arm pain subsides with 400 mg ibuprofen taken daily. Pharmacist recommended Benadryl for hives, taking 25 mg Diphenhydramine HCI once daily with little improvement in symptoms. Patient recalls no previous history experiencing acute or chronic urticaria. Hives are moderately itchy, mostly painless, and have gradually increased to 2-3 inches in diameter.

Close
Fainting spell. Patient felt dizzy and almost passed out. His heart rate was elevated and his breathing became rapid. 911 was called immediately. His blood pressure was 102/80 and heart rate was 92. After about 5 minutes he was feeling fine. EMS determined it was a vagal response.

36 2021-06-16 gait disturbance Patient developed muscle and joint pains and fatigue roughly 3 weeks after the first dose of the vac... Read more
Close
Patient developed muscle and joint pains and fatigue roughly 3 weeks after the first dose of the vaccine. Developed swelling and pain in the hands. He developed difficulty walking due to joint pains. Received 2nd dose of vaccine on 5/28/21. Came to the ER on 6/4/21 due to persistent hand swelling. Labs sent on that day showed proteinuria for which he was sent to rheumatology (serology done for SLE came back positive) and nephrology. Patient has been diagnosed with systemic lupus eryhtematosus with renal involvement.

Close
Employee presented to me 6/21/21 with c/o very localized pain in right deltoid at the site of the COVID vaccine (Moderna #1 12/23/20, # 2 1/15/21, both of which administered on the right) that he said began about 3 weeks ago. Pain is elicited on palpation (no induration felt today) and with certain movements (lifting of arm and abduction). He relates this specifically to the vaccine administration site. He said that he had only experienced soreness at the administration sites immediately following the vaccinations until now. He also has had numbness involving what appears to be the medial nerve (just one time in last week) and strange sensation down at the elbow/AC area. Advised to F/U with PCP from health system return to work coordinator if employee feels he needs medical treatment . This was communicated to employee and it is unknown at this time if employee has sought medical care.
36 2021-06-21 vertigo Presyncope, Veritgo, Disorientation.
36 2021-06-28 dizziness, gait inability Syncope; Diarrhoea; Dizziness; Fatigue; Gait inability; Pallor; Skin discolouration; Pyrexia; Vomiti... Read more
Close
Syncope; Diarrhoea; Dizziness; Fatigue; Gait inability; Pallor; Skin discolouration; Pyrexia; Vomiting; This case was received via Regulatory Authority on 15-Jun-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 15-Jun-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by an other health care professional and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (Syncope), DIARRHOEA (Diarrhoea), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), FATIGUE (Fatigue), GAIT INABILITY (Gait inability), PALLOR (Pallor), SKIN DISCOLOURATION (Skin discolouration), PYREXIA (Pyrexia) and VOMITING (Vomiting) in a 36-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 006c21a) for COVID-19 vaccination. No medical history reported by the reporter. Concomitant products included MOMETASONE FUROATE (FLONASE [MOMETASONE FUROATE]) and FEXOFENADINE HYDROCHLORIDE (ALLEGRA) for an unknown indication. On 18-May-2021, the patient received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 19-May-2021, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (Syncope) (seriousness criteria medically significant and congenital anomaly), DIARRHOEA (Diarrhoea) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly), DIZZINESS (Dizziness) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly), FATIGUE (Fatigue) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly), GAIT INABILITY (Gait inability) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly), PALLOR (Pallor) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly), SKIN DISCOLOURATION (Skin discolouration) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly), PYREXIA (Pyrexia) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly) and VOMITING (Vomiting) (seriousness criterion congenital anomaly). At the time of the report, SYNCOPE (Syncope), DIARRHOEA (Diarrhoea), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), FATIGUE (Fatigue), GAIT INABILITY (Gait inability), PALLOR (Pallor), SKIN DISCOLOURATION (Skin discolouration), PYREXIA (Pyrexia) and VOMITING (Vomiting) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Body temperature: 103.2 (High) 103.2. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No treatment was reported. Action taken with the mRNA-1273 in response to the event is not applicable. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
36 2021-07-07 vertigo, dizziness After I was vaccinated, I didn't have any initial symptoms and then about thirty minutes after my ri... Read more
Close
After I was vaccinated, I didn't have any initial symptoms and then about thirty minutes after my right shoulder was throbbing and I felt very dizzy. An EMT that was at the vaccination site checked my BP and pulse and monitored me and suggested I go home and rest. She said not to take Tylenol unless I absolutely needed it. When I got home I felt absolutely tired and exhausted. By 6:00PM I was developing a low grade fever. I went to the ER at 5/29/2021 at 7:00PM. My temp was 101.5 so I went and got checked out at the ER. The diagnosis was elevated procalcitonin and they ordered a number of labs as well. They also said it was a post vaccination reaction. They gave me about a 1,000 MG of Tylenol and a liter of fluids. I was at the ER for about 3 hours. I also had swelling and rash around the injection site, a raised rash which almost looked like a burn to me it was about 3 inches. I felt tired and weak for about a week to so following this. Another thing that started was vertigo and migraines, but I was suspected of having Covid twice so DRs do not know and it is hard to sat what that is in regards to. I may have had Covid in March 2020 and Feb 2021, I was unable to get tested but the first time it lasted about 6 weeks and the second time was more mild.

AE: Adhesive capsulitis. Treated by stretching, NSAIDs, topical pain relievers. Time course: started out in "freezing" stage from January through March. Entered "frozen" stage in late March to June. Entered "thawing" stage in June and continues to this day.

Patient received the Moderna Covid Vaccine at 1700. By 1725, patient complained of tingling in his RUE, posterior neck, and frontal head. He also reported lightheaded and dizzy. VS were WNL. Rapid Response Team ( RRT) called 1804. RRT arrived at 1808. PO Benadryl 25mg given and symptoms began subsiding. The patient no longer felt lightheaded or dizzy. Dr. visited the patient at 1810. No new orders. Patient left at 1830.

37 2021-01-12 dizziness Patient received the Covid vaccine on 1/12/2021 at 11:18 am. He felt light headed a minute or two po... Read more
Close
Patient received the Covid vaccine on 1/12/2021 at 11:18 am. He felt light headed a minute or two post vaccination. He then lost consciousness for about <30 seconds. The staff eased him down the floor from the chair he was sitting on. He regained consciousness at 11:21am. He was diaphoretic and very pale. BP was 128/73 and HR was 46. Patient was given O2 at 2L/min and Gatorade which he tolerated well. At 11:26 am BP was 121/75, HR 53, O2 Sats at 99%, and RR 16. At 11:40am, patient stated he felt well and at this time, his color had returned. Patient stated he has a history of fainting with blood draw in 2003 but no issues with vaccines in the past. Also stated his HR usually runs in the 50's range.

Close
12/29/2020 Vaccination. Within minutes blurry vision, dizzy, tx to stretcher. EXTREME HA, coughing, sensitivity to light. EPI pen in ER. I fell asleep. Woke up, don't remember much. Admitted to hospital. Chest pains started within 2 hours, SOB, HA. Admitted for 2 nights, 3 days. Discharged home. Still having SOB and referred to Pulmonologist. Waiting on appt. *did NOT have problems before this vaccine. I was fine. Now i am completely different person, I have to monitor my walking, etc.
37 2021-01-17 gait disturbance Took shot on December 30th, 2020. January 3rd night I went to bed with bumps on the back of my head ... Read more
Close
Took shot on December 30th, 2020. January 3rd night I went to bed with bumps on the back of my head and itching pretty bad. I woke up sometime during the night and realized my top lip was swollen. When I got up the next morning my head was still itching and my top lip was still swollen. Monday, January 4th, 2021, I began having? Dime sized? Rep spots come up on my body all over that itched pretty bad. January 7th, my injection site turned really red and began to swell. I called my primary care physician and he immediately put me on some meds, both prescription and otc. The symptoms subsided January 9th. January 10th, I began to notice red spots began to appear again and itch. I continued the meds prescribed and thought it would go away, it did not and a few more appeared. Thursday, January 14, my left hand between my thumb and pointer finger began to hurt and turn red. A few hours later the same thing began happening to my right hand. They both began to swell, itch, and turn hot. This lasted all Thursday night and part of Friday morning, and then the swelling, and itching, began moving into both wrist and forearms. Both wrist and forearms turned red and were swollen mid way up the arm. The swelling subsided Saturday night, January 16th. The morning of Sunday, January 17th, my right foot became very tender and painful to walk. I removed my sock and had a considerable red rash on the inside and bottom of my arch that was hot to the touch and itching. A few hours later, a rash developed on the left side of my left foot, but not as painful or large. During this whole time, I have continued to have rashes and bumps appear all over my body, with them coming and going, usually lasting about 2 days.

37 2021-01-21 gait disturbance, dizziness After a night of being up with flu like symptoms, when I got out of bed at 7 am to start my day, I h... Read more
Close
After a night of being up with flu like symptoms, when I got out of bed at 7 am to start my day, I had a precipitous fall in body temperature. At this time, I also had profuse cold sweats, my limbs started getting cold, I could not see or hear and had ?stars? like I was about to pass out. My wife helped me downstairs and after some water and Tylenol, symptoms reversed themselves in about 15 minutes. My body temperature was not recognized by the thermometer and then registered 93.4
37 2021-01-21 mobility decreased Moderna COVID -19 Vaccine EUA Approximately 3 hours after vaccine, shoulder pain began to develop. P... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID -19 Vaccine EUA Approximately 3 hours after vaccine, shoulder pain began to develop. Pain became significant, waking me in the middle of the night. The following day, I was unable to lift the arm I received the injection in no higher than about 80 degrees from my side. Pain increased despite taking OTC NSAIDS. By the second morning after vaccine administration, pain had worsened and right arm cannot be raised more than about 60 degrees without significant pain. Contacted PCP office about 12 hours after injection, they recommended NSAID dosages alternating ibuprofen and tylenol, and icing the shoulder. Pain impacts daily life activities, including caring for small children , lifting items that weigh more than a few pounds by the impacted arm, and significant difficulty reaching any object above the level of the shoulder. I have never previously experienced this kind of reaction to any other upper arm injection or vaccination.

Close
Persistent (> 4 weeks) right shoulder pain and weakness with certain movement of the arm/shoulder as well as a full pain at rest. This is not a report of the typical soreness after a shot. Concern for tendonitis/shoulder injury from the shot itself or a complication thereafter. I have been taking ibuprofen around the clock. The normal soreness after the shot started around 12 hrs. These subsequent pain/weakness issues continued on after that point

37 2021-02-10 dizziness Pt. was at least 15 minutes post receipt of his second dose of Moderna COVID vaccine. He began compl... Read more
Close
Pt. was at least 15 minutes post receipt of his second dose of Moderna COVID vaccine. He began complaining of dizziness and a headache. We monitored him for over an hour and during that time, he continued to c/o dizziness, frontal headache, photophobia, and worsening when opening his eyes are trying to look straight ahead. We had him isolated in a dim room and had air blowing on him as he complained of being hot. His O2 Sat, pulse , and BP all stayed stable and within normal range. Pt. denied sx of swelling around face/neck or difficulty breathing. RR was stable and unlabored at all times. Pt. refused EMS services and after some time, insisted he needed to get up and leave. Our staff and his co-worker assisted him out of the facility and to a vehicle where we was transported off the premises. We were informed later through his supervisor that he got worse after leaving and went to the hospital where he "seized." He is reportedly stable at this time but further information on his condition is unavailable.

37 2021-03-02 dizziness Pt received dose #1 of the Moderna COVID19 vaccine today. Immediately following the injection while ... Read more
Close
Pt received dose #1 of the Moderna COVID19 vaccine today. Immediately following the injection while still sitting in the vaccination station he began to feel very dizzy and started to sweat profusely. Pt did not lose consciousness. Pt was laid down on a cot and recovered within 10-15 minutes. ER care was on site and evaluated the pt. BP 88/56 HR 67. Repeat BP 143/87 HR 100. Pt signed refusal for transport to the hospital. Pt stated this has not happened to him before. Pt was advised to call his PCP and have his 2nd dose scheduled in a medical facility. Pt verbalized understanding.
37 2021-03-04 dizziness After the 15 minute waiting period, I was released. While driving home, I experienced swelling in my... Read more
Close
After the 15 minute waiting period, I was released. While driving home, I experienced swelling in my throat. This persisted and worsened until 5 pm. At 5 pm I had fatigue, muscle pain, and joint pain, as well as dizziness. By 5:30 my condition worsened, and I have a fast heartbeat, significant dizziness, and chills. At 5:40 I contacted my wife to leave work to drive me to the hospital. We arrived at the hospital around 6:15; by 8 pm most symptoms except dizziness had disappeared. By 9 pm the dizziness had abated. It is 10:40 pm and I am still a little dizzy, but able to move and operate fine.
37 2021-03-04 dizziness Patient felt "a little dizzy" after sitting for 15 minutes post vaccination. Pharmacist asked for o... Read more
Close
Patient felt "a little dizzy" after sitting for 15 minutes post vaccination. Pharmacist asked for other possible reactions: tingling, itchy skin, rash, difficulty swallowing or swelling of lips. Patient denied all those reactions stating that he only felt "a little dizzy." He decided that he would sit for 10-15 more minutes to "wait it out." Patient was given water to sip while seated for the extra time. After about 10 minutes he was able to walk without feeling dizzy and reported to the pharmacist that he was well. Pharmacist advised him to log onto the V-Safe site to report his reactions and to review the Moderna EUA.

37 2021-03-11 posture abnormal, dizziness patient received his first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. After receiving in our immunization... Read more
Close
patient received his first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. After receiving in our immunization room, he left the room and then shortly walked over to the pharmacy in-window and told the pharmacy tech that he did not feel well and felt dizzy. Tech had him go sit down in the waiting room and went and got the nurse, who went out to check on patient. Patient was slumped in the waiting room chair with eyes closed and very sweaty. Patient said he wanted water, so staff quickly got him water. After a few sips, patient's head rolled back and he lost consciousness for roughly 10 seconds before waking up startled and confused. Ambulance was already called and when the arrived they triaged the patient for around 15 minutes. After about 15 minutes the patient seemed much better and the paramedics decided it was OK for him to leave and drive himself home.
37 2021-03-12 dizziness Patient had dark circles under their eyes and did discuss at the drop off window they had a needle p... Read more
Close
Patient had dark circles under their eyes and did discuss at the drop off window they had a needle phobia. Immediately after the immunization, he said he felt lightheaded. I, pharmacist, sat in the booth and talked to him for a couple minutes then asked if he felt he could finish his observation outside the booth. I notified technician to hand him off to her for observation , sharing by observation that the patient did not look well but he said he was doing a little better. He said he felt better and he did wait in the chairs outside the immunization booth. While I was in the pharmacy discussing this information with my pharmacy technician when I heard yelling and I stepped back out of the pharmacy to observe the patient was sliding out of his chair, stiff straight. My other technician came to my assistance and we both tried to get him to the floor and he was making incoherent noises and his arm was bent behind him and not relaxing to where we could get him to the floor. He then came to and startled a bit, with a bewildered look on his face. He asked what happened and said he felt he was dreaming. A witness waiting on her prescriptions for pickup said that it originally appeared he was having a seizure which was my concern as well. We called code white and 911 and store manager assisted us at the scene. Patient denied the ambulance.

Shoulder/neck pain four days after second vaccine. Shoulder joint feels like something is torn, inflamed, or hyper-extended on side of injection. Neck feels like a muscle is pulled, strained, or otherwise tense. Movement was limited initially, similar to sciatica, but regular neck stretches and shoulder massages have increased mobility but not decreased pain.

Wife described a putrid metallic odor coming from my body and had an allergic reaction after kissing me. She experienced numbness and tingling on her face and lips as well as hives on her face and neck that was treated with Benadryl. These symptoms went away after a few hours but she was unable to come in close proximity to me until the next day. Also experienced, soreness around injection site, body aches, fatigue, flushing of face, headache, light headedness. All of these symptoms subsided within approximately 36 hrs. after time of vaccination with plenty of rest.

Took two Advil 1-10-21 at 11am got a headache 1-11-21 around 830pm shoulder and arm finally started feeling less pain 1-13-21 headache around 134. Took Advil 1-14: arm and shoulder still cracking. Got really bad constipation. Forced it out. Hurt like hell. Tore something took 2 senna plus pills 1-15. Morning had thick and super long poop again. Forced it out a lil quicker but tore again or hemorrhoids or both. Took 2 senna pills. Moved my neck wrong way. All muscles are super super tight in my neck. Cracked with shoulder. Now I can?t move my neck to the right 1-16: poop was pretty normal. Came out nice. Still some in rectum wasn?t ready to expel. Had to use badee three or four times and lots of wiping to get clean. 1-18: right arm hurting again about half as bad. Still very painful when I lift etc. Neck is a lot better 1-19: arm still hurts. Can?t lift up without pain. Weak to lift other things pain actually seems to be in my shoulder and cracking a lot. Not in my arm itself. By the nighttime the pain became more intense in my shoulder and very difficult to lift it or move it. Like the first day I got the vaccine. 1-20: shoulder hurts worse than ever. Worst pain ever even if I keep it still has some pain. Horrible. Became worse over the day 1-21: at 330pm had loose bowels. 1-22-21 at 1118am. Loose bowels again after an initial drop of on bowels. 1-23. Normal poops. 2-5-21. Got second dose at 1250am in left arm this time instead of right. At 215pm still fine. But as I got up slight headache. Arm not hurting yet 247pm started having some pain just at injection site. Later at night around 9 or so I got really tired also felt slightly nauseous 2-6-21 at 1207pm. Arm is sore but bearable. Can move it fine. Doable. At 1221pm felt nauseous. Sick to my stomach. 130pm or so was able to eat Mac n cheese. Had raspberries about a half hour earlier to settle my tummy 2/7 at 122am: laying in bed. Got a bad headache since I got up. Arm pain is minor. So long as I don?t touch it it?s fine. I am tired. Worn out. Congested. Left arm and shoulder starting hurting around 2-15? Once I started working out. Hurt like hell. 800mg Advil helped some but still hurt. 2-26: shoulder left still hurts and tight. Did not take Advil. Tried to stretch it. Feels a little better at 9pm 2-28-21: slight nausea Again. Still sore arm on and off. Dried out. Tired. Drinking tons of water 3-3. Last day I worked out and did cardio. 3-5. Left arm still hurts a bit at injection site.

37 2021-03-31 dizziness Patient noted he had no adverse reactions with his first dose of the Covid vaccine or other vaccines... Read more
Close
Patient noted he had no adverse reactions with his first dose of the Covid vaccine or other vaccines he has had in the past. He was informed that there are more chances of side effects experienced with the second dose ( such as headaches, flu like symptoms, nausea). He was directed to stay in the store for at least 15 minutes and to inform the pharmacy immediately if he felt anything out of the ordinary. He said he walked down several aisles then started feeling light headed and having tunnel vision. He was on his way back to the pharmacy when he ended up on the ground. He does not remember how he ended up laying on the ground. He said his head did not hurt but does not know if he hit it. When started regaining conscience, his right arm and leg jerked somewhat then calmed down. When he came to, he said he didn't feel dizzy when he tried to sit up. The ambulance was called so he was instructed to remain laying on the floor. The EMT personnel asked him his name, the date, and where he was while he was laying down and after sitting up on the floor. He answered correctly both times. He was then asked to sit down on a chair to take his blood pressure. The EMT personnel were having trouble getting a good reading so he was transported to Hospital.

37 2021-04-14 fall, dizziness Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID vaccine at 1645. At 1650 patient fell face down out of... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Moderna COVID vaccine at 1645. At 1650 patient fell face down out of chair in observation area. Patient was rolled over on side by unknown patient (later identified as a doctor, not affiliated with clinic) and legs raised on chair. Patient was responsive , speaking in full and complete sentences and AAOx3. Patient was confused, did not remember events after falling forward. Patient states that he is lightheaded, nauseous and bilateral tingling in hands. Unknown if patient hit head, no visible injuries or abrasions noted. Patient diaphoretic, lips and face pale. Patient placed on cardiac monitor in sinus bradycardia. BP 100/77, P31, O2 91% RA, R16 . Pupils PERRLA, +weak radial pulse, peripheral pulses thready, lungs clear on auscultation, abdomen soft, non-tender and non-distended. At 1649, patients pulse increased to 82. EMS applied O2 at 4LNC, patient at 100%. 1650 Patient secured in neck collar and transferred to stretcher and transported to medical center by EMS.

Patient reported complaints of palpitations, dizziness, twitching eye. Also reporting acute onset of tingling in arm of vaccine administration at 30 mins post-vaccination. VITALS: HR 68, RR 14, BP 132/84, O2 94% Patient was supervised for 45 mins and given water and gatorade with resolutions of complaints of palpitations and dizziness. No complaints of progression of issues with twitching eye, soft tissue swelling. Patient denied dermatological changes. No loss of range of motion or function of right arm despite reports of tingling sensation. Symptoms of tingling in arm did resolve prior to leaving site.
37 2021-04-15 dizziness The side effects I'm experiencing didn't start until about 2 days later. It started out as pain at ... Read more
Close
The side effects I'm experiencing didn't start until about 2 days later. It started out as pain at the injection site with extremely bad dizziness that has gotten worse each day. On day 4 after the injection I noticed a full pain in my left thumb area. The same side as the injection. I didn't think anything of it but as the hour's and days went by it continued and continues to get worse. The best way I could explain it is it feels like when your hand falls asleep without the pins and needles. Yesterday I ended up having to go to the ER. My issue with my left thumb area started to get much worse. I couldn't hold things in my left hand and started to radiate up my arm. It was the weirdest feeling I can't really explain it other than being slightly numb and very week. I wasn't able to move my hand much at all. They gave me a cat scan but they never called me back to be seen or to give me my results. I was there for 8 hours and was never called back to be seen. I had to leave this morning before I was seen because I didn't have anyone to watch son. Today is 8 days since I received my first covid shot and I still have major fatigue along with dizziness. I will start sweating profusely out of nowhere and then stops. I've had a numb/metallic taste in my mouth for about 4-5 days as well. I feel like I'm in a complete fog and can't shake this feeling. I'm having trouble concentrating and remembering things. I'm drinking lots of water and trying to rest when I can but I'm still feeling terrible with no signs of this getting better. My doctor suggested I report this to you and I'm hoping and praying this goes away. Is there anything I can do or a specialist I could see? Thank you so much in advance.

37 2021-04-21 dizziness Approximately 3- 5 minutes after felt strange mild sensation as if pins and needles was moving throu... Read more
Close
Approximately 3- 5 minutes after felt strange mild sensation as if pins and needles was moving throughout my body from the injection site. I also started to breathe differently. Couldn't tell if my heart rate changed or not. At about 5 minutes, I started to feel light-headed and nauseous as if I just had blood taken or an IV in my, likely a drop in blood pressure. I was reading a book, put it down on my lap as I couldn't focus on reading and considering to get help. At that moment, I passed out, hunched over in my chair staring at the floor. This moment likely lasted for about 1 minute, but felt like 20. I was in a dream like state and at one point had a series of images and/or memories flash by in a sequence. Then, I felt like I was half asleep but couldn't tell what I was staring at but knew that I had to "wake up". Then , I was surrounded by people who helped me up. At this moment I felt very weak and tired and was sweating profusely. My right hand felt very weak. About 10 minutes later, I started feeling better. I was given water which seemed to help. I would have waves of mild nausea come and go that eventually subsided. I also felt random cramping around my stomach/lower chest area and lower right side rib cage area. At about 15 -20 minutes felt confident to walk to the bathroom and throughout the store. Eventually, I felt confident to drive safely home. At the time of writing this (approx 2 hours later), I'm feeling random sensations/feelings of itchyness throughout my body. No sign of hives.

Close
Patient received his vaccination then sat in the waiting area for his post-vaccination waiting period with his son. Within the next ten minutes became dizzy then fell out of the chair onto the floor where he struck his nose and eye area on the floor. Patient lost consciousness for about 30 seconds then woke up. Patient had profuse bleeding from the nose and dizziness for 15 minutes. We had patient sit on the floor and press towels to his head to stop the bleeding. We gave an instant cold pack to patient. We called 911 and requested medical assistance due to the amount of bleeding that patient was experiencing. EMS arrived and took charge of the scene. EMS providers attempted to help the patient to his feet and he fell again. EMS decided to transport the patient to the hospital for further evaluation.

37 2021-05-27 dizziness Loss of consciousness; Dizziness; Hyperhidrosis; Hypoaesthesia; Pallor; This case was received FDA V... Read more
Close
Loss of consciousness; Dizziness; Hyperhidrosis; Hypoaesthesia; Pallor; This case was received FDA VAERS (Reference number: 1086426) on 18-May-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 18-May-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by an other health care professional and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Loss of consciousness) in a 37-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 immunisation. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Eczema. Concurrent medical conditions included Skin infection (Infection on mid to lower back, possible eczema per patient). Concomitant products included TRIAMCINOLONE for Eczema, CEPHALEXIN [CEFALEXIN] for Skin infection. On 09-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 09-Mar-2021, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Loss of consciousness) (seriousness criterion medically significant), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), HYPERHIDROSIS (Hyperhidrosis), HYPOAESTHESIA (Hypoaesthesia) and PALLOR (Pallor). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Loss of consciousness), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), HYPERHIDROSIS (Hyperhidrosis), HYPOAESTHESIA (Hypoaesthesia) and PALLOR (Pallor) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 09-Mar-2021, Oxygen saturation: 99 (normal) 99. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. The reporter states that the patient received shot and then blacked out a minute or two later. The reporter called 911, and while on the phone the patient regained consciousness and felt much better. EMS checked him out and all of his vitals were normal and he could walk upright just fine. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded, although the events may be associated with the act of being injected rather than with the vaccine itself.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded, although the events may be associated with the act of being injected rather than with the vaccine itself

37 2021-06-24 dizziness Two days after getting the first dose of the vaccine I began to get headaches and sharp pains in my ... Read more
Close
Two days after getting the first dose of the vaccine I began to get headaches and sharp pains in my head that would come and go. My lymph nodes behind the back of my head were also sore. I was also very lightheaded and dizzy anytime I would bend over or when I would exercise. Unfortunately it has been over two months now and I am still having these issues almost daily. The sharp pains come and go throughout the day and usual occur in the temple area and one side at a time, and sometimes in the back of the head. The soreness in the lymph nodes behind my head varies day-to-day, and I still have some light-headedness that also varies depending on the day. I had no prior history of any of these conditions.

I?m a healthcare provider and received the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine in January. For the past 7 months, if I do any sort of physical activity or get excited, I get a very debilitating brain fog and headache. It?s adversely effecting my work and can be dangerous at times. I?ve had to pull my car off the road on several occasions because the symptoms were so severe. I?m learning how to cope with the triggers but has definitely decreased my quality of life. I?m unable to exercise and have to be very careful when doing household chores.

38 2021-01-08 dizziness Received Moderna vaccine 1/6/21 at 9:10 am. Felt fine until approximately 4:00 pm when he noticed h... Read more
Close
Received Moderna vaccine 1/6/21 at 9:10 am. Felt fine until approximately 4:00 pm when he noticed his left arm was very sore. At approximately 9:30 pm, the patient became cold with shivering. Temp fluctuated during night between 99 - 103.8. During the night, he experienced nausea and vomiting, dizziness, body aches, and a weird taste in mouth. On 1/7/21, patient still complained of fever, headache, nausea, and the new symptom of diarrhea. His neck was now very sore, with pain moving it right or left. On 1/8/21, slight improvement of symptoms. On 1/8/21 at 7:00 pm, he noticed a very itchy, red raised rash on torso, arms and legs. He called his physician and was called in a prescription for steroids. The pharmacy was closed and he picked the steroids up on the morning of 1/9/21. He took the steroids on 1/9/21 and has noticed major improvements. Rash still present, but not itching. Temp currently 99.1, but all other symptoms improved.

38 2021-01-12 dizziness Nausea, lightheadedness, and finally numbness to right side of face, slight drooping on right corner... Read more
Close
Nausea, lightheadedness, and finally numbness to right side of face, slight drooping on right corner of mouth and right side of bottom lip. It began with a tingling feeling in lip. Observing staff did not notice any swelling, or other impairments, asked me if I had anxiety, and sent me on my way. Shortly after, it felt as if I had gotten a shot at the dentist, and had the tingling numbness left over on the right side of my face. About 4 hours later, my bottom lip and right side of my mouth drooped slightly, but I could still smile, talk, raise my arm, so there was no other impairment. By the next day the numbness had mostly subsided, and the nausea and lightheadedness was gone. This vaccine was given to me at a work clinic in the administration building. I do not have contact information for them but was provided a packet with this website. I don't have any pre-existing conditions, do not have anxiety, am not a hypochondriac, did not even know about the Bell's Palsy issues in trials until after I felt numbness, and the right side of my face felt as if it fell asleep, like a foot falling asleep but it was my face. It was not to the extent of Bell's palsy, and may have even been my bottom lip swelling slightly on the right side that caused the droop. It infuriates me that this side effect was dismissed as me having anxiety because I was nervous that my face was going numb which would be a natural reaction for anyone.
38 2021-01-12 dizziness Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Nausea, lightheadedness, numbness to right side of face, slight droop o... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Nausea, lightheadedness, numbness to right side of face, slight droop of right side of bottom lip/mouth. The right side of my bottom lip started tingling about 15-20 minutes after receiving the vaccine. I had no swelling or other impairment at the time and was released after 40 minutes of observation. A little later the entire right side of my face felt as if it had fallen asleep, approximately 1 hour later and it worsened until about 4 hours later. By the next day the nausea and lightheadedness was gone, and the tingling/numbness to the right side of my face was gone within 48 hours, improving after 24 hours.

38 2021-01-27 mobility decreased Lower Back Spasms just a few hours after vacine was administered. I went to bed with what I thought... Read more
Close
Lower Back Spasms just a few hours after vacine was administered. I went to bed with what I thought was just flu like syptoms like achy muscles. But this was more then that. Even laying in bed my back would spasm and almost take my breath away. That night did not sleep due to the sporadic unpredictable pain when laying in bed. Describe pain as electic shock or stabbing pain that takes your breath away it's so intense, but then goes away very quickly. The next couple of days I was forced to stay immobile due to the pain that was sporadic in nature. Even when laying down it spasmed. I could barely walk for a few days. I started taking NSAIDS to help with the pain and I became more mobile after a few days. Work has been very difficult and spasms have not gone away even now Im still having problems and am struggling making it through the work day. I have to lay down flat on my back as soon as I get home from work and take ibuprofen to relieve the pain. I was absolutely fine healthy and very active person prior to the vaccine. Just hours after getting vaccine it's almost like my joints and back were inflamed for some reason.
38 2021-01-27 movement disorder Pt was vaccinated at 10 am on 1/25/21 He stated that at 3:00 am on 1/26/21 he began having severe ch... Read more
Close
Pt was vaccinated at 10 am on 1/25/21 He stated that at 3:00 am on 1/26/21 he began having severe chills trouble moving and extreme thirst. He started to experience tachycardia and was diaphoretic. He stated that at 8 am 1/26 he had tingling in his lips and they began to swell. He stated taking 50 mg of diphenhydramine orally at this time. He had swelling and tingling of his face, eyes and tongue shortly after the oral diphenhydramine. He called an ambulance and was taken to the ER. At the ER he was given IV diphenhydramine and kept 2 hours for observation. He was also given oral steroids. He was sent home 1/26 with prescription oral steroids. He stated he has continues to experience tachycardia with average HR at 110. He also continues to experience night sweats but stated this symptom is improving.

38 2021-02-11 mobility decreased Patient received Moderna dose 2 on 02/09/21 10:00, noticed that the LCP who administered the vaccine... Read more
Close
Patient received Moderna dose 2 on 02/09/21 10:00, noticed that the LCP who administered the vaccine failed to identify landmarks to properly administer IM injection, injected high in the deltoid I received Moderna dose 2 on 02/09/21 and noticed that the LCP who injected me improperly landmarked the injection site. Note from the attached photo that I was injected high in the deltoid, approximately 1 cm below the acromion process. I'm now approaching 72 hours post vaccination and am still experiencing achiness in my upper left arm and limited ROM. No fever, swelling, redness, bruising or allergic reaction. I have been taking Tylenol 500 mg 2 tabs PRN, which has helped with the pain at night. approximately 1 cm below the acromion process. Patient noted gradually increasing achiness and feeling of heaviness in left arm 4-8 hours post vaccine, was unable to sleep due to pain. On 02/10/21, patient took Tylenol 500 mg 2 tab at 05:00 and 14:00, still had difficulty raising arm. On 02/11/21, patient woke up at 02:00 with 7/10 pain in left shoulder, took Tylenol and was able to fall asleep. Patient went to work but was unable to raise left arm no more than 30 degrees from body and continued to complain of achiness. On 02/12/21, patient woke up at 04:30 with 7/10 pain in left shoulder and took Tylenol 500 mg 2 tab. At 06:20, pain is 0/10 and patient is able to raise arm 90 degrees from body but notes stiffness and heaviness. Patient sent message to primary care provider to determine possible shoulder injury related to vaccine administration (SIRVA), awaiting MD response.

38 2021-02-14 dizziness Subjective; Patient is a 38 yo male who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for his second dose ... Read more
Close
Subjective; Patient is a 38 yo male who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for his second dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. He was given the Moderna vaccination in the right deltoid muscle. During his 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience lightheadedness and diaphoresis, chest tightness that is reproducible by provider with palpation. He denied difficulty breathing, wheezing, throat tightness and dizziness. This provider was notified of patient reaction and he was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to blood pressure abnormality , rapid progression of symptoms, respiratory distress and vomiting. During monitoring, patient complains of shortness of breath and chest tightness. SpO2 100% room air, blood pressure elevated at 152/104 at 0840, 147/112 at 0900. Patient is alert and oriented. O2 per NC placed at 0900, SpO2 at 100%. Patient was able to eat and drink during monitoring. Blood glucose is 107. BP at 0910 150/93. He is not on any prescribed medications. He denies past medical history. Patient to go to ER for further evaluation of chest pain. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient complains of chills, chest tightness and shortness of breath Pain behind both eyes: Pt once in bed, reported worsening chest tightness/sob. stabilized symptoms during his stay.: Nausea: lightheadedness: Previous Reactions: First dose of Moderna with headache, nausea, fatigue x 2 days. Objective Vitals Vitals: 02/09/21 0830 02/09/21 0842 BP: (!) 164/85 (!) 152/104 Pulse: 73 72 Temp: 98.8 °F (37.1 °C) SpO2: 100% Blood Sugar 107 collected at 0838 Physical Exam Eyes: Extraocular Movements: Extraocular movements intact. Pupils: Pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm. Pulses: Normal pulses. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. Comments: Hyperventilating at times. Chest: Chest wall: Tenderness present. Abdominal: Comments: Periods of belching Musculoskeletal: Right lower leg: No edema. Left lower leg: No edema. Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: He is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Gait: Gait normal. Psychiatric: Mood and Affect: Mood is anxious. Speech: Speech normal. Thought Content: Thought content normal. Cognition and Memory: Cognition normal. Judgment: Judgment normal. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: water, snacks and Pepcid, Tylenol Follow up response to treatment: good. Patient discharge: Transported to ED by ambulance. Differential Diagnosis: Vaccine-Related Anxiety (include misc mental health) and Red flag symptoms (CP, SOB, NVD, Visual/Neuro concerns) Patient transported to ED. ER notified of patient's coming.

Close
Patient reports approx. 5-10 min after receiving first dose of COVID vaccine, he became hypotensive (98/60), dizzy, diaphoretic and near syncope. States he was monitored by EMT for a short time after this happened, did not need to use his EpiPen, but did take Benadryl. Reports that after 5-10 min his symptoms improved/resolved, and he has felt fine since. States he is feeling great today. He was advised by PCP NOT to get the second dose of the vaccine, and if he would like a second opinion, will need to be referred to an allergist. Patient declined referral, leaning towards not getting the second dose.

Patient received her Covid19 Vaccine and had and began to feel lightheaded approximately 5 minutes after vaccine administration. Paramedic assisted the patient to the bed where the patient sat down. Vital and patient history was obtained. Paramedic contacted Dr. and was instructed to monitor the patient for any changes in patient condition. The patient was continuously monitored and stated that she began to feel much better. Paramedic obtained three sets of vitals which were all within normal limits. The patient relayed that she was no longer feeling her symptoms. The patient was walked to the front door. BP 187/121 HR 98 RR18 / BP 84/112 HR 100 RR18 / BP 168/109 HR 87 RR 16

Close
Pt received dose #1 of the Moderna COVID19 vaccine. Within minutes of sitting down in observation the pt began to feel light headed and very sweaty. Pt was laid down on a cot, BP was 110/80, HR 77, O2sat 98%. EMS on site and performed evaluation. Pt recovered within 10 minutes. Pt did not lose consciousness. Pt stated this happened to him before when he had lidocaine at the dentist. Pt signed refusal for transport to the hospital. Pt was advised to contact his PCP to discuss what happened and to arrange to have his second dose in a medical facility. Pt verbalized understanding.

Pt states that he got his 2nd COVID shot on 25Feb and had fever/chills/cough/congestion over the weekend then PM 28Feb visualized a swollen uvula that goes almost all the way down to his tongue. Called nurse line at clinic 2Mar AM, current pain 8/10 with ongoing drainage to his throat, congestion, right ear congestion. Pt also reported coughing up dark blood, unsure of whether it's coming from throat. He tried nyquil and tylenol without relief of symptoms. Reported some dizziness, trouble swallowing and having to spit out saliva, inability to drink liquids. Referred to ER. followed up with Pt 3Mar AM, Pt states he was given steroids, benadryl and a numbing spray for his throat and that the swelling to his uvula has gone down, symptoms are resolving. Was told by ER that he possibly contracted COVID prior to his 2nd shot.

I had a MVA on December 19 2000. After physical therapy the pain in my neck was down to a 1. Then after the 2nd dose of moderna about 15 hours after injection I woke up Sunday morning (the next day) and I could barely get out of bed from the pain in my neck. I went to the PA on Monday and got checked out. I still had strength but mobility was very little. I still have the pain and radiation down arm.
38 2021-03-15 dizziness Patient received vaccine and then went to sit in designated chair for the 15 minute wait. As he was... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine and then went to sit in designated chair for the 15 minute wait. As he was walking to the chair he stated that he felt faint, hot, sweaty, weak and shaking. Upon arriving to the patient, the patient was hot to touch and had beads of sweat to forehead. Patient was sitting crossed legged on the floor with head down. Asked patient if he wanted 911 called and patient adamantly declined. Patient was alert and oriented. Pharmacy gave patient a water bottle. Had patient lie back with feet up. After a few minutes patient started to feel better. Had patient stand up and sat patient in the chair in waiting room. After going into the exam room for a few minutes to get ready for next patient, I went back into waiting room and patient was sitting on the floor again with legs crossed and head down. Had patient come back to exam room and lie down on exam table with feet up. After approx. 10 more minutes, patient was standing up in hallway and stated that he was feeling better and would walk around the store. Patient left the store without checking back in. Called patient to follow up at end of shift and patient did not answer. Left a message letting the patient know we were checking on him.

No fall or physical harm occurred as the patient was sitting. He regained consciousness within 10-15 seconds, and reported feeling nauseated. Pt. supervised by pharmacy staff, and offered water and crackers as tolerated. Pt. able to leave after resting for about 30 minutes.

Day #6: chest discomfort with sharp pressure - worse with deep inspiration and temporarily relieved with belching/burping. Day #7: continues to have chest discomfort - worsening fatigue and some light headedness when bends over or standing up. EKG c/w acute pericarditis. Started on Colchicine. Day #8: feels much better and discharged from hospital on Colchicine 0.6mg twice a day.

Started with the regular symptoms shaking (like with a fever) nausea. Was on a road trip in a snow storm don?t know if it just was a combination of the nausea and the dizziness of the snow flying towards the windshield. But started to feel like throwing up. Pulled over and passed out, my wife says I was shaking. Came back to and throw up a few times. After that I was just not feeling well and had nausea. Started feeling better later that day.

Patient was unresponsive for approximately 2 minutes and regained consciousness without intervention. EMS was called and attended to patient. Sinus rhythm normal, blood pressure 140/82. I was out for 30-40 seconds then startled awake. I laid in the floor for about 10 minutes and my wife helped me get back to bed. 38 2021-04-03 fall In addition to the (common) side effect of chills and body aches, at around 75 hours after getting t... Read more
Close
In addition to the (common) side effect of chills and body aches, at around 75 hours after getting the shot I developed extreme gas pains and nausea while running, and barely made it home, collapsing on our floor. I then suffered severe diarrhea (which had not been listed as a possible side-effect). It is now five days out, and the diarrhea appears to have abated. But I continue to have lower abdominal bloating and discomfort. (I also have painful swollen lymph nodes under the armpit of injection, as I did after the first dose, for at least a week.) Note: These gastrointestinal symptoms are NOT like those I suffer from with gastric dysmotility, which affects my upper GI tract.

Close
Patient stated that post vaccination on Sunday 4/4/2021, Monday 4/5/2021, and Tuesday 4/6/2021. Patient reported his reaction to clinic staff on Wednesday 04/07/2021 he was experiencing pain going down his arm to his fingers. Patient described it as a sharp burning pain that woke him out of bed for two nights. Patient stated that he also felt pain while trying to move his arm above his shoulder. Hives, rashes, and throat swelling were not noted on the patient. Patient denied difficulty breathing or chest pain. Treatment provided for the patient included using a cold pack for pain relief. Patient reported an improvement in his pain with the use of an ice pack. Patient stated that he would be following up with a physician to report his side effect.

No other symptoms before I went to sleep I woke up at 2 pm, went to toilet my bedroom shower. Was able to pee. But my arm was hurting a lot. Was hard to stand up from bed ans walking I don?t remember finishing to pee , and I lost conscience, I did same as a vasovagal , I woke up about 1 min later. My wife was yelling at me but could not hear her. My tension was vers low. I could not stand up. I was checking and before waking up , I was shaking like an epileptic crise Than he took me more than 10 min to recover. I was chilling. Get cold and hot. I had no energy. Could not move. I was about to call 911. But was getting better It look similar to ans orthostatiques hypotension. I did aboi 3 to 4 in my whole life. But never like this one. It was way stonger. 38 2021-04-08 dizziness Patient was being observed following his vaccination. The patient stated that he started feeling lig... Read more
Close
Patient was being observed following his vaccination. The patient stated that he started feeling lightheaded so he got up to let us know. As he was walking toward us, he had a syncopal episode and started to collapse. We were able to catch the patient prior to him hitting the ground. Patient was pale, diaphoretic and hypotensive. The patient was moved to a cot and place in trendellenburg position. The patient was monitored for approximately 30 minutes with vital signs being checked every 5 minutes. The patient's blood pressure increased and his color improved. After 30 minutes the patient stated that he felt better and he was allowed to leave with his wife.

38 2021-04-14 joint range of motion decreased Shoulder Injury Related to Vaccine Administration (SIRVA). The person administering the vaccine on b... Read more
Close
Shoulder Injury Related to Vaccine Administration (SIRVA). The person administering the vaccine on behalf of CIC Health, whose name I later learned, injected the vaccine too high (roughly level with the acromion process) and far back. Initially there was only a quick burning sensation. The pain started about an hour later, but at that point it was mild and only notable because of the quick onset and slightly different feel from the first dose. Over the next few hours, it intensified and I began to lose the majority of the range of motion in that arm due to excruciating pain. I saw my primary care physician the next morning, he confirmed the positioning of the injection was incorrect. As of writing, ~56 hours after vaccination, the pain and limited range of motion have not yet resolved.

Vasovagal syncope post vaccination, fell from chair in waiting area, vitals stable. Advised to allow EMS to examine, refused.

38 2021-05-03 dizziness On Friday, April 2nd, I received my first dose of the Moderna vaccine. Within minutes, my heart sta... Read more
Close
On Friday, April 2nd, I received my first dose of the Moderna vaccine. Within minutes, my heart started racing and I felt faint. Thereafter, my hands and face got the sensation of tingling. It felt like ice was running through my veins. My heart stopped racing approximately fifteen or so minutes after it began. The tingling sensation in my hands and face ended approximately one hour later. I also noticed a strange taste in my mouth during this same timeframe. Subsequently, I had the sensation of being dizzy and lightheaded. Importantly, I have never reacted to a vaccine in this manner. On Saturday, April 3rd, I woke up with symptoms that were to be expected. My arm was very sore and I felt a little achy. However, I continued to feel dizzy and lightheaded. That evening and for the next week or so, my heart was beating rapidly, and my blood pressure was elevated. I also had the continuous feeling of my skin crawling. My hands and feet also seemed to be experiencing tremors and twitching. On Sunday, April 4th, I woke up and noticed that my right eye seemed a little blurry as I read an article on my phone. I assumed I must have slept on my eye wrong and did not pay it much attention. I do not recall my eye being blurry for the rest of the day. The following morning on Monday, April 5th, I woke up once again feeling dizzy and lightheaded. As I walked to the restroom, I noticed that my right eye was blurry again. This time it seemed to be more pronounced. Moreover, when I closed my right eye, I could see hundreds of dots in different colors. In addition to having blurry vision, my legs felt weak and nearly buckled as I walked. I felt like I was intoxicated. Upon returning to bed, my teeth began chattering and I felt like I was freezing. I called my doctor?s office and spoke with a PA who recommended that I go to the ER. While I checked in at the ER, I could not remember my ZIP code. I felt like my brain was not running on all cylinders. Upon explaining my symptomology to the ER doctor, she recommended that I have my blood drawn and that I get an MRI to rule out a stroke. All test results came back normal. On Wednesday, April 7th, I made an appointment with an allergist. They tested me to see if I was allergic to Polyethylene Glycol (PEG) and Polysorbate 80. For the skin scratch portion of the test, neither of the substances had much of a reaction on my skin. I thought the Polysorbate 80 scratch had a little bit of redness to it, but it was negligible. When the doctor injected Polysorbate 80 under my skin with a syringe, a welt formed. I am not sure why, but PEG was not injected in the same manner. As a result of the test, the allergist confirmed that I am allergic to Polysorbate 80. He mentioned that there may be instances of cross reactivity to PEG for individuals that are allergic to Polysorbate 80. He recommended that I not get the second Moderna dose unless it was administered in a controlled setting. On Sunday April 11th, I noticed what felt like a hard vein in my abdominal fat. It felt slightly tender to the touch. I was fearful that it could be a clot. On Tuesday, April 13th, I woke up and as a I stood in the shower, my foot was painful to stand on. On top of my right foot near my ankle, I could visibly see red inflammation in a vein. I massaged the vein and the redness and pain dissipated. Being fearful that I did have blood clots, I scheduled an appointment with a PA at my doctor?s office that same day. We discussed my ongoing dizziness, lightheadedness, and me being fearful of blood clots. She had an EKG performed at the office and ordered a barrage of blood tests. Everything continued to be normal. On Sunday, April 18th, I again went to the ER, because the hard vein in my stomach became larger and more tender to the touch. When I bent over, it felt like there was a lot of pressure emanating from the hard vein down to my groin. Once again, blood was drawn and everything was normal. I also had an ultrasound performed on the area that felt like a hard vein and the doctor concluded that it was most likely swollen lymph nodes. I was diagnosed with lymphadenopathy. On Monday, April 26th, I scheduled an appointment with my primary care doctor to discuss the ongoing dizziness, lightheadedness, and pain in my stomach and groin area. He told me that he had seen other patients that were experiencing similar symptoms and that my immune system was possibly overreacting to the vaccine. He told me the symptoms should go away in time. He also ordered a new blood test to check for clots. The D-Dimer test came back normal. On Tuesday, April 27th, I experienced a painful genital herpes outbreak. I normally get one every year. I had just recovered from an infection in December of 2020. This outbreak was more intense and for the first time I had nerve pain that wrapped around my hip and down my inner thigh. As of a week later, the infection is almost gone. Today is May 4th, and I am still experiencing dizziness and lightheadedness. Some days are better than others and every time I get optimistic that my dizziness and lightheadedness is finally gone, it reappears. Being an IT consultant business owner and an attorney, I need to think clearly for my profession. The side effects from the Moderna vaccine have made it very difficult to function. I would like to get fully vaccinated, but I am fearful of getting the second shot. I do not want the vaccine to cause permanent neurological damage or worse. Finally, I am sure your organization is aware, but there are many other people experiencing the same symptoms as me.
38 2021-05-03 dizziness 1435: Patient stated he was feeling dizzy and tingly 1437: Blood pressure 142/92 Pulse 86 O2 stat 9... Read more
Close

38 2021-05-05 fall thinks it was a potential seizure; vasovagal effect from the needle; Patient fell off the bench onto... Read more
Close
thinks it was a potential seizure; vasovagal effect from the needle; Patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement; Patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement; This spontaneous case was reported by a pharmacist (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of SEIZURE (thinks it was a potential seizure) and PRESYNCOPE (vasovagal effect from the needle) in a 38-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 007C21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 26-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 26-Apr-2021, the patient experienced SEIZURE (thinks it was a potential seizure) (seriousness criterion medically significant), PRESYNCOPE (vasovagal effect from the needle) (seriousness criterion medically significant), MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement) and FALL (Patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement). At the time of the report, SEIZURE (thinks it was a potential seizure), PRESYNCOPE (vasovagal effect from the needle), MUSCULOSKELETAL STIFFNESS (Patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement) and FALL (Patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement) was resolving. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Concomitant medications taken by the patient were not provided. The reporter reported that patient never had any allergic reactions to vaccines or medications before and had no past medical histories for vasovagal reactions. After receiving the vaccine, the patient waited in the pharmacy for 15 minutes - 20 minutes. The patient fell off the bench onto the floor and became rigid and stiff and exhibited some rigid movement. The patient was out of it for 15-30 seconds. The reporter stated that she called 911. The patient came to, his eyes were huge, but he was aware to self and surroundings. The emergency team came, took the patient's vitals which were stable and stated the patient likely experienced a vasovagal effect from the needle. However, the reporter thinks it was a potential seizure; more than a vasovagal response. Emergency team offered no treatment. The emergency team had encouraged the patient to follow up with a doctor but the patient did not want to make a big scene. Emergency team offered no treatment for the patient. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Moderna Dose 2 adminster 4/30/21. Fever developed within 24 hours, bad flu-like symptoms. Hour 48: Troubling symptoms after fever lifted. Brain fog, headache, chest tightness, light headedness, nausea, low energy. Neurological symptoms felt concussion like. Flu-like symptom resolved very rapidly after 36 hours. Headache persistent. Week 2: Brain-fog, lightheadedness, chest tightness, low energy, low ambition, insomnia. Took 20 hour sick leave. Visited two physicians. BP Normal. Blood work normal. Day 19: Persistent symptoms: Shortness of breath, chest tightness, headache, brain fog, low energy. Day 20: Symptoms persistent w/increasing severity. SYMPTOMS RESOLVED FOLLOWING TREATMENT contact me for details
38 2021-05-23 dizziness started a severe headache with blurry vision, feeling of fainting, chills

Patient was given water and EMT responded. When offered to be assessed by EMT, patient responded that he was feeling better. Close
The morning after receiving the shot, I woke up at roughly 9am with a High fever (100+), headache, and general felt very sick. Upon getting up and going to the bathroom, I fainted which peeing (standing up). Upon waking up on the floor of the bathroom, I got up, was light headed, took 4 steps to the bathroom door, and fainted a second time. Upon waking up the second time, I made it to bed and fell back asleep until 11:30. I took my temperature at 11:30 and found it was 99.9 degrees. I was feeling cooler (less fevered) then I had been at the time of the fainting incident. I called a nurse through my insurance company, who instructed me to go to the ER. I waited 3 hours in the ER waiting room, and then received Fluids, A CT head scan, an ECG 12 lead, and blood work. All normal. I felt better, if banged up, by the time I left the ER. I hit my head and Left shoulder in the fall.

Treated with high dose methylprednisolone x 3days without improvement. 4/22/21 visual evoked potential test second trial showed abnormal pattern on the left MRV, CT, MRI brain no abnormality 4/24/-5/4/21 admitted for L vision loss, severe neck, back pain, weakness, difficulty walking. 38 2021-06-02 dizziness, balance disorder 3 weeks after initial dose (4/23/2021), I started experiencing dizziness and a constant mild headach... Read more
Close
3 weeks after initial dose (4/23/2021), I started experiencing dizziness and a constant mild headache. With the dizziness, there was no visual perception of moving or spinning objects and no proprioception problems. The dizziness is more like a sense of being unsteady and an inability to maintain balance. The feeling has never gone away and persists in any position. On different occasions, many times per hour, there is a sweeping feeling that is never in a persistent direction. On the first day of symptoms, the headache was moderate with a feeling of facial puffiness with an elevated blood pressure near hypertensive crisis levels... which was on a Sunday. The following Wednesday morning, I visited the Emergency room at 0034 EST 5/19/2021 because the dizziness was not getting better. A review of systems was performed with no abnormal results. EKG was normal. Cranial CT scan showed no indications of stroke either although I have not looked at it myself yet. Blood sugar level was at 90. Chem12 test was normal. Well for more details, please contact me. Session is about to time out and I don't know how to extend it on my phone. I have tried vestibular therapy motions. None improved the dizziness. I also have intermittent fog and below normal focus capacity.

Close
On the 2nd dose, I decided to contact the doctor in advance. We cranked up the heater in the house. After getting the 2nd dose, I got sick the same way as the first dose. I was very cold and very weak. Thursday and Friday I'm very sick. I felt fine Saturday and Sunday. On Monday, my right arm swelled up so much that it couldn't handle it's own weight. The pain got really bad and I had to go back to the dr. I get naproxen sodium to take with Tylenol. Thankfully that worked. My arm still didn't work until later that Tuesday evening. I would not have been able to make it to the Dr. if I had to drive myself. The doctor called it Moderna arm and said it was something he has seen a lot of. Here is when I find out that something is not right. My mind starts getting trouble. If we went through the same thing in the winter, my heater would not be able to keep the house warm enough. I hear about the booster and I just know I can't handle it. I am not sure what to do about that.

Joints were stiffening which resulted in surgery; Respiratory reaction-sounded like severe cold/flu; Pain like his arm and legs are being ripped off; sounded like severe cold/flu; Joints were very painful; Muscle ache; Fever of 102 degrees F; Severe migraine like headache; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of JOINT STIFFNESS (Joints were stiffening which resulted in surgery) in a 38-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 13-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient experienced JOINT STIFFNESS (Joints were stiffening which resulted in surgery) (seriousness criterion medically significant), RESPIRATORY DISORDER (Respiratory reaction-sounded like severe cold/flu), PAIN (Pain like his arm and legs are being ripped off), INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (sounded like severe cold/flu), MIGRAINE (Severe migraine like headache), ARTHRALGIA (Joints were very painful), MYALGIA (Muscle ache) and PYREXIA (Fever of 102 degrees F). The patient was treated with Surgery for Joint stiffness. On 20-Mar-2021, MIGRAINE (Severe migraine like headache) had resolved. At the time of the report, JOINT STIFFNESS (Joints were stiffening which resulted in surgery), RESPIRATORY DISORDER (Respiratory reaction-sounded like severe cold/flu), PAIN (Pain like his arm and legs are being ripped off), INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (sounded like severe cold/flu), ARTHRALGIA (Joints were very painful), MYALGIA (Muscle ache) and PYREXIA (Fever of 102 degrees F) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Body temperature: 102 degrees f (High) developed fever. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) was unknown. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. The patient got the first dose of Moderna vaccine on Saturday 13-Mar-2021 in his left arm and was awfully sick for 3 days. He developed fever of 102 degree Fahrenheit, muscle ache and pain like his arm and legs are being ripped off, joints were very painful, also had a respiratory reaction. It sounded like severe cold/flu. He was in the bed for straight 2 days. He returned to work on Wednesday but he had severe migraine like headache until Saturday which was 7 days later. He was very nervous about taking the second shot. He took may be Aleve or Tylenol. He was afraid to lose work and needs to take second shot. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 10-May-2021: Follow up received on 10-May-2021 added new event joint stiffness.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

18 days after 2nd vaccination I started feeling intermittent paresthesias in my feet. These slowly progressed to my lower legs. After about a week I noticed numbness/paresthesias in my fingers and forearms. About a week later it progressed to my face and is now also in my oral cavity (teeth, tongue, and posterior oropharynx). The paresthesias have been accompanied with intermittent mild vertigo, headaches, mild shortness of breath, and palpitations.

Approximately two weeks ago (around 6/27/2021): Sudden onset of pain in the chest, then heart felt like a clenched fist, then heart started racing. Couldn't catch a breath and felt like passing out. I crawled to my neighbors house and told them to call an ambulance as I thought I was having a heart attack. While waiting for ambulance, got extreme chills and sweats. Ambulance came and did EKG which was normal. Gave me the option to go to hospital, but felt better so I declined. Since I have gotten the vaccine, I have consistently struggled with shortness of breath, tachycardia, and lightheadedness, to the point where I feel like I'm going to pass out, or die.

38 2021-07-24 fall Patient received the 1st dose of Moderna vaccine at 5:30PM. Patient was advised to wait for 15 minut... Read more
Close
Patient received the 1st dose of Moderna vaccine at 5:30PM. Patient was advised to wait for 15 minutes and report to the pharmacy team know if there was any unusual reaction. At 5:40PM , patient informed that he was feeling flushy and he fell down immediately on the floor. I instructed my technician to call 911 immediately. He woke up 30 seconds after falling down and I was there to check on him. We observed him and offered a bottle of water. The 911 team arrived and did a few tests: measured blood pressure reading, collected the heart rate reading, performed the EKG and glucose test. After 20 minutes, patient was alert. He was able to provide answers from the 911 team correctly (his address, the city that he was from, the city that he was at, his full name) and informed that he was okay to go home. The 911 advised him to have a few sips of Pedialyte and had a small snack. Patient reported that he had not eaten since the morning and had very few liquid.

Close

The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No medical history information was reported. Concomitant products included QUETIAPINE FUMARATE (SEROQUEL XR) for an unknown indication. On 30-Mar-2021 at 1:00 PM, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 27-Apr-2021 at 3:30 PM, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 06-May-2021, the patient experienced CONDITION AGGRAVATED (Joint pain that got progrrssively worse and spread from condition aggravated) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), ARTHRALGIA (Joint pain that got progrrssively worse and spread) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), MOBILITY DECREASED (could barely move / I could barely get out of bed) and BACK PAIN (pain in the back of knees, every joint in the body). On an unknown date, the patient experienced JOINT SWELLING (ankles were swollen), PERIPHERAL SWELLING (fingers were swollen) and SERUM SICKNESS (had serum sickness from the vaccine). The patient was hospitalized from 26-May-2021 to 27-May-2021 due to CONDITION AGGRAVATED. The patient was treated with IBUPROFEN for Joint pain, at a dose of 600 milligram three times a day and PREDNISOLONE (PREDNISOL [PREDNISOLONE]) for Pain, at a dose of 1 UNK. On 01-Jun-2021, CONDITION AGGRAVATED (Joint pain that got progrrssively worse and spread from condition aggravated), ARTHRALGIA (Joint pain that got progrrssively worse and spread), JOINT SWELLING (ankles were swollen), PERIPHERAL SWELLING (fingers were swollen), SERUM SICKNESS (had serum sickness from the vaccine) and MOBILITY DECREASED (could barely move / I could barely get out of bed) had resolved. At the time of the report, BACK PAIN (pain in the back of knees, every joint in the body) had resolved. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter considered CONDITION AGGRAVATED (Joint pain that got progrrssively worse and spread from condition aggravated), ARTHRALGIA (Joint pain that got progrrssively worse and spread), JOINT SWELLING (ankles were swollen), PERIPHERAL SWELLING (fingers were swollen), SERUM SICKNESS (had serum sickness from the vaccine) and MOBILITY DECREASED (could barely move / I could barely get out of bed) to be possibly related. No further causality assessment was provided for BACK PAIN (pain in the back of knees, every joint in the body). I started feeling mild pain in the back of my knees around the 6th of May, 2021. After a few days it got progressively worse and every joint in my body was in pain. I was treated with NSAIDs and they helped for a few hours each time I took them. The pain then disappeared around May 20th, but it came back and much more aggressive and painful. I could barely get out of bed; my fingers and ankles were swollen. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
