38 2021-07-29 vertigo, dizziness, mobility decreased, balance disorder Pericarditis; Flu like symptoms; Dizziness like vertigo; Dizziness like vertigo; Balance issues; Blu... Read more
Close
Pericarditis; Flu like symptoms; Dizziness like vertigo; Dizziness like vertigo; Balance issues; Blurry visions; Chest pain; Pain at his back; High blood pressure going crazy; Heart palpitation; Weakness; Car accident not long after the 1st dose; Shortness of breath; Difficulty sleeping; Felt he was getting worse; Difficult to do laundry/Difficult to do clean dishes/Difficult to do make dinner; 1st dose of the Moderna COVID 19 vaccine on 11MAR2021 & 2nd dose on 28MAY2021; Fatigue; Pain belowhis shoulder blade; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of PERICARDITIS (Pericarditis) in a 38-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 11-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 28-May-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient experienced PERICARDITIS (Pericarditis) (seriousness criteria hospitalization and medically significant), INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (Flu like symptoms), DIZZINESS (Dizziness like vertigo), VERTIGO (Dizziness like vertigo), BALANCE DISORDER (Balance issues), VISION BLURRED (Blurry visions), CHEST PAIN (Chest pain), BACK PAIN (Pain at his back), HYPERTENSION (High blood pressure going crazy), PALPITATIONS (Heart palpitation), ASTHENIA (Weakness), ROAD TRAFFIC ACCIDENT (Car accident not long after the 1st dose), DYSPNOEA (Shortness of breath), INSOMNIA (Difficulty sleeping), FEELING ABNORMAL (Felt he was getting worse), MOBILITY DECREASED (Difficult to do laundry/Difficult to do clean dishes/Difficult to do make dinner), INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (1st dose of the Moderna COVID 19 vaccine on 11MAR2021 & 2nd dose on 28MAY2021), FATIGUE (Fatigue) and ARTHRALGIA (Pain belowhis shoulder blade). The patient was hospitalized from 26-Jun-2021 to 27-Jun-2021 due to PERICARDITIS. The patient was treated with IBUPROFEN for Pericarditis, at a dose of 1 dosage form and COLCHICINE at a dose of 0.6 mg. At the time of the report, PERICARDITIS (Pericarditis), INFLUENZA LIKE ILLNESS (Flu like symptoms), DIZZINESS (Dizziness like vertigo), VERTIGO (Dizziness like vertigo), BALANCE DISORDER (Balance issues), VISION BLURRED (Blurry visions), CHEST PAIN (Chest pain), BACK PAIN (Pain at his back), HYPERTENSION (High blood pressure going crazy), PALPITATIONS (Heart palpitation), ASTHENIA (Weakness), ROAD TRAFFIC ACCIDENT (Car accident not long after the 1st dose), DYSPNOEA (Shortness of breath), INSOMNIA (Difficulty sleeping), FEELING ABNORMAL (Felt he was getting worse), MOBILITY DECREASED (Difficult to do laundry/Difficult to do clean dishes/Difficult to do make dinner), FATIGUE (Fatigue) and ARTHRALGIA (Pain belowhis shoulder blade) outcome was unknown and INAPPROPRIATE SCHEDULE OF PRODUCT ADMINISTRATION (1st dose of the Moderna COVID 19 vaccine on 11MAR2021 & 2nd dose on 28MAY2021) had resolved. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Blood pressure measurement: high (High) High. On an unknown date, Heart rate: abnormal (abnormal) Pulse - Abnormal. No concomitant product information was provided. Patient stated that he received his 1st dose of the Moderna COVID 19 vaccine on 11MAR2021 at grocery store and his 2nd dose on 28MAY2021 at supermarket. He did not receive his 2nd dose on the scheduled day because he got into a car accident not long after the 1st dose. He had flu like symptoms after the 2nd dose. Two weeks later, he started having other symptoms. These symptoms include dizziness like vertigo, balance issues, pulse issue related to his heart rate, blurry visions, chest pain, pain at his back, pain below his shoulder blade, high blood pressure going crazy, heart palpitation, shortness of breath, difficulty sleeping, weakness, and fatigue. On 26JUN2021, he went to the ER and was diagnosed with pericarditis. He spent the night in the hospital 26/27JJUN2021 and was discharged with Ibuprofen ON 27JUN2021. While at the hospital they did blood work and EKG to confirm that he was not having a heart attack. A week later he returned to the ER because he was not feeling better. He is not in a good place, he finds it difficult to do laundry, clean dishes or make dinner. He feels off and thinks he is getting worse and no one seems to be taking him serious. He does not have a primary care physician; he goes to a clinic and usually sees any doctor that is available. He is currently taking Ibuprofen and Colchicine 0.6 mg to help with the symptoms. He is still having the symptoms; he will be referred to a cardiologist. He regrets getting the 2nd dose. He gave consent for safety to follow-up with him. Company Comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested. This also report refers to a case of inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered for mRNA-1273 with the associated AEs reported. This case was linked to MOD-2021-266164 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Further information has been requested. This also report refers to a case of inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered for mRNA-1273 with the associated AEs reported.

Patient was observed for ~2 hours after which his symptoms were totally gone and patient was sent home with normal vitals and without complaints of any kind.

MODERNA COVID-19 VACCINE . 12/22 Headache started at 4pm 1.5 hours after receiving vaccine. At 7pm muscle aches started and headache became worse. I took 400mg of Ibuprofen and was asleep by 730. 12/23 Woke up at 5am. I still had the headache was dizzy and nauseous and had all over muscle pains. I stayed in bed as much as possible and took another dose of 400mg Ibuprofen with some lunch. Headache and nausea went away at around 5pm. 12/24 Muscle aches and dizziness continued through the day but less severe. No Ibuprofen. 12/25 No longer dizzy but muscle aches in lower back and upper thighs persisted until I was asleep. 12/26 Some pain in lower back still but not much. 12/23 - 12/27 Pain at injection site. Unable to lift arm above shoulder level until 12/26.

39 2021-02-03 dizziness Approximately 20 minutes after vaccine administered, pt reported feeling flush, heart racing, then d... Read more
Close
Approximately 20 minutes after vaccine administered, pt reported feeling flush, heart racing, then dizzy. Became tachycardic and tachypnic and reported headache. Rapid Response called and patient transported to Emergency Department (ED). Cardiac workup, CT of head done. No acute process found. Given Ativan, fentanyl without improvement. Then given droperidol, Beandryl and Toradol and had complete resolution of headache. Other symptoms resolved. Discharged from ED at 2:22pm 2/1/2021.

Close
Patient reported watching the Nurse swab his shoulder with alcohol ( here shoulder meets the arm). He noted that he feklt the injection going in and muscle felt tense. He waited 15 minutes prior to levaing the area. He reports leaving area on or about 1030hrs. He states he informed spouse his shoulder was little sore but he return to work around 1230hrs. Patient reports as time went on his left arm became more sore that he had started to use his right arm to move his left. Patient reports he left work around 1700hrs, went home then to bed. Discomfort was rated 3-4/10. On or about 2300-2330 pain increased to 7-8/10 and he could not get comfortable. After mid night he went to the Emergency Room. During the evaluation the pain increased to 8-9/10. He was diagnosed with post immunization arthropathy unspecified site and released to home with instructions to use ice. He then notes after returning home he still could not become comfortable (stood in hot shower, sat in hot tub of water).On or about 0330 he states pain increased to 9/10 and then he went to the Emergency Room. Patient was evaluated, MRI was conducted which reveal: Fluid in the subacromial-subdeltoid bursa suggesting a reactive bursitis. He was discharged to home with instructions to f/u with his Primary Care Physician. Patient was seen by his PCP on 20210210 on or about 1445 hrs for revealuaton and treatment. Evaluation revealed increased discomfort with moving of (L) arm. He was plaed in a shoulder sling, a shoulder immobilizer was subsequently ordered; he was placed on Lortab 10, given Diclofenac 75mg and placed on quarters.

39 2021-02-28 gait inability Not able to walk; A spontaneous report was received from a [consumer/physician/nurse/pharmacist/heal... Read more
Close
Not able to walk; A spontaneous report was received from a [consumer/physician/nurse/pharmacist/healthcare facility staff member/regulatory authority report] concerning a [age/gender] patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and became unable to walk/gait disturbance. The patient's medical history was not provided. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included unspecified psychiatric medications. On 19 Jan 2021, approximately two days prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (batch number not provided) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. The patient lost the ability to walk on 21 Jan 2021 and was hospitalized. He was entered into a rehabilitation facility where he was to start treatment with a physical therapist to walk again. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not provided. The outcome of the events fatigue, body aches, loss of taste, chills, and temperature of 99 degrees were not reported. Reporter causality for the events was not provided.; Reporter's Comments: Very limited information regarding this event has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested. Company assessed the event to be unlikely related to company product.

Patient walked over to observation table and complained of nausea and light headedness. He then walked back to his chair . I took his blood pressure at 1313: 165/123 (L), P - 77. , BP @ 1322 - 143/118 (L), P - 82. Patient was given cheese cracker and water after her reported that he hadn't eaten that morning, since he is intermittently fasting. BP was attempted a third time; however, the patient was very agitated therefore the BP couldn't be read. The patient complained of headache and anxiety. Another attempt was made for the third BP @ 1335 - 168/104 (R), O2 - 97%. The patient was encouraged to finish his crackers and have another bottle of water. The final BP at 1350 - 147/104 (R). Patient reported no headache and feeling less anxious. Patient left with cousin and advised to report to PHCP for follow up of blood pressure.
39 2021-03-31 dizziness A spontaneous report (United States) was received from a consumer concerning a 39-year-old male pati... Read more
Close
A spontaneous report (United States) was received from a consumer concerning a 39-year-old male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced metallic taste, eyes burning, dizzy spells, heart rate dropped, sharp stabbing pain abdomen, sharp stabbing pain chest, vaccination site swelling, and vaccination site tenderness. The patient's medical history was not provided. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 27-JAN-2021, the patient received first of two planned dose of Moderna vaccine and after one minute of dose he experienced the event(s) metallic taste, eyes burning, he waited in the nursing area for one hour. While he was driving home, he experienced a dizzy spell for a couple of minutes and then his heart rate dropped to 40 beats per minute coming back to normal after. On 28-JAN-2021, for a period of three to four hours, the patient experienced localized sharp stabbing pain at upper left abdominal and lower chest areas and then it stopped. All side effects have stopped except for swelling and tenderness at vaccine location. No treatment information was provided. No laboratory tests were reported. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome for the events, metallic taste, eyes burning, dizzy spells, heart rate dropped, sharp stabbing pain abdomen, and sharp stabbing pain chest, was resolved on 28-JAN-2021. The outcome of events, vaccination site swelling and vaccination site tenderness, was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

He rested there and drank 2-3 bottles of water. 12:33pm BP - 148/91 HR - 95 Pulse Oximeter - 98% 12:45pm BP - 133/84 HR - 102 Pulse Oximeter - 98% 12:55pm BP 137/92 HR - 98 Pulse oximeter - 99% 1:15pm BP 132/90 HR - 96 Pulse oximeter - 98% He continued to rest in the SWHS Health Office and a family member was called to pick him up. 39 2021-04-09 dizziness Patient received COVID vaccine and was advised to wait 15 minutes. 5 minutes later, the patient's wi... Read more
Close
Patient received COVID vaccine and was advised to wait 15 minutes. 5 minutes later, the patient's wife comes asking for water and stated the patient was feeling dizzy. I approached the patient and asked questions regarding symptoms and he stated he "lost consciousness" for a few seconds and was sweating. I waited with the patient for 10+ minutes and asked if his symptoms were getting better. I made sure he was awake and responsive. The patient stated he was feeling tingly and "amphetamine-like effect." A few minutes later he was pouring the water on his head and decided to lay on the ground. Based on his response, I called 911. After paramedics arrived and checked his condition, his symptoms improved. Based on discussion with paramedics, it looked to be like a panic attack to vaccination.

Vaccine administered at 1157. Patient reported symptoms at 1202 of dizziness, weakness, vision and hearing impairment. Initial blood pressure noted 84/42. Lead nurse made aware regarding patient status. Repeat blood pressure 69/48 at 1202. Patient symptoms continue. Bp 98/55 at 1206. 1208 patient complaining of chest pressure. 1211 EMS notified regarding patient status. Patient continues dizzy and faint but remains responsive to verbal stimuli and responsive to name. Awaiting EMS. At 1255 patient continues to refuse transfer to hospital but states feeling better and symptoms have resolved. Father at patient side. At 1259 BP 112/77 pulse 51 and oxygen 99%. Patient escorted via wheelchair by lead nurse accompanied by father. Patient instructed to call 911 if symptoms return and verbalized understanding.

39 2021-04-16 dizziness I received the vaccine around 11am and did not experience any adverse reactions aside from a sore ar... Read more
Close
I received the vaccine around 11am and did not experience any adverse reactions aside from a sore arm throughout the day. I went to sleep at 10pm and was awakened at 3am with moderate soreness in my arm and I began to feel feverish and woozy. About 2 minutes later I could tell that I was going to faint. The thing I remember was waking up on the floor next to my bed with my wife holding me up. She said that I started making sudden, loud guttural noises and she was afraid that I had been choking. She reached over to touch my arm and my body jerked out of bed and I hit the ground. When I woke up, I realized that I had fainted (I have passed out after a flu shot a couple years ago, but that incident happened about 15 minutes after injection) and my entire body was trembling and sweating profusely. My wife left the bedroom to get me some water and a cold towel. I got myself back into bed and passed out again. The trembling and sweating continued but gradually decreased for about 15 minutes until I felt back to normal. After I had calmed down, I felt no adverse symptoms and fell back asleep and have felt fine since the incident.
39 2021-04-18 vertigo Suicidal idealization; felt bad; tongue swollen; Mental health issues; bad tingling in mouth; Face i... Read more
Close
Suicidal idealization; felt bad; tongue swollen; Mental health issues; bad tingling in mouth; Face is red; mind is spinning; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of SUICIDAL IDEATION (Suicidal idealization) in a 39-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 002B21A and 027A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Generalized anxiety disorder and Gastric bypass in June 2020. Concomitant products included DIAZEPAM, DULOXETINE HYDROCHLORIDE (CYMBALTA) and ALPRAZOLAM (XANAX) for an unknown indication. On 08-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 05-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 05-Apr-2021, the patient experienced SUICIDAL IDEATION (Suicidal idealization) (seriousness criterion medically significant), FEELING ABNORMAL (felt bad), SWOLLEN TONGUE (tongue swollen), MENTAL DISORDER (Mental health issues), PARAESTHESIA ORAL (bad tingling in mouth), ERYTHEMA (Face is red) and VERTIGO (mind is spinning). At the time of the report, SUICIDAL IDEATION (Suicidal idealization), FEELING ABNORMAL (felt bad), SWOLLEN TONGUE (tongue swollen), MENTAL DISORDER (Mental health issues), PARAESTHESIA ORAL (bad tingling in mouth), ERYTHEMA (Face is red) and VERTIGO (mind is spinning) had not resolved. Treatment included benadryl. Patient mentioned he went to urgent care, his covid test was negative, psych evaluation recommended help for side effects only. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the event; therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the event is not applicable. Company Comment - Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to MOD-2021-073680 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
PATIENT FELT DIZZY AND ALMOST FAINTED WITHIN 5 MINUTES OF ADMINISTRATION. HE WAS VERY SWEATY AND AT FIRST HAD SOME ISSUE BREATHING WHICH RESOLVED AFTER A FEW SECONDS
39 2021-04-20 dizziness 1:13 pm-Patient symptoms began with feeling of about to pass out; patient reclined in drivers side... Read more
Close
1:13 pm-Patient symptoms began with feeling of about to pass out; patient reclined in drivers side seat of car. Continual monitoring began, staff applied cool wet cloth. -Patient passed out. Patient sweating, clammy feeling. Patient came to, oriented to place, but groggy. While attempting to get B/P, patient passed out a second time. 1:18pm-Client began with wretching body movement, nurse rolled patient to his right side and he began vomiting. (Patient had McDonald?s burgers just prior to shot, vomit appeared to be the undigested food) Patient woke up after began vomiting. Patient coughing, raised patient slightly to sitting position, coughing frequently, congested sounding. Cool cloth kept on forehead. 1:20- B/P 138/74 HR 76, pulse ox 97% on room air (RA). Client stated he felt like he was passing out again, reclined again and syncope followed, lasting only a few seconds and then was awake. 1:28- Cool cloth kept on forehead, B/P 92/54, bounding pulse, HR 62 pulse ox 92% on RA, monitoring continuously, client continued coughing frequently. 1:33 pt warm, dry. Resting in reclined position. 1:38- patient remains awake and alert B/P 114/66, 98% RA, HR 72, skin warm and dry. Patient talking with wife and nurses. 1:51- B/P 130/78, HR 64, RR 20, 98% RA, coughing decreased, but cough still sounding congested. Bilateral lung sounds clear to auscultation. 1:57- Patient states he feels 85% better than he did a few minutes ago. Cough continues on and off. Client has no current PCP, No history of medical issues. Discussed possibility of aspiration when vomiting during sycopal episode. Advised client to go to urgent care or ER if cough continues, chest pain, difficulty breathing, or fever develops, or experiences another syncopal episode. Patient left for home, with wife driving, at 2:03 pm.

39 2021-04-21 dizziness Persistent dizziness started 2 days after vaccine and has not gone away since, it has been 3 weeks. ... Read more
Close
Persistent dizziness started 2 days after vaccine and has not gone away since, it has been 3 weeks. The dizziness reminds me of getting motion sick or after you found the boat for a very long time but feeling when you get when you're off the boat at first. They have tried taking vitamin c and d they have not helped so far. The dizziness sometimes does get worse when doing certain motions
39 2021-04-24 dizziness, impaired driving ability I began to feel a little dizzy on 03-25. This light lack of equilibrium steadily grew for the next... Read more
Close
I began to feel a little dizzy on 03-25. This light lack of equilibrium steadily grew for the next couple days. I found my limbs had apparently began to lose strength. breathing became difficult as if I could only take 1/4 breaths unless I actively forced myself to inhale deeply. I developed sleep apnea about this time. Driving became difficult. I was walking and driving as if I was drunk. When walking, it felt as if I was on a swaying ship. Driving felt like my workvan was in a constant crosswind that I wanted to correct from. At this point, I stopped driving. That was on 03-25. On 03-26 I suddenly developed up-beat nystagmus in my vision that continues to this day, making me functionally blind. I visited multiple urgent care facilities. Received full panel blood work, urine tests and a MRI. All tests came out completely normal. Doctors are baffled. I was given Valium to help with my eyes and that does help a little. However I'm still unable to see adequately to function without assistance.
39 2021-04-25 dizziness Patient developed dizziness, slight tingling and muscle tension in neck 45 minutes post Covid vaccin... Read more
Close
Patient developed dizziness, slight tingling and muscle tension in neck 45 minutes post Covid vaccination Dose #1 on 3/25/21. States symptoms stayed a day and went away however he felt 'off' for a few days. About 4 days post-vaccination developed tingling/numbness and intermittent lightheadedness with slight difficulty breathing at night when trying to get to sleep. No swelling of face and no hives reported. Able to exercise (weightlifting & biking) without SOB. Became concerned and went to ER on 4/6/21. Per ER report stated that substernal chest pain started one week prior and worsens at night along with BL leg numbness, numbness in hands, L sided facial tingling and muscle tightness that wraps around neck. Denies SOB except when trying to go to sleep. Not sleeping well due to the feeling of not getting enough air when trying to fall asleep. No fever, chills, N/V/D. ACS ruled out: EKG showed no signs of ischemia & troponins WNL. PE ruled unlikely d/t no DOE, sats 99%, HR 71 in ER. Chest pain not reproducible on palpation. Referred for sleep study to evaluate for sleep apnea.

39 2021-04-30 dizziness Patient was given his first modern dose. About 10 minutes after vaccination the patient and his wif... Read more
Close
Patient was given his first modern dose. About 10 minutes after vaccination the patient and his wife alerted me that he was feeling like he was going to pass out. Also reported feelings of ringing in ears, nausea, cold sweats and very pale. I had the patient sit on the ground. I offered him water, but his wife got him a soft drink. He notified us that he had not eaten today. We gave his wife glucose tablets which the patient took 2. He took the 2 glucose tablets while we waited for EMT's to arrive. He had more color in his face after the soft drink and glucose tablets. The EMT's evaluated him and decided to take him to hospital out of caution.
39 2021-05-03 dizziness Patient had pallor and dizziness. He then experienced a syncopal event with subsequent seizure. The ... Read more
Close
Patient had pallor and dizziness. He then experienced a syncopal event with subsequent seizure. The seizure was accompanied by loss of bladder control. Patient rapidly regained consciousness and had minimal post ictal state. He has no history of previous seizure though his mother had a seizure disorder. Patient was sent to the emergency department where he was given IV fluids, and bloodwork was noted to be normal. Was discharged in 1 to 2 hours to home. He states he is doing well this morning.

Close
Patient passed out and became diaphoretic, clammy, pale; fell forward. BP 100/80. Given water and orange juice. Placed in wheelchair. Subsequently fell back in chair and whole body became rigid. 911 called. Cold compresses place around patient's neck. Pt alert and response and taken to Emergency Room.
39 2021-05-04 inability to stand, gait disturbance Extreme pain in heels of both feet within 24hr of vaccine injection. Difficulty walking and standin... Read more
Close
Extreme pain in heels of both feet within 24hr of vaccine injection. Difficulty walking and standing. Constant pain in both feet during daytime and nighttime. Particularly acute pain in morning after sleep. After 1-2 weeks, pain remained in heels of both feet, but also migrated into lower ankles. Swelling was present from the beginning of the episode, but increased over time. Pain and swelling abated 3 weeks after first vaccine dose for about a week. Second vaccine dose occurred 3-29-21 and pain/swelling returned. Pain in heels was still present at this time, but majority of pain migrated to ankles and achilles regions. Swelling increased by week 5 to become obvious Edema. Acupuncture did not help. Stretching did not help. Rest and elevating feet did not help. Magnesium supplement may have helped relieve pain, but I am unsure. Compression sock did not help. Ibuprofen did relieve pain but not swelling. By week 9, no relief from symptoms. Podiatrist x-rayed affected areas and found no structural issues, but was concerned with Edema. Administered steroid dosepack for 6 days. Symptoms immediately abated. No symptoms as of today.

Chills, nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, fatigue, brain fog, blurry vision, poor depth perception and headaches.

39 2021-05-07 dizziness During the 3 weeks after my first vaccination, I experienced all these symptoms repeatedly: Blurred ... Read more
Close
During the 3 weeks after my first vaccination, I experienced all these symptoms repeatedly: Blurred vision Audio hallucinations Visual Hallucinations Extreme paranoia Feeling of lightness and being detached from body For the week leading up to my second vaccination, many of these symptoms started to calm, although I still felt very paranoid and suspicious of the people around me, including my family. After Receiving my second dose, I experienced a second surge of all these symptoms. I will describe them in the next Vaers entry.

Patient received the first Moderna vaccination at Publix pharmacy. He was instructed to remain in the area for 15 minutes for observation but he went to get something to drink with his wife. At checkout he fell and personnel was immediately called for assistance. When I arrived from the pharmacy to check on patient he was alert but clammy and covered in cold sweat. We removed his mask and called the EMS. Patient wanted to sit on the bench so he was escorted. He stated that he was feeling fine but he was very scared of needles which might have caused the incident. The EMTs arrived shortly after and took over the patient care. He was escorted out of the store by EMTs.

39 2021-05-16 dizziness, vertigo Starting around 9:00pm with general malaise that developed into severe nausea and joint pain over ne... Read more
Close
Starting around 9:00pm with general malaise that developed into severe nausea and joint pain over next two hours. Pain was severe enough to bring tears. Began treating with Tylenol 650mg every 4-6hrs, which seemed to help initially. Starting around 11pm, I had severe chills with uncontrollable tremors lasting next 3-4hrs. Could not stop shaking, could not get warm. Intense joint pain continued. Was able to sleep intermittently from 2-3am, but awoke with return of severe nausea and vertigo/dizziness around 3am, accompanied by profuse sweating and hot flashes. I laid on cold tile floor with ice-pack on head/chest until it passed, about 30min, and nearly called for ambulance. Treated nausea by inhaling vapor from rubbing alcohol and taking a dose of zofran dissolving tab, which seemed to help. Able to sleep 4am-9am May 15th and return to normal diet. Malaise continued throughout 15th, but gradually subsided. Rashes in armpits and hot sweats night of 15th. I appear to be mostly normal as of today, May 17th.

Within 5 minutes of receiving the injection, I experienced the following symptoms; Sweats and chills Shortness of breath Nausea Dizziness Volatile blood pressure readings (dropped to 70/40 back to 135/80) Lack of energy The nurse used 4 ice packs to cool me down, gave me tangerines and water. This helped, it took about 20 minutes for everything to normalize and I left the facility.

Got into position to vomit into toilet, and upon getting up, fainted. Spent the rest of the day with high levels of nausea, soreness, and headaches. At the end of the day, with more ibuprophen and pepto bismol, was able to sit up and interact. Food body would accept without nausea was crackers/toast. At end of the night, left shoulder was swollen and red around injection site, radiating out approximately 4in.

After regaining consciousness, I instructed patient to put his head down in between his knees and he said he felt a lot better, Patient waited in the post vaccination area for over 30 minutes and left fine.

Close
Beginning the night of 5/14, the injection date, I began to feels strong aches and mild fever. Through the night the aches became severe enough to prevent sleep and I began to experience intense bouts of chills, followed by fever and profuse sweating. These symptoms continued through the day on Sunday 5/16. On Monday 5/17 I felt the symptoms lessening, and on Tuesday I felt better after a full 7 hours of uninterrupted sleep. Wednesday 5/19 I woke up feeling dizzy and disoriented. My limbs were weak and I was feeling body aches again, though not as sever as after the initial shot. I have a fever of 101.1 degrees F and have reached out to my PCP to give me direction on what to do next.

Close
Mr. Rommel received the second dose of Moderna COVID-19 vaccine on 04/17/2021, notes it was administer very superiorly on shoulder. Pt felt no acute symptoms after administration, but noted severe L shoulder pain three hours post- vaccination. Unable to move his shoulder at that time, and rated pain as 10/10. Felt constant pain greatest at the greater tubercle of the humerus that radiated diffusely down his L arm toward his wrist, with no involvement of the hand. Pt was unable to move his arm and endorsed sleep disturbances due to the severity of the pain. Denies loss of sensation, erythema, ecchymoses.

39 2021-06-15 mobility decreased Severe and erratic heartbeats, heavy slow breathing accompanied with severe fatigue, severe headache... Read more
Close
Severe and erratic heartbeats, heavy slow breathing accompanied with severe fatigue, severe headaches, and severe chills with no energy to move around for a week. After these symptoms eased, no appetite (went from eating five times a day and gym workouts 5 days a week to maybe eating twice a day and unable to walk up 20 stairs without shortness of breathe and heavy erratic heartbeats) still accompanied with little energy, erratic heartbeats, shortness of breath, and lingering headaches well into week three. Admitted myself to the ER on due to lingering affects and a new symptom of swelling/throbbing on the left side of my head; previous mentioned symptoms still there but milder than before. Diagnosis at ER was high blood pressure 150 over 92; never had blood pressure problems prior 1st COVID vaccine dose. Follow-up visit with primary care provider, checked my vitals and high blood pressure remained; primary care provider diagnosed high blood pressure, prescribed Amlodipine 5MG tablets.

39 2021-06-25 dizziness, fall Patient was in the designated waiting area after having received a vaccine. He was seated in a chair... Read more
Close
Patient was in the designated waiting area after having received a vaccine. He was seated in a chair just outside the vaccination room. After about 10 minutes he was observed to suddenly fall to the side of his chair to the floor. The Cashier quickly called to me for help, I quickly ran out to the patient and found him face down on the floor attempting to raise his head and look around, I told him to remain on the floor and we turned him over and kept him lying down on the floor. I asked him what he could see, if it was fuzzy or unclear. He stated that I seemed to look clear to him. He stated that he didn't want to be on the floor and wanted to sit down, so I helped him into the chair and I sat down in a chair directly in front of him. With in a minute he stated that he was beginning to be light headed again. I noted that he was losing his color. I asked him to lay down on the floor again. We got him a pillow for his head and a bottle of water to hydrate him. We also put a cool compress on his forehead. Through questions I asked, again it was determined that he has had no history of any seizures, and had fainted before when it had been too hot. We were able to have him get us his father's phone number and we called him to come to the pharmacy from home. Patient remained on the floor till the father arrived and we asked him a few questions. Father wanted the BP taken, so we did, it was 122/69 Pulse rate was 72. Father wanted to give him a sugar pill because he thought that might increase the blood pressure some. So we gave him one glucose tablet. Patient then expressed that he was ready to try and stand again. We helped him stand up and allowed him to take a few steps and to monitor him. We brought over a powered scooter to have him sit on out to his dad's vehicle. It didn't have enough power so we had my Tech and the Patient's father escort him out to the car with out incident. We asked them to call us if they had any questions. The Father was asked if he was going to take his son to be checked out and he didn't feel it was necessary.
39 2021-07-05 dizziness A FAMILY MEMBER OF PATIENT WITH RX# 7006047-1041, CAME OVER STATING THAT WE GAVE PATIENT A 3RD MODER... Read more
Close
A FAMILY MEMBER OF PATIENT WITH RX# 7006047-1041, CAME OVER STATING THAT WE GAVE PATIENT A 3RD MODERNA SHOT. SHE STATED THE VACCINE CARD ALREADY REFLECTED 2 SHOTS WHICH SHE VERIFIED WITH DOCTOR (THERE WAS ONLY ONE LOT NUMBER) AND WE GAVE HIM A THIRD ONE. PATIENT CAME IN ON 7/1/2021 AS A WALK IN AND REQUESTED HIS SECOND SHOT. PATIENT FILLED CONSENT FORM AND SHOT WAS BILLED AS 2ND SHOT VIA MEDICAID, FL SHOTS WAS VERIFIED AND ONLY SHOWED ONE SHOT, AND WE ASKED PATIENT "IS THIS YOUR FIRST SHOT OR SECOND SHOT?" AS IS OUR STANDARD PROCESS. Family member claims pt had dizziness and fainting resulting in hospitalization.

39 2021-07-27 exercise tolerance decreased In September of 2020 I was diagnosed with partial central retinal vein occlusion. It had gotten bett... Read more
Close
In September of 2020 I was diagnosed with partial central retinal vein occlusion. It had gotten better in January, but after taking the vaccine it got much worse. I went to my routine follow up and the doctors discovered that the vein is clotted and blocked. This has caused me to lose vision in my right eye. Since then I have noticed my exercise has greatly decreased. I normally run 8 minutes 30secounds per mile. Now I am struggling to get to 10 minutes a mile. I now have much more fatigue throughout the day.
